loans.name: Seang Hy's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Seang Hy is 35 years old and a mother of three schoolchildren. To support her family, she grows rice and sells snacks to earn more income. She has been involved this business for ages and earns her about 27,300 KHR per day. 

For Seang Hy, this is her fourth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her family condition so it is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María Cristina originaria de san Martin Jilotepeque, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y venta de atol y tostadas. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita en sus pagos ha sido bien puntual y responsable. Agradece a Fape y kiva por el apoyo que se le ha brindado ya que por medio de ese apoyo ha podido darles estudio a sus dos hijos que están estudiando ya que ella es viuda. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos y concentrado para los mismos luego engordarlos y venderlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en: María Cristina is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque. She raises pigs and sells atol (a cornflour drink) and tostadas. This is the third loan she seeks and her payments have been punctual and responsible. She is thankful to Fape and Kiva for the support that they have provided her as it is through this support she has been able to provide her two children with an education as she is a widow. She seeks a loan to buy pigs and feed for the pigs to fatten and then sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Dúo Alotenango Group

texts.es: Dúo Alotenango está integrado por doña María Lina quien se dedica a la venta de helados y de papas fritas y también posee una pequeña tienda desde hace mas de 5 años, ella solicita su crédito para la compra de utensilios de cocina (ollas, trastes, tasas, vasos, platos, etc.) y otra parte del crédito lo solicita para invertir en compra de frutas e insumos para la venta de helados (papaya, sandia, fresa,  coco, papas, chicharrines etc.).  ya ella desea aprovechar la temporada ya que se acercan los convivios, bodas, y festividades y es donde ella vende todos los utensilios de cocina para regalos y también vende helados y donde aumenta las ventas ya que los niños no van a estudiar y están en su casa  ella desea poder trabajar muy fuerte y poder lograr tener un negocio bien estable y surtido y tener un ahorro para su vejez  ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de ninguno de sus hijos.
texts.en: Doña María Lina is one of the two members of Dúo Alotenango.  She opened a small store 5 years ago and sells prepared food, ice cream and general merchandise.  She is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to stock her business with kitchen utensils (pots, dishes, glasses, etc.) and the rest to buy supplies (potatoes, papayas, watermelons, strawberries, etc.) for making prepared foods and ice cream.  She expects demand for everything she sells to increase at year-end because there will be parties, weddings, etc. Her customers want kitchen utensils, for example, to give as gifts.  The investment will help to ensure her a steady income.  She also wants to save for later so she needn't count on her children for help.

loans.use: to stock her home products sales business.

loans.name: Yeini Yoana

texts.es:
Padre de 2 hijos (Ver Foto) y con un gran deseo verlos convertidos en todos unos profesionales es el motivo que llena de entusiasmo y animo la señora Yeini de 23 años de edad a trabajar incansablemente en su criadero de cerdos y pollos pues aspira que con este humilde empleo brindarles una educación universitaria a todos sus hijos ya que no quiere verlos en un corral realizando estas funciones.

Ya que su deseo es poder brindarles una buena educación a todos sus hijos necesita de una actividad capaz de generar los recursos suficientes para cubrir estos gastos y sin descuidar los gastos primordiales del hogar.

Se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerdos los cuales criara y engordara para su posterior venta. 

Yeini está muy motivada con este gran proyecto ya que sus hijos demuestran buenas actitudes estudiantiles y disposición para triunfar y hacer que sus padres se sientan más que orgulloso de sus hijos
texts.en:
Being the parent of two children (see photo) and having a great desire to see each of them become professionals, fills Yeini, 23 years old, with the spirit and enthusiasm to work tirelessly to raise chickens and pigs. 

She hopes that this humble work will allow her to provide a college education to all of her children, as she doesn’t want to see them in a livestock pen performing such tasks. 

As she wants to give her children a good education she needs to be able to generate enough revenue to cover such costs without cutting into household expenses. 

She will use the loan to buy pigs to raise and fatten for later sale. 

Yeini is very motivated by this project as her children display the habits of good students and the disposition to succeed and make their parents proud.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and fatten for later sale

loans.name: Dúo Neftali Group

texts.es: Dúo Neftali es integrado por doña Guadalupe de 41 años de edad, quien es madre soltera y se dedica  a la venta de comida y refacciones desde hace mas de 11 años y también se dedica a la crianza de pollos y venta de pollos destazados ella solicita su crédito para la compra de concentrado por quintal de engorde y de crecimiento ya que ella los cría y luego los destaza y los vende a una pollería semanalmente y otra parte de su crédito lo invertirá para la compra de panes, jugos, aguas etc. Su meta más corta es poder criar en mayor cantidad sus poyos y poder venderlos a sus vecinos ya que posee mucha demanda  pero no puede satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes porque no cuenta con suficiente efectivo para poder invertir en sus poyos y poder vender por mayor.
texts.en: Guadalupe, 41, is one of two members of Dúo Neftali.  She is a single mother and has had a business making and selling snacks and prepared food for 11 years.  She also raises, butchers and sells chickens.  She is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy bulk supplies of feed and the rest to buy supplies for her foods and snacks business.  Guadalupe's immediate goal is to raise more chickens so that she can sell them to a neighbor who wants to buy more chickens.  The neighbor has customers for the chickens, but lacks the cash to invest in her business and meet exploding demand from her customers.

loans.use: to support her poultry and foods sales businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, tiene 41 años de edad, esta soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside con su madre y sus dos hijos en una aldea del Municipio de Puerto Cortes. Ella trabajó en una maquila por varios años y hace 5 años decidió por tener su propio negocio y estableció una pequeña pulperia donde vende ademas de productos de la canasta basica familiar, vende champu, lociones, adornos y otros. En la pulperia vende azucar, arroz, manteca, huevos, churros, dulces, pan, galletas, productos enlatados y otros abarrotes. Su objetivo es que las ventas aumenten y aumenten sus clientes para tener como ayudar a su familia. Para eso ha solicitado un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras que es su segundo ciclo con la institución y lo invertirá en la compra de refrescos, churros, azúcar, harina, huevos, manteca, frijoles, maíz y variedades para vender.
texts.en:
Margarita is 41 years old, single, and has two children. She lives with her mother and her kids in a village in the municipality of Puerto Cortes. She worked in a factory for many years, but 5 years ago she decided to start her own business. She established a small grocery store where she sells basic food products, as well as shampoo, lotions, decorations and other things. More specifically, she sells sugar, rice, lard, eggs, churros, sweets, bread, crackers, canned goods, and other groceries. 

Her goal is for her sales to grow, and to gain more customers to provide her with a way to support her family. For this reason, she has asked for a loan of 20,000 lempiras ($975 USD), and this is her second loan from the institution. She will invest it in the purchase of drinks, churros, sugar, flour, eggs, lard, beans, maize, and other odds and ends to sell.

loans.use: to buy drinks, churros, sugar, flour, eggs, lard, beans, maize and other odds and ends to sell.

loans.name: Banco Comunal La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL LA ESPERANZA ESTA CONFORMADA POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS CON QUINCE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIAS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER PRODUCTO DE LECHE, QUESO, ESTAS MUJERES SE CONOCEN ENTRES SI, TIENE DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS LAS CUALES MANTIENEN A SU FAMILIA.  EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA PARA BRINDARLES UN FUTURO MEJOR A SUS FAMILIAS, ELLAS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS PERO LUCHA PARA PROPORCIONARLE A SUS HIJOS UN FUTURO MEJOR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES AUDELIA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE FRITANGA EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN NEGOCIO QUE CONSISTEN EN VENDER COMIDA CORRIENTE COMO GALLO PINTO, TACOS, POLLO, CARNE, MADUROS, ENCHILADAS, MANUELITAS, TOSTONES, TAJADAS ETC. ELLA DEDICA  A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DIES HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SU PRODUCTO. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES PARA LA FRITANGA, PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. LA ESPERANZA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Esperanza is composed of nine members. They are single mothers with children 15 children in their care. They are from El Sauce which is located in the northern part of the region. It’s a place characterized by the production of milk and cheese. These women know each other. Each has a different economic activity to support their family. They work hard to give a better future to their families.They could not attend school due to lack of economic resources but work hard for their children to provide them a better future. 

Thanks to her desires to succeed, Audelia is the coordinator of the group. Her economic activity is a home-style Nicaraguan restaurant in a room in her house. She sells typical foods like rice and beans, tacos, chicken, meat, plantains, enchiladas, crepes, tostones, and fried plantains, etc. She works a few hours daily offering her products. The purpose of this loan is investing in working capital to stock her restaurant with foodstuffs. She hopes in the near future to have better sales. 

The La Esperanza Group is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide by investing in low-income people so they can have a dignified job.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her home-style Nicaraguan restaurant

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica al cultivo de arroz bajo riego desde hace 3 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y asi continuar con sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ángel lives in his own house with his life partner.  He has earned a living for three years growing rice under irrigation.  He sells his crops in various markets near his home.

He's requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, pest controls, and herbicide to improve his land (shown in the photograph) and keep growing his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, pest controls, and herbicide to improve his plot of land

loans.name: Nurillo

texts.en:
Nurillo is a repeat client of IMON. He is an honest person and makes his payments on time. Nurillo has more than 15 years experience in the animal husbandry business. He buys cattle, feeds them for a few months, and then sells them in a local market. Nurillo’s wife and children help him to feed the cattle.

Nurillo is going to buy 2 cows now, and in this way he will be able to increase his working capital and maximize his profit. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS (Somoni) to buy 2 cows for increasing his working capital. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows for increasing his working capital

loans.name: Wilmer Adalberto

texts.es: Wilmer de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, se dedica al cultivo de Chile dulce y pepino desde hace 6 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y tiene muchos clientes, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: 30-year-old Wilmer lives in his own house with his family. He has made a living for the past six years by growing sweet chili peppers and cucumbers. He sells his products in the vicinity of the area where he lives and he has many clients. He is requesting a loan so he can buy fertilizers, herbicides, compost, and pesticides, and improve the plot of land shown in the photograph. This will mean he will be able to continue with his work, which generates good profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, compost, and pesticides, and to improve his plot of land

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat was born in 1962. She lives with her family in a village. 

Many local people are busy with animal husbandry and they run their business successfully. Saodat also has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 20 years. She has great experience in this field. Saodat’s husband and son help her with managing the business. 

Saodat is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy coal and wood for winter season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal and wood for the winter season

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is 37 years old and married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. 

She sells ornaments such as necklaces made of beads, wall hangings, and photo frames. She is also a farmer and has been in this business for 14 years. 

She will be using this loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for use on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun is a 46-year-old woman who lives in a remote area of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of five children. 

To make a living, Soeun manages and operates a farming business on rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been involved in this business for twenty years. One average, she is able to make earnings of USD 3.00 per day. 

Soeun wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, Soeun hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. 

Soeun is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

Erlinda has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  

Erlinda is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store business such as shampoo, groceries, etc. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Aura Delia

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA AURA DELIA DE 50 ANOS DE EDAD, MADRES SOLTERA CON  CON HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES TRABAJAN Y SON INDEPENDIENTE ECONÓMICAMENTE.  SE CARACTERIZA POR SER RESPONSABLE, TRABAJADORA, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDIERON CURSAR SUS ESTUDIOS Y SE VIO EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD, PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DE HOGAR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE MERCADERÍA EN GENERAL COMO: ROPA DE NIÑOS, DE ADULTO, BLUSAS, PANTALONES DE VESTIR Y JEANS, COSMÉTICOS, ROPA DE CAMA, TOALLAS, FALDAS, VESTIDOS, ROPA INTERIOR. ELLA DEDICA A SU ACTIVIDAD UNAS OCHOS HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE MERCADERIA VARIADA , Y SATISFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES Y  OBTENER MEJORE INGRESOS EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO. DELIA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Aura Delia is 50 years old, a single woman with grown children who work and are economically independent. She is known for being responsible, hard-working, with the desire to be successful. Sadly because of the lack of economic resources she could finish her education and had to begin working at a young age to help with the household expenses.
Thanks to her desire to succeed she has a business selling general merchandise such as clothing for children and adults such as blouses, dress pants, jeans, cosmetics, pajamas, skirts, dresses, and underwear. She works 8 hours per day offering her products. Her business is located in her home. The loan will be used as working capital to stock her business with a variety of merchandise and meet the demands of her customers, resulting in better income in the near future. Delia is thankful for the Kiva investors’ help that is provided to people of few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a way to work with dignity.

loans.use: clothing for children and adults such as blouses, dress pants, jeans, cosmetics, pajamas, skirts, dresses, and underwear.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

Gloria has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen foods.  Gloria is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of charcoal to sell to customers.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 50 years old and married with one child.

Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell.

Marites has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 33 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Maricel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Maricel has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Maricel aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en el Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Lleva nueve años de dedicarse a su propio negocio vendiendo frutas como mangos, naranjas, sandias, y verduras como patastes, yuca, pepinos, etc. todo de temporada. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante ofreciendo de casa en casa. Ella ha mantenido estable el negocio mediante la inversion de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita otro por 25,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar mas producto como ser mangos, naranjas, mandarinas, bananos, y verduras frescas. Considera que esta inversion le ayudará a incrementar el inventario y aprovechar a vender mas en la temporada para obtener mas ganancias. Su meta es lograr tener el negocio en un solo lugar y poder vivir del negocio y ayudar a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Doña María is 59 years old. She is a single mother, and has 3 children who live with her in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. For nine years, she has had her own business selling fruits like mangos, oranges, watermelons, and vegetables such as patastes, yuca, cucumbers, etc, all in season. She makes her sales as a street vendor, going from house to house. 

She has kept her business stable by investing various loans, and this time is asking for 25,000 Lempiras ($1,200 USD) with which she will buy more products, like mangos, oranges, mandarins, bananas, and fresh vegetables. 

She expects this investment to help her to increase her inventory and take advantage of selling more while these products are in season, improving her earnings. Her goal is to be able to have her business in a store or set location, and to be able to live off her business and help support her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy more products such as mangos, oranges, mandarins, bananas, and fresh vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Amirbek

texts.en: Amirbek is a handsome guy. He was born in 1997, and lives in the northern part of the country. He is a single student, and is in the first year of his studies. He is an exemplary student at the university. His attendance in classes is very good, and his studies are excellent. He is well known among friends and course mates. His parents are workers, and this year they had some problems with paying tuition. Amirbek is asking for financial support to pay his tuition.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
José, ha utilizado los préstamos para mejorar su sastrería, hoy en día cuenta con mayor demanda de sus servicios, la clientela es mayor y el estilo de vida familiar es más digno.
Nuevamente requiere de un préstamo para comprar hilos, telas, botones, zippers y otros materiales de costura, así mantendrá su negocio funcionando y continuara su progreso.
texts.en:
José has used his loans to improve his tailor shop.  Today there is greater demand for his services, he has more customers, and his family's lifestyle is better.

He again needs a loan to buy thread, fabric, buttons, zippers, and other sewing supplies.  That way he'll keep his business in operation and continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, buttons, zippers, and other sewing supplies to keep his business in operation and continue making progress

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Victoria would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Victoria can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Victoria, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jhon William

texts.es:
El señor Jhon es un hombre muy emprendedor y creativo, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de taller y cerrajería.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán sus padres.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar un kit de herramientas y materia prima inicial como hierro y acero con los cuales podrá iniciar este negocio y cumplir su objetivo.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a un hombre lleno de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Jhon is a very entrepreneurial and creative man. He has long wanted to be independent and have his own business, a locksmith shop.

Currently, he is realizing this dream thanks to his great capacity for work, the support he receives from Interactuar, and people wishing him success in his business.

He will support his parents with this business. He applies for financial support to purchase a tool it and materials such as iron and steel with which he can start his business and meet his goal.

With a loan, you’ll be able to support a lively man work hard for his family!

loans.use: to purchase a tool kit and materials for a locksmith's shop

loans.name: Nhóm 3 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thang, pictured first from the right, is 64 years old. She works in the agricultural sector and earns 500,000 VND monthly. She's been a member of the Women's Union since 1990. She is married with grown children. She has been sick for the whole year. Her family is in economic hardship and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a toilet to improve the living conditions for her family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap.

loans.name: Berta Maria

texts.es: La perseverancia es lo que caracteriza a Doña Bertha, a sus 60 años y a pesar de las enfermedades ha logrado salir adelante. Está casada y tiene cinco hijos pero solo uno a su cargo. Tiene nueve años de tener la pulpería que le ha sido de mucha ayuda y a su familia también. Doña Berta para seguir en su negocio y aumentar su inventario solicita un crédito para comprar Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite entre otros. Este crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Perseverance is what characterises Berta. At 60 years of age, and despite illnesses, she has managed to get ahead in life. She is married and has five children, but only one of her children is still in her care. She has had a grocery store for nine years, which has been of great help to her and her family. In order to continue with her business and increase her inventory, Berta is requesting a loan for purchasing rice, beans, sugar, oil, and other supplies. This loan will be very helpful since she will be able to meet demand from her clients.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, and other things

loans.name: Nicolás Ambrosio

texts.es:
Nicolás, de 59 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado, está casado, no tiene hijos y solo vive con su esposa quien es agricultura y poseen una pequeña tienda.

Desde la edad de 12 años inicio a trabajar en la agricultura junto a su padre y sus hermanos y a la edad de 18 años comenzó a trabaja como ayudante de albañilería.- Ahora, es un buen albañil y aparte de eso, ayuda a su esposa en la siembra de maíz, frijol y crianza de ganado. 

El crédito será utilizado para comprar ganado de repasto, el cual cuidarán y engordarán para luego venderlo y obtener ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

El sueño de Nicolás es, tener hijos y a la vez le gustaría estudiar en turno nocturno, para formarse académicamente.- Este año espera poder tener una buena producción de maíz y frijol.
texts.en:
Nicolás, 59, studied up to third grade.  He has no children and lives only with his wife, who's a farmer and has a small store.

He started working in agriculture with his father and siblings when he was 12 years old.  At the age of 18, he started working as an assistant in construction.  Now, in addition to being a good bricklayer, he helps his wife grow corn and beans and raise livestock.

The loan will be used to raise grazing livestock, which they'll take care of and fatten to sell and earn income to cover the household expenses.

Nicolás's dream is to have children.  He also would like to attend night school to get an education.  He hopes to be able to have a good corn and bean crop this year.

loans.use: to buy grazing livestock

loans.name: Telma Yamileth

texts.es:
Telma, de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive con sus padres y una hermana.


Telma, es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde la edad de 15 años ayuda a sus padres en la elaboración de pan.- Sin embargo, para ayudarles con los gastos del hogar,  desde que terminó sus estudios, inicio a trabajar en una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad. Ahora, realiza las dos actividades.


El crédito será invertido para comprar harina, azúcar, levadura y manteca.- Todo esto para la elaboración de pan.

El sueño de Telma es continuar con sus estudios de educación universitaria y seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Telma is 23 years old, a high school graduate, single and has no children. She lives with her parents and a sister.

Telma is a young woman with a great desire to succeed. Since the age of 15 she has been helping her parents make bread.  However to help them with household expenses, since she completed her studies she has started a small general store. Now she does both activities.  The loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, yeast and lard.

Telma's dream is to continue with her university studies and continue working to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, yeast and lard.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Kampong Cham province, Chreb is 34 years old and a mother of one child. 

She can earn income to support her family condition via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn more income. 

For Chreb, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support her farmland. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support her farm land.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nana Group

texts.en:
Sarah (wearing the red dress) is a member of Nana Group. She is 30 years old, a resident of Nansana - Wakiso district, and married with 2 children who both attend school. Sarah also looks after her nephew, the son of her sister who passed away three years ago.

Sarah operates a footwear shop, which is situated at an arcade in Kampala city center. She mainly deals in ladies' and kids' shoes. Sarah started this business in 2003 when she realized that her family’s needs were increasing rapidly, yet her husband’s income was not enough to support the entire family. She basically started the business to assist her husband with paying for some family needs.

She and the group members thank the Kiva lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Kankeletiki Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KANKELETIKI ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à MEDINE l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, des condiments et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KANKELETIKI sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire. SADIO, 1ère femme debout à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 cartons de savon, 1 carton de bonbon, 20Kgs de sucre, 5 boîtes de lait concentré et 1 carton de pile. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of group KANKELETIKI are on average 32 years old with three children. All live in traditional extended families in MEDINE, one of the SAN/SEGOU districts (in the Republic of Mali’s fourth administrative region).

These women met through their families. They trade in clothing, condiments, and miscellaneous products. After repaying their previous loan, group KANKELETIKI’s women are on their second solidarity loan.

SADIO, the woman standing all the way to the left in the photo, intends on using her loan to purchase two boxes of soap, one box of candy, twenty kilos of sugar, five boxes of condensed milk, and one box of batteries. She procures her products from local wholesalers. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and often offers payment plans.

She foresees an average monthly profit of 15,000 XOF, which will be used for expenses relative to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various products (groceries, small household items)

loans.name: Sofia Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento SOFIA está compuesta por nueve integrantes de las cuales siete  son mujeres y dos varones, todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, personas venta de mandiles y lana, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares,  venta de jugo, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios todas ellas se conocen entre sí ya que viven por la misma zona.

La presidenta del Banco es la señora Laura (en la foto es del vestido a cuadros la que sostiene al bebe) es una mujer de 49 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos uno de ocho años y otro un bebe, y su negocio es la venta de electrodomésticos
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, luchadora, fuerte, constante independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona Sur de su ciudad, un área caracterizada por el creciente comercio, con una temperatura que varía de los 27-32 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Laura es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura alta, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el Qhechua debido a que sus padres son de occidente Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que se dedica al transporte y sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor se encuentra a su cuidado. Su negocio es la venta de electrodomésticos como también equipos electrónicos . Ella se encarga de buscar clientes ubicados en oficinas, centros comerciales, puestos de venta, etc., personas que por sus trabajos no tienen tiempo de salir e ir de compras, y les ofrece productos que también da a crédito, es una labor bastante agotadora por las distancias que debe recorrer y el peso que debe cargar. Su sueño es tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer estos productos para vender por mayor y contar con vendedoras que realicen las ventas, su negocio es rentable porque los productos que ofrece son de buenas marcas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en un año que lleva con esta actividad.
Por este motivo solicita el préstamo para la compra de variedad de productos porque estas fechas de fin de año tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en:
The SOFIA community bank has nine members, seven women and two men.  The members operate various businesses: auto upholstery services;  juice sales; cell phone card services; food and drinks sales; etc.  The members know one another and live in the same neighborhood.  
Sra. Laura, 49, is partnered and has two children, an eight-year old and the baby that you see in the photo.  She operates a business selling small appliances.  She is an enterprising woman, hard-working, strong, independent and a great mom.  She operates the business in a growing commercial area in the south of the city.  Temperatures here vary between 27- and 32-degrees, Centigrade during the year.
Laura is dark-skinned, tall and strongly built, with long black hair.  Her first language is Spanish but she knows Quechua, as well, because her parents are from the west of the country.  Her partner is a driver and he and her children are very important to her.  Her oldest child is in school.  
Laura sells small appliances and electronic equipment.  She works from place to place: offices, shopping centers, etc.  She sells on credit.  The work is difficult because her products are heavy and she has to cover a lot of ground.  She would like to open a store of her own one day.
This is the group's first round of funding in the year since they organized.  They are applying for a loan that they will use to buy a variety of products to make the most of year-end demand.

loans.use: to stock her small appliances and electronics business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Elena successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Elena's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nhóm 4 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nam, pictured first from the right, is 60 years old. She works in the agriculture sector and earns 400,000 VND monthly. She is married with grown children. She has been sick for the whole year, and her family is in economic hardship and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will build a toilet to improve the living conditions for her family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1989.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Noeun, 49, is a single lady who lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been involved in a farming business since 1985, growing rice and selling her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 5.00 a day, on average.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her mango plantation. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Sikikadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SIKIKADI ont en moyenne 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à MEDINE l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, des condiments et du poisson.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SIKIKADI sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire. CHATA, 1ère femme debout à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2Kgs de poivre, 25Kgs de Sel, 50Kgs d’oignon, 3 paniers de tomate, 2 paquet de Cube Maggi et 3 boîtes de tomate concentré. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of group SIKIKADI are on average 31 years old with four children. All live in traditional extended families in MEDINE, one of the SAN/SEGOU districts (in the Republic of Mali’s fourth administrative region).

These women met through their families. They trade in clothing, condiments, and fish. After repaying their previous loans on tome, group SIKIKADI women are on their third solidarity loan.

CHATA, the woman all the way to the left in the photo, intends on using her loan to purchase two kilos of black pepper, 25 kilos of salt, 50 kilos of onions, 3 baskets of tomatoes, two boxes of Maggi bouillon, and three boxes of tomato paste. She procures her products from local wholesalers. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and often offers payment plans.

She foresees an average monthly profit of 15,000 XOF, which will be used for expenses relative to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She also has been operating her own fruit and vegetable stand for years and she earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. The couple had to work hard, with the determination of having better income to provide their children with better education, which they don't currently have. 

To improve sales, Arceli would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional fruits and vegetables. At an amount of PHP 10,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of fruits, veggies, and other items needed to expand her inventory. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Arceli hopes that more customers and buyers will patronize her products and she also desires to buy a tricycle unit for additional income. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each fellowship group, composed of 15 to 30 community partners, gathers every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nikanou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe NIKANOU ont en moyenne 52 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, des fruits, des légumes, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe NIKANOU sont à leur 17ème prêt solidaire. FANTA, 1ère femme à droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 rouleau de Bazin, 10 pièces de Wax, 5 pièces d’unit Wax et 10Mètres de tissus léger. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of group NIKANOU are on average 52 years old with three children. All live in traditional extended families in LAFIABOUGOU, one of the SAN/SEGOU districts (in the Republic of Mali’s fourth administrative region).

These women met through their families. They trade in clothing, fruits, vegetables, cereals, and condiments. After repaying their previous loans on tome, group NIKANOU women are on their seventeenth solidarity loan.

FANTA, the woman all the way to the right in the photo, intends on using her loan to purchase one roll of bazin fabric, ten pieces of Wax fabric, five pieces of “unit” Wax fabric, and ten meters of light fabric. She procures her products from local wholesalers. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and often offers payment plans.

She foresees an average monthly profit of 15,000 XOF, which will be used for expenses relative to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Carmen Rosa tiene 62 años de edad tiene 5 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos como quinua con leche, leche, quinua con manazana, entre otros, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de quinua, azúcar, leche entre otros.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de vidriería, artesanía, turismo.

La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

 Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank group called Nuevo Amanecer (a new dawn). This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. 

One member, Carmen Rosa, is 62 years old and has five children. She is separated from her husband and works each day selling breakfast dishes such as quinoa with milk, milk, quinoa with apple, and others. Carmen Rosa has been working in this business for a long time. Things have gone well for her thanks to the dedication that she shows each day. Carmen Rosa hopes to be able to continue working in order to keep supporting her family. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy quinoa, sugar, milk, and other items.

The other group members work selling fruit, glassware, handicrafts, and in the tourism industry. 

The group member who is pictured next to the photo of the other group members obtained permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work obligations. 

These group members are grateful to everyone who has become part of making their dream come through through this loan and they pledge to make the scheduled repayments. 

The person whose face is not shown is not part of this bank group.

loans.use: to buy quinoa, sugar, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Marisol July

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO,la socia Marisol July continua  dedicándose al negocio  de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo productos como arroz,azúcar,leche entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, arroz entre otros para su negocio.
texts.en: Marisol belongs to the communal bank LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO. She continues working  her grocery store business. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make the loan payments. She continues selling products such as rice, sugar, milk and others. She is a responsible and diligent person. She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family. She seeks a loan to buy milk, rice, and other items for her business.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson—who used his previous loan to buy sugar, soap, and paraffin to sell—now deals in farming as his main activity. This has helped him improve his standard of living. Apart from that, he also operates a retail shop and owns a motorcycle-for-transport business. 

Edson hopes that, in the future, he will own a big plantation, though he faces the challenge of bad weather, which affects the produce level. 

Edson intends to use the loan to buy more farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings for the next season.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings for the next season.

loans.name: Blanca Bertha

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
 La señora Blanca tiene 82 años de edad hace muchos años su esposo falleció y quedo sola pero de esa relación tuvo 5 hijos los mismos que ahora ya son mayores de edad. Uno de sus hijos aun vive con ella.
Doña Blanca para obtener para obtener sus ingresos y así salir adelante  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, trabaja dos o tres días por semana y también vende en su casa a los clientes más conocidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, son más de 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que dan en el grupo. Sus sueños son tener salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in the parish of La Sequita, located in the prosperous canton of Montecristi in the province of Manabí. This area is known as the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro, the “Old Warrior”, as well as for its famous straw hats (Panama hats), which are appreciated both inside and outside the country.

Blanca is 82 years old. Her husband died many years ago and she is alone but she had five children from this relationship and now all are adults. One of her children still lives with her.

In order to make a living and thus get ahead Blanca works selling all types of clothing. She sells from door to door. She works two or three days a week and she also sells from her home to customers well known to her. She sells on credit and collects every eight days. She has been doing this for more than eighteen years to earn a livelihood. 

She is going to use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses and clothing for children. She has been a part of the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the support given by the group. Her dreams are to be healthy and to move forward.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and clothing for children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase the necessary materials to make traditional rope from the palm trees and sell it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock like crates of soda, sweets and soap to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Agnes, a 57-year-old youthful mum. She is a very hardworking, honest, and ever smiling mother of two children. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Kapsowar, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Agnes passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past 10 years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding her family requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are milk, crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her parents and family. 

In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. The main challenge that Agnes faces is that her cows stray to her neighbour's compound. This has been causing many losses to her, because she has to compensate for the damages caused by the animals. She is requesting a loan to buy barbed wire. Through the loan she will be able to control her animals, and this will help her a great deal. She will save more money. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL SANTA LUCIA ESTA CONFORMADA POR DIES INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE PADRES Y MADRES RESPONSABLES CON VEINTE HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR DESDE MUY TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DE HOGAR. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DÍA A DÍA PARA BRINDARLE UN FUTURO MEJOR A SUS HIJOS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES MAGDA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE CERDOS EN PIE EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN,  ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS OCHO HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS.  MAGDA TIENE UNA RUTINA DE TRABAJA DESDE MUY TEMPRANO PARA ALIMENTAR ENTREGAR, CUIDAR SU MERCANCÍA, Y DOS VECES A ALA SEMANA ENTREGA  CERDOS PARA DESTACE  A CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTUALES, RECUPERANDO SUS  GANANCIAS DE FORMA SEMANAL, QUINCENAL. EL OBJETIVO DE CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE UN LOTE DE CERDOS EN PIE, Y APROVECHAR LA TEMPORADA PARA LA VENTA Y SATISFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES.  SANTA LUCIA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia community association is composed of ten members: seven women and three men, responsible fathers and mothers who are responsible for twenty children. They are from Sauce, which is located in the Northern part of the region. They are characteristically hard-working, responsible people, who are keen to improve themselves. Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources they were not able to study and they found they had to work from a young age to help with household costs. Currently they strive day after day to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her desire to succeed the coordinator is Magda, who sells live pigs. Her business is located in her house. She dedicates eight hours a day to her business offering her products.  Magda's work routine which starts very early so that she can feed, deliver, and care for her stock. Twice a week she delivers pigs so that she stands out to her fixed and potential clients, recovering her earnings on a weekly or fortnightly basis.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in buying a batch of live pigs, and make the most of the selling season and satisfy her clients' demands. 

The Santa Lucia association is grateful for the support Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce resources and from poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to buy a batch of live pigs and satisfy the demands of her clients.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BALIMAYA ont en moyenne 27 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO II l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits artisanaux, des habits, de la boisson et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BALIMAYA sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire. BINTA,  femme debout au milieu sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 paires de chaussure en cuir, 15 paires de collier artisanal et 10 portes-monnaie. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of group BALIMAYA are on average 27 years old with two children. All live in traditional extended families in SANTORO II, one of the SAN/SEGOU districts (in the Republic of Mali’s fourth administrative region).

These women met through their families. They trade in craft products, clothing, beverages, and miscellaneous products. After repaying their previous loans on tome, group BALIMAYA’s women are on their third solidarity loan.

BINTA, the woman standing in the middle of the photo, intends on using her loan to purchase twenty pairs of leather shoes, fifteen pairs of craft necklaces, and ten wallets. She procures her products from local wholesalers. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and often offers payment plans.

She foresees an average monthly profit of 30,000 XOF, which will be used for expenses relative to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy craft products.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJEKAFO ont en moyenne 46 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à MEDINE l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, du savon, de la patte d’arachide et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. AWA, 1ère femme à droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 seaux de pâte d’arachide et 5 cartons de savon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of group DJEKAFO are on average 46 years old with six children. All live in traditional extended families in MEDINE, one of the SAN/SEGOU districts (in the Republic of Mali’s fourth administrative region).

These women met through their families. They trade in condiments, soap, ground nut paste, and miscellaneous products. After repaying their previous loans on tome, group DJEKAFO’s women are on their fourth solidarity loan.

AWA, the woman all the way to the right in the photo, intends on using her loan to purchase three buckets of ground nut paste and five boxes of soap. She procures her products from local wholesalers. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and often offers payment plans.

She foresees an average monthly profit of 25,000 XOF, which will be used for expenses relative to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy soap and ground nut paste.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 66 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for ten years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Sge requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Epifania would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan, de 63 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a realizar los oficios del hogar, tiene 5 hijos, todos tienen sus propios hogares.
Juan, desde la edad de 15 años trabaja en la agricultura., actualmente cuida 3 novillas, aprendió los trabajos de la agricultura y ganaderia, gracia a sus padres.- Además, anterioemente aprendió la sastreria.

Actualmente, tiene sembrado 2 hectáreas de maíz, trabaja de 6:00 de la mañana a 11:30 a.m. Aparte de sembrar granos básicos, hace 8 meses inicio un nuevo proyecto, el cual es de panaderia, junto con su hijo y su esposa trabajan en ésta actividad.

El préstamo sera utilizado para la compra ganado de repasto.

Juan ha logrado cumplir uno de sus sueños el cual era de tener un negocio de panadería., ahora su sueño es que este negocio sea productivo y genere las ganancias esperadas, para mejorar las condiciones de vida en las que viven actualmente.
texts.en:
Juan is 63 years old and went to school up to grade eight.  He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores.  He has five children and they all have their own homes. 

Since the age of 15 Juan has worked in agriculture.  He is currently caring for three heifers.  He learned the work of agriculture and raising livestock thanks to his parents.  Also, he previously learned tailoring.

Currently, he has 2 hectares of corn planted.  He works from 6 in the morning until 11:30 AM.  Aside from sowing basic grains, 8 months ago he began a new project, a bakery, which he runs together with his son and his wife.

The loan will be used to buy grazing livestock.

Juan has succeeded in fulfilling one of his dreams which was to have a bakery business.  Now his dream is that this business be productive and generate the income he hopes for in order to improve the conditions of life in which they currently live.

loans.use: to buy grazing livestock

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is a married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells green leaf tea and at the same time earns a monthly salary. He faces challenges of price fluctuation and inadequate capital, however, he has hopes of constructing a residential house for his family. Leonard needs a loan to buy tea for selling.

loans.use: to buy tea for selling.

loans.name: Concepción Del  Jesus

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Concepción, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 6 hijos, 5 mayores de edad y una de 10 años que estudia en escuela, con ella también vive un chico de 17 años que estudia en colegio y que lo crio desde pequeño como su hijo, el marido trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
Doña Concepción es una mujer que le gusta trabajar por el bien de su familia, tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría pollos y chanchos, ella compra estos animalitos pequeños los cría por tres meses los pollos y 6 meses los chanchos  y luego los vende en pie o por libras a los vecinos o entrega a las tiendas de la localidad, ella también en su casa vende golosinas y deliciosos bolos que ella misma prepara, de esta forma ella se gana algo extra en beneficio de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar golosinas, alimentos y medicinas  para los chanchos y pollos. Lleva más de 15 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The loan group María Auxiliadora meets in the La Sequita parish, which belongs to the Montecristi canton, a prosperous canton of Manabi known for being the place of birth of the Old Warrior Eloy Alfaro, and for the famous hats made of cap straw that are appreciated both inside and outside the country.  

In this place lives Concepción who is 47 years old, married, and has six children: five of them of legal age, and one who is 10 years old and is still attending school. With her also lives another boy who is 17 years old and is attending school. He has lived with Concepción since he was a little boy and was raised as her son. Concepción's husband works in a factory in Manta. 

Concepción is a woman who enjoys working for the good of her family. She has a small farm, on which she raises chickens and pigs. She buys these animals when they are young and raises (three months for the chickens and six months for the pigs) and later sells them to her neighbors or businesses in the area. She also sells candy and delicious bolos (a dessert similar to a popsicle) that she makes. In this way, she earns extra money to benefit her family.  

Concepción will use this loan to buy candy, food items, and medicines for pigs and chickens. She has been part of this loan group for 15 years. She likes the group because of the help that the loans give. Her dream is to move forward.

loans.use: to buy candy, food items, and medicines for pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Shirley Lorena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
Aquí vive la señora Shirley, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 10, 5 y 1 año de edad, los mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es electricista.
Doña Shirley es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo y bisutería, trabaja tres días por semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos y también vende en su casa, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días,  de esta forma ella  se gana algo por el bienestar de su familia y ya son más de 5 años en esta actividad razón por lo cual cuenta con buena clientela. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa y bisuterías. Es socia del Grupo De Crédito hace ya 4 años y le gusta por la responsabilidad de sus compañeras. Sus sueños son tener un bazar.
texts.en:
The members of the María Auxiliadora communal bank meet in La Sequita parish which is part of the prosperous Montecristi cantón of Manabita, known as the birthplace of the "Old Warrior" Eloy Alfaro, and for its famous toquilla straw hats, which are valued inside and outside the country.

This is where Shirley lives.  She is 28 years old, married, with three children, ages 10,  5, and 1. The older ones attend school. Her husband is an electrician. Shirley is a very hard working woman who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells clothing of all types, and costume jewelry, working three days a week and selling door to door. She goes around the city offering her products and also sells from her home. She sells on credit and collects each week. 

In this way she is earning something for her family's well-being. She has been in this business for five years already, so she has a good clientele. She is going to use this loan to buy clothing and costume jewelry. 

She has been in the communal bank group for four years and likes it because of how responsible her fellow group member are. Her dream is to have a small store.

loans.use: To buy clothing and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Mary Joy successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Mary Joy's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 5 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Mo, pictured first from the right, is 48 years old. She works in the agriculture sector and earns 400,000 VND monthly. Among her children, some are still going to school and some have grown up. She is often sick for the whole year. Her family is in an economic hardship situation and cannot afford to have a hygienic toilet. Like other members of Group 5 - Hoi Ninh 01, she will use the fund to build a toilet to improve the living conditions for the family members and contribute to the community's sanitary improvement. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1995.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 6 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nhi, pictured first from the right, is 56 years old. She works in the agricultural sector and earns 600,000 VND monthly. She is married with grown children. Her family is in an economic hardship situation and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a toilet to improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets.  She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1992.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 7 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Oanh, pictured first from the right, is 52 years old. She works in the agricultural production and makes 500,000 VND monthly. She is married with grown children. Her husband passed away many years ago. She does not have good health and usually be sick for the whole year. Her family is in economic hardship situation and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a toilet to improve the living conditions for the family members, by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1998.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Maria Dinora

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de repuesto para bicicletas, quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes y encementando el piso, pero con lo que gana en sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra para y asi puedan vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en: Maria is 52 years old and lives in a house of her own with her husband.  She has a business that sells spare parts for bicycles and wants to improve her home by plastering the walls and making a cement floor, but the money she earns in sales isn't enough for her to afford it.  For that reason, she's requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, iron, and pay for labor so they can live more comfortably and in cleanliness.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, iron and pay for labor to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Sumac Maki Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC MAKI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gerarda ella es soltera y tiene 50 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de pollos,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y que todos sus hijos salgan profesionales, la socia los pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta los pollos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
The members belong to Sumac Maki Communal Bank in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco.

Gerarda, 50, is single and has three children.  She works in her business raising chickens.  Through this business she wants her children to finish school and become professionals.

Gerarda fattens and raises the chickens, then sells them in different markets.  She has several years of experience in this business and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her business selling chickens.

She's requesting the loan to buy chickens and chicken feed.

The other members earn a living in clothing sales, handmade craft sales, a grocery store, and a restaurant.  (The member attached to the group photo had permission to have her photo taken after the meeting because of her job.)

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra is a kind person. She lives in a rural area. She is married and has two children. Her husband works abroad. She has had a business for about two years, and is an experienced and capable person. She is a sewer and also a retailer; she buys and sells clothes for women and kids. She is doing well, and has permanent clients. She considers the market condition where a lot of competitors are. She tries to have unique clothes in order to attract more customers. She is responsive for her products' quality. She wants to enlarge her business and buy a new collection of clothes. She needs financial support for her business.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Pamela se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace paltos como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Pamela is continuing with her restaurant business.  Through this business, she wants to get ahead.  She makes dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and other foods.  Pamela's dream is to expand her business selling food.  She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, chicken, and meat.  She is pleased to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, and meat

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng, 42, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she works very hard on her own rice farmland by growing and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in market. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 3.00 a day. 

She is a lovely mother of two single children. One of her children is going to get married soon. However, she doesn't have enough money to prepare a proper wedding party. Thus, she is applying for a Kiva loan to pay for her child’s wedding party. Through this loan, she hopes that it can bring real happiness for this new couple. She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her child’s wedding party

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 41 years old and married, with three children.

Joan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Joan has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 28-year-old, married man with one child, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a restaurant and a hotel, the business he started with a hope of earning a living. He faces the challenge of high competition. However, he hopes of having a healthy family, and a well-furnished hotel, attracting many customers. Joseph needs a loan to buy furniture for the hotel.

loans.use: to buy furniture for the hotel.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.en: Ruzigul is a strong woman who lives in a rural area. She is married and has four children. She is a hardworking woman. Her business is in planting, landing and growing seeds. She looks after her plants very well. She is planning to enlarge her business and wants to plant a new sapling. She tries to work effectively. She thinks that land is the place where she finds herself. She is asking for financial support to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for enlarging her activity.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento Virgen del Carmen está compuesta por ocho integrantes de las cuales siete  son mujeres y un varón, todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, personas venta de mandiles y lana, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares,  venta de jugo, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios todas ellas se conocen entre sí ya que viven por la misma zona.
