La presidenta del Banco es la señora Getrudes (en la foto es del vestido lila floreado) es una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene cuatro hijos de las edades 14, 10, 8, y uno tres de ellos en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio, ella es emprendedora, buena madre, luchadora, fuerte, constante independiente. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona Sur de su ciudad de Santa Cruz, un área caracterizada por el creciente comercio, con una temperatura que varía de los 27-32 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Getrudez es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el español Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en un año que lleva con esta actividad.
Por este motivo solicita el préstamo para la compra de variedad de productos para surtir su tienda, porque estas fechas de fin de año tienen mucha demanda.
texts.en:
The bank Virgen del Carmen is made up of eight members: seven women and one man. They all make a living through distinct businesses such as car upholstery, wool and net sales,smoothie sales, cell phone cover sales, juice sales, perfume sales, soft drink sales, and clothing sales. They are requesting this loan in order to expand their businesses. Each of the members know one another because they all live in the same region.  

Gertrudes is the president of this bank (she is the one in a purple flowered dress). She is 40 years old and lives with her husband. She has four children ages 14, 10, 8, and 1. Three of them are school age. Gertrudes makes a living selling basic goods in a neighborhood store. She is an entrepreneurial woman and a good mother. She is a fighter, who is strong and independent. Gertrudes works in the southern zone of the city of Santa Cruz, an area characterized by its growing business. The temperatures stay between 27-32 degrees Celsius throughout the year. 

Getrudes has a dark complexion with long black hair. She is of medium height and has a robust figure. Her native language is Spanish. This is her first loan cycle through a financial institution. She is requesting this loan in order to buy a variety of products to stock her store because during the end of the year there is always much demand.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to stock her store.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO,la socia María Carmen sigue dedicándose al negocio de restaurant, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de platos para sus clientes que le solicitan cada dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera continuar apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de huevos, menestras entre otros.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the communal bank group "Las leonas de San Jeronimo" (The lions of San Jeronimo). María Carmen continues making a living through her restaurant. She is grateful for this loan and pledges to make her scheduled repayments. María Carmen will continue making different types of dishes for her customers that come each day. She is a responsable and dedicated person. She hopes to be able to keep working and support her family. 

María Carmen is requesting this loan to buy eggs, vegetable soup, and other items.

loans.use: to buy eggs, vegetable soup, and other items.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio Julio Cesar se sigue dedicando al negocio de maestro de construccion,el socio realiza casas y edificios, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de maestro de construccion.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como madera y herramientas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Julio Cesar makes a living as a master carpenter. He makes houses and buildings. His dream is to expand his construction business. 

The member is requesting the loan to buy construction materials such as wood and tools.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as wood and tools.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras 2014 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS 2014”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quillabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de la Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luzmila ,la socia  tiene 57 años  tiene 4 hijos y es soltera; La socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores ,la socia crianza estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan ,a la vez  la socia se dedica a la agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the community bank "Enterprising Women 2014." This bank is located in the Quillabamba district, which is part of the Convención province in the department of Cusco.

One member is Luzmila. She is 57 years old, is single, and has four children. She is in the business of raising young animals and then selling them to her customers. She is also a farmer. She is responsible and hard-working. She's been in her lines of work for a long time now and they're going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. This work is how she is able to get her family ahead.

Luzmila is requesting this loan so that she can buy seed and fertilizer.

The other members have a variety of businesses, including selling food, selling clothes, running a grocery store and running a restaurant. Luzmila is grateful to everyone who becomes part of her dream and she is committed to repaying her loan according to the established terms.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily runs a retail business in Mombasa town. She has worked hard in her business and she has been able to support her family. She is 21 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two schooling children. 

She has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of flour, sugar, cooking oil and cereals to sell in her business. This will enable her to serve more customers and make more income, which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

This is her second loan term and she paid her previous loan well. Her future hopes are to be successful and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy more stock of flour, sugar, cooking oil and cereals to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 8 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nhiem, pictured first from the right, is 41 years old. She works in the agricultural sector and earns 600,000 VND monthly. She's married with children who are still going to school. She is usually sick for the whole year. Her family is in an economic hardship situation and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a toilet to improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1996.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL NAZARETH ESTA CONFORMADA POR  NUEVE INTEGRANTES SEIS  MUJERES  Y TRES HOMBRES, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE. SON ORIGINARIOS MALPAISILLO, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SE PERSONAS RESPONSABLES, TRABAJADORAS, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, TODAS TIENE DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS, PERO LUCHA DÍA A DÍA PARA PODER SATISFACE LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES Y MEJORAS SUS INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS POR ENDE LOS DE SU FAMILIA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES AUDELIS Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE CUAJADAS DE FORMA AMBULANTE Y EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS OCHOS HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SU PRODUCTOS.  ELLA RECORRE LAS CALLES DE SU LOCALIDAD CON UNA PANA DE UNOS 20 KG  A CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTUALES, ELLA TAMBIÉN DISTRIBUYE A LAS PULPERIAS DE SU LOCALIDAD , CON RECUPERACIONES SEMANALES, QUINCENALES. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE CUAJADA PARA SU DISTRIBUCIÓN.  PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. NAZARETH AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Nazareth communal bank is made up of nine members; six women and three men, responsible mothers and fathers with the desire for success in life. They are from Malpaisillo, and are known for being hardworking and responsible people, with a desire for personal success. All of them have various business activities, and strive from day to day to be able to satisfy the needs of their customers, improve their income and therefore that of their family. 

Thanks to her desire to succeed the coordinator is Audelis.  She sells cheese curd as a street vendor and from her home. She works at her business around eight hours a day selling her products. She goes around the streets of her neighborhood with a 20 kg basket selling to steady and occasional customers. She also distributes to the small general stores in her neighborhood. She sells on credit and makes bi-weekly and weekly collections. 

The purpose of the credit is to buying cheese curd for her distribution sales so that in the not too distant future she can obtain better income. Nazareth is grateful for the help that the KIva lenders are offering to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that people can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: para invertir en la compra y venta de cuajada para su distribucion.

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en: Cyprien is 58 years old. He is married with seven children aged between 10 and 24 years, and six of them go to school. He has a shop and has been in a business for six years. With the loan, he would like to buy more rice, biscuits and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, biscuits and soap to sell.

loans.name: Fanny Flor

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia Fanny tiene 48 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos, la socia se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte (movilidad escolar),la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dúa a su negocio.
La socia solicito el crédito para la hacer el mantenimiento de su carro.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Fanny is a member of the community bank "Liderando Las Palmeras."  She is 48 years old, married, and has two children. Fanny is a responsible person who works by providing transportation services for school children. She's been in this business for some time, and it's going well for her thanks to the drive she brings to her work every day. She wishes to continue working in this way.

Fanny is requesting this loan so that she can do maintenance on her car. She is grateful for the offered credit and she is committed to repaying it within the established terms.

This loan is part of an Asociación Arariwa credit line called Credi Yapa. It is provided to loan recipients with good credit history.

loans.use: perform maintenance on her car

loans.name: Betül

texts.en:
Betul is a young woman who has finished high school and is studying in university.   In the meantime, she would like to learn a trade to earn income since it can be hard to find a job right after school.  With the Maya credit she will buy a sewing machine and start looking for work to support herself through school.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Betül oldukça genç bir kadın.Lise bitti,yüksek okulda okuyor.  Bu arada meslek edinmek ve para kazanmak istiyor.Okul bitince iş bulmakta zor zaten.  Kısadan hem meslek edinecek,hem para kazanacak. Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile dikiş makinesi alarak işe başlıyor.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат мужчина 40 лет , женат , отец четверых детей. На протяжение 25 лет он занимается животноводством . На своем участке земли Шухрат ухаживает за домашним скотом . Из молока ,полученного от коров,его жена делает кефир и сметану и относит на рынок для продажи. Продукция ,приготовленная с любовью и нежность, скупается сразу же . У Шухрата трое маленьких детей и один старший сын,который учится и работает в России и  отправляет деньги своим родителям.Шухрат хочет обеспечить своих детей светлым будущим,поэтому трудится день и ночь.В настоящее время он хочет расширить поголовье своего скота и закупить корм на зиму.Поэтому Шухрат обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Он надеется на положительный ответ от МДО Арванд и благодарит за помощь и доверие.
texts.en: Shuhrat is a 40-year old man, married and the father of four. He has been raising livestock for 25 years. He has his own land plot where he takes care of his livestock. His wife processes milk produced by their cows into kefir and sour cream for sale at the market. Her homemade dairy products, prepared with care and a loving touch, are sold out very quickly. Shuhrat has three young children and one grown son, who studies and works in Russia and sends money to his parents. Shuhrat works long hours in order to secure a better future for his children. At present he would like to increase his livestock and buy animal feed for winter. This is why he turned to the Arvand microfinance institution for financial support. He is hoping for a positive response from Arvand and thanks you for your help and trust.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Henry Wilfredo

texts.es: Henry, tiene 43 años de edad, está soltero, tiene dos hijos, vive con ellos en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. El ha trabajado como jornalero para obtener ingresos para su familia pero hace 6 años miró la oportunidad de poner su propio negocio y comenzó a vender helados como paletas, conos, cremas, y jugos, esta actividad la realiza en su casa y es su fuente de ingresos. Ha decidido solicitar un prestamo por 7,000 Lempiras para abastecerse de mas productos y vender, comprara ice cream, conos y paletas para poder incrementar el inventario y sus ingresos. Siendo su plan crecer con el negocio y obtener mayor ganancia para su familia.
texts.en: Henry is 43 years old. He is single and has two children, with whom he lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. He has worked as a day laborer to earn income for his family. However, six years ago, he saw the opportunity to open his own business and began to sell ice cream popsicles, cones, creams, and juices. He runs this business from his home and it is a good source of income. Henry has decided to request a loan for 7,000 Lempiras to stock his business with more products to sell. He will buy ice cream, cones, and sticks to increase his inventory and his profits. His plan in to expand his business and obtain more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy ics cream, cones, and sticks to sell.

loans.name: Y

texts.en:
Y, 32, is living in Prey Chhor District, in Kampong Cham Province. He is a father of two dependent children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and selling his crops to local dealers.  So far, he has been a farmer for ten years. He can make an income of USD 2.00 a day, on average.   

To accelerate his farming process, he wants to buy horses to help carry many heavy farming materials. Because there is insufficient money, he would like to apply for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy the horses. With the support from this loan, he hopes that it can help to process his farming faster. He is thankful to all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy horses

loans.name: Zulayho

texts.en: Zulayho is a hardworking woman who was born in 1970. She lives in a village. Zulayho is married and has three children. For the past 20 years, she has operated a business buying and selling livestock. She has two big and ten small cattle. Her husband and son help her with the business; her husband sells small cattle in the domestic market. Zulayho has a yard where the cattle are kept in good condition. Zulayho is planning to enlarge her activity. She needs financial support to buy additional small cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle to enlarge her business

loans.name: Mervin Anderson

texts.es:
MERVIN DE 54 ANOS DE EDAD, SOLTERO CON DOS HIJOS DE MAYORES DE EDAD,  QUE ESTUDIA EN LA UNIVERSIDAD SU CARRERA, CON MUCHO ESFUERZO POR PARTE DE SU PADRE, PERO ES SU SUEÑO QUE SUS HIJOS SE FORMEN. ORIGINARIO DE MANAGUA, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER RESPONSABLE, TRABAJADOR, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL.  LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDO ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD Y APRENDER SU OFICIO, PARA SALIR ADELANTE EN LA VIDA.
EN LA ACTUALIDAD TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA EL SERVIO DE TALLER DE ELECTROMECÁNICA, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN.  TIENE 33 ANOS DE DESEMPEÑAR SU NEGOCIO,  EL DEDICA UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS SERVICIO Y CONSISTE EN REPACION DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO DE LOS VEHÍCULOS  Y MOTORES. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO CON PRODUCTOS COMO: ESTAÑO, SOLDADORES, DESARMADORES, LLAVES, PROBADORES DE ENERGÍA, MESAS. EL OBJETIVO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA BRINDAR UN BUEN SERVIO Y MANTENER SU CLIENTELA Y QUE EN UN FUTURO  NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS.  MERVIN AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Mervin is 54 years old. He is single with two adult children studying for professional degrees at university through a lot of effort by their father, but it is his dream that his children are educated. 

Originally from Managua, he is known to be very responsible, hardworking, wanting personal success. Unfortunately he could not study due to the lack of financial resources. The need to work could be seen at an early age and he learned his trade in order to get ahead in life.

Currently he has an electromechanical workshop as his activity. His business is located at his home. He has had 33 years of experience in his business. He dedicates twelve hours daily offering his service repairing electrical systems of vehicles and engines.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to supply his business with products such as tin, welders, screwdrivers, keys, power testers, and tables.

The object is to invest in working capital and supply his business in order to offer good service and keep his customers so that in the not far off future he can obtain better income.

Mervin is thankful for the help that the Kiva loaners offer to people with scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to have decent work.

loans.use: to invest in supplies for his mechanical workshop such as: tin, welders, screwdrivers, keys, power testers, and tables.

loans.name: Benedicta Aurentina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Benedicta, tiene 68 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación  tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo no trabaja está enfermo.
Doña Benedicta para ganarse el sustento diario de ella y para su esposo se  dedica a la cría de animales, tiene chanchos y pollos los cuales compra cuando están pequeños y los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado,  luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para luego llevarlos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad y comercializar la carne, a los pollos los pela y los vende por libras a vecinos y tiendas de sus localidad.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para pollos y chanchos. Lleva más de 14 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener salud.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Credit Group meets in the La Sequita parish, which belongs to the Montecristi settlement, a prosperous settlement in Manabí. The settlement is known for being the birthplace of the old warrior Eloy Alfaro, and for the famous straw hats that are valued both in and out of the country. 

Benedicta lives here. She is 68 years old and is in a domestic partnership. From this domestic partnership, she has 7 children who are independent adults. Her spouse does not work because he is sick.

Benedicta, in order to earn sustenance for her and her spouse, making a living in animal breeding. She has pigs and chickens, which she buys when they are small and keeps for three to four months until they weigh enough. Later, she sells them to traders who come to her house and then bring them to the different markets in the city to market the meat. She plucks the chickens and sells them by the pound to her neighbors and the local stores.

She is going to use this loan to buy chickens, as well as food and medicine for chickens and pigs. She has been in the Credit Group for more than 14 years, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dreams are to get ahead and to have health.

loans.use: to buy chickens, as wells as food and medicine for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Nhóm 10 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ha, pictured first from the right, is 22 years old. She works in the agricultural sector and earns 600,000 VND monthly. She's married with young children. Her husband  is often sick for the whole year. Her family is in an economic hardship situation and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a toilet to improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2010.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Vitumbiko Group

texts.en: Miriam is 29 years old and married to a bus driver. She has four children and looks after four orphans.  Mirriam has a farm where she keeps pigs, and she depends on this business for her main source of income. This business helps her to find funds to support her family, by providing her children with basic needs and paying their school fees. She will use the loan to expand her business, as she wants to buy more pigs and reconstruct a better kraal. She plans to build a better house for her children and hopes to have enough food throughout the year. Accessing loans have helped her to become self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and reconstruct a better kraal

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en:
Teyyub, 22 years old, is single and lives with his parents and sister. His family has been IDP (internally displacted persons) from the city of Füzuli for 20 years and now live in the Füzuli region. Teyyub’s mother, Husniya, is a housewife who helps Teyyub in his business. His father is a taxi driver and his sister, Narmin, is a student.

Teyyub has been in the animal breeding business for 2 years. He buys small cattle, raises them and sells them in the local bazaar. He wants to develop his business and needs a loan of 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy cows. Teyyub is thankful to Kiva and the Komak organization for this aid. He wants to buy more cows and, in the future, to produce dairy products and sell them.

loans.use: to buy cows to increase his business and, in the future, to produce dairy products and sell them.

loans.name: Kamola

texts.en:
Kamola is a hardworking woman. She is divorced and has three children. She brings up her children alone. Kamola has been busy with growing crops for more than 10 years. She also has been busy with animal husbandry. Kamola’s brother and sister help to manage her business. She sells the getting harvest in a local market. 

Kamola is going to repair her house, as it is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy building materials for repairing her house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, wood, etc. for repairing her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her production of nacatamales [steamed corn cakes] in order to support her home finances.

loans.name: Mary Jakeline

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Mary, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 11 y 10 años de edad, el mayor estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en construcción.
Doña Mary es una muy buena esposa que al ver que su marido no gana mucho hace varios años  adecuo un pequeño local en su casa en el mismo que surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres, allí vende granos, carnes y otros productos de primera necesidad, ella con cada crédito que recibe compra más productos para satisfacer a su clientes y así tener más clientela con el pasar de los días, a ella le gusta su labor ya que se gana algo y está atenta de lo que sus hijos necesitan, con esto ella se gana lo suyo para el bien de su hogar.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, aceites  entre otras cosas para surtir su negocio. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace más de 12 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora community bank meets every in the Sequita parish, which is part of the Montecristi Prospero settlement, well known not only as the birthplace of the famous soldier Eloy Alfaro but also for the famous straw hats (Panama hats) that are well loved both within the country and abroad.

This is where Mary lives. She's 37 years old, and she and her husband have three children, ages 14, 11 and 10 years. The oldest is in high school and the two younger children are in primary school. Her husband works in construction.

Mary is a good wife who noticed that her husband hadn't been making much money for several years. She decided to allocate a small part of their house as a store and stock it with household necessities for sale. She sells grains, meats, and more. With each successive loan, she has been able to buy more products to meet her customers' needs, and now she has a larger clientele than ever. Mary likes her work since it helps her earn some money while being able to look after the children when they need it. She feels like she is doing her part for her household.


This loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other items to stock her store. She has been in the credit group for more than twelve years and she appreciates the help that the loans have given her. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, oil and more

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
To have additional income, Editha engages in direct selling of AVON, Natasha, MSE and Board Walk products within her community. She is 49 years old, married and blessed with two children.

Editha aims to further improve this business but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, Editha is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more stocks of the said products to resell. She hopes and believes that someday, she will further improve this business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of AVON, Natasha, MSE and Board Walk products to resell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is originally from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She has four single children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. So far, it is almost twenty years of being a farmer.

Apart from involvement with the agriculture sector, her husband, Noun, has a car rental service with a net profit of USD 5.00 a day. During this time, her husband’s job is running badly, since the car is broken and needs to be repaired. Due to insufficient money, she is applying for a Kiva loan for her husband to pay car repair fees.

She hopes this loan will help her husband’s job to go smoothly, as well as bring regular income for her family. She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay the car repair fees for her husband's car rental service.

loans.name: Asumpter

texts.en:
Asumpter is 38 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with two children. She is a cash crop farmer in Thika town and has been in this business for five years. 

She will be using this loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.  This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her farming and to have a good family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 42 years old and married to Rose. Together, they are blessed with 3 children. He does farming and has been in this business for the past 14 years.

He will be using this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, manure and fertilizers. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children.

This is his first loan term with Vision Fund Kenya and his future hopes are to improve his business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Marivic works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens. Marivic is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past 36 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: April Rose

texts.en:
April Rose works hard to support her family. April Rose is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

April Rose has been in this business for five years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ayuba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Nahemiya and Emmanuel.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ayuba  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for childrens school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nhóm 11 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Minh, pictured first from the right, is 53 years old and works in the agricultural sector with a monthly income of 500,000 VND. She is married with grown children. Her husband passed away many years ago. She has bad health and often gets sick for the whole year. Her family has an economic hardship situation and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a toilet to improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1990.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 12 -  Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Tho, pictured first from the right, is 44 years old. She works in the agricultural sector and earns 600,000 VND monthly. She is married with grown children. Her husband passed away many years ago.  She has bad health and often gets sick for the whole year. Her family has an economic hardship situation and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a toilet to improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1995.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
Procesa is married, and she works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing and pig fattening businesses.

Procesa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nhóm 13 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Khuyen, pictured first from the right, is 54 years old. She works in the agricultural sector and earns 600,000 VND monthly. She is married with two children, one of whom is attending high school. Her family has an economic hardship situation and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a toilet to improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1997.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rebecca has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from food vending. Rebecca aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old and married with four children.

Susan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Susan has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Susan aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 61 years old. She is married with nine children aged between 4 and 16 years; all of them go to school.  She sells foodstuffs and has been in a business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and maize to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Each morning at 5:30 a. m. Henry wakes up to go to his farm located in the Eldoret area of Kenya. He wouldn't want to work anywhere else. "When you have your own farm you are free," he says. "You could offer me a million to work for someone else, but I would still prefer my own farm. It may be small, but it is mine." Henry is a bright and visionary farmer. He has been through primary school, but due to circumstances out of his control, he dropped out. He describes his upbringing as challenging. 

His primary income sources are milk, vegetables and a motorcycle business. He is seeking a loan to construct a greenhouse, which will give him control over the environment that his crops grow in. He will be able to produce more variety of exotic crops and increase his yield by more than 40 percent.  Henry has fully repaid a previous loan that he secured through Juhudi Kilimo. With the new loan, he is looking to increase crop production on his farm, where he has worked for the last 10 years. He and his wife have hired other employees to help run their farm. Henry also owns over 20 chickens and two exotic breeds of dairy cows. However, he is very cautious when approaching a new business opportunity and is very focused on money matters. He records every transaction and reviews his budget on a daily basis. He is certain that returns from the expansion will allow him to repay the loan. 

Henry is an active member of Kosyin Group ( among the oldest and one of the most successful groups in Juhudi Kilimo) who believes in luck and hard work as a way to succeed and to build a better life for future generations. He has over 100 trees on his compound and various works of art. He considers himself to be very honest. With this loan, Henry will build a better life for his wife and three children and put in a lot more hard work.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Señor De Los Nevados Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS NEVADOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yony ella es soltera y tiene 56 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva papa,quinua y maiz, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Señor de los Nevados communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Paucartambo, part of Paucartambo province and Cusco department.

Yony is single and is 56 years old and has three cildren. She works in her agriculture business. She has a plot of land where she grows potatoes, quinoa, and corn. She works from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm. She has had this business for some years now and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her cultivated land. She asks for the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

The other members work in an animal sales business, a vegetable sales business, a grocery store business and a food sales business. 

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform and promises to make the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ketty Viviana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la  señora Ketty, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 16 y 9 años los cuales estudian en colegio y escuela, el esposo es comerciante.
Doña Ketty es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella  se dedica al comercio, vende  bisutería, ropa, ropa interior de damas, zapatos entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale dos o tres días por semana de dos a tres horas al día, ya son más de 5 años dedicada al comercio con lo cual se gana algo por su cuenta para beneficio de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, bisutería, ropa interior y zapatos. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que viven en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets  in La Sequita parish in Montecristi, a canton known as the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro [José Eloy Alfaro (1842-1912), an Ecuadorian revolutionary leader and president] and for the famous straw [or "Panama"] hats that are valued both in Ecuador and abroad.

This is where Ketty lives. She's 34 years old and she and her husband have two children, ages 16 and 9 years, who are both in school. Her husband is in sales.

Ketty likes working to help her husband with the household expenses. She is in the business of sales as well, and she sells clothing, undergarments, jewelry, shoes, and more. She does door to door sales and goes out two or three days a week for two to three hours. She's been working in this way for five years, and it's how she earns a little something to help out the family.

This loan will be used to supply her store with all sorts of merchandise. She's been in the credit group for four years and she likes the help that the loans have provided her and her business. Her goal is for her family to have their own home and move out of her parents' house.

loans.use: buy clothing and accessories for resale

loans.name: Nhóm 15 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Khuyen, pictured first from the right, is 49 years old. She works as a farmer and earns 500,000 VND monthly. She is married with children who are still going to school. Her husband got a fatal disease which made him sick for the whole year. Her family has an economic hardship situation and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will use the fund to build a toilet to improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2000.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 16 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong, pictured first from the right, is 29 years old. She works in the agricultural sector and earns 600,000 VND monthly. She is married with children who are still going to school. She has bad health and often gets sick for the whole year.

Her family is in an economic hardship situation and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. With this loan, she will use the funds to build a toilet to improve the living conditions for the family members by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets She has been a member of the Women's Union since 2008.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 9 -  Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Tuyet, pictured first on the right, is 50 years old. She works in the agriculture sector and earns 500,000 VND monthly. She is married and her children are adults now. Mrs. Tuyet's husband has been sick for the whole year. Her family faces economic hardship and they do not have a hygienic toilet yet. Mrs. Tuyet will use this loan to build a toilet to improve her family's living conditions, improving their health by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets. Mrs. Tuyet has been a member of the Women's Union since 1992.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 14 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Voc, pictured first from the right, is 46 years old. She works in the agricultural sector and earns 600,000 VND monthly. She's married and her children are still going to school. Her husband is often sick for the whole year. Her family has an economic hardship situation and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. A portion of Group 14 - Hoi Ninh 01 's loan will help her as well as other group member build a hygienic toilet to improve the family members' quality of life and their health by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic latrines. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1996.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Nimia Graciana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Nimia,  tiene 62 años, está separada hace varios años pero de esa relación procreo 5 hijos los cuales ya son  mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun  vive con ella. 
Doña Nimia es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro para salir adelante, ella  tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende de todo un poco, desde granos hasta legumbres, pollo, pescado y carne por libras, le gusta tener de todo para que sus clientes estén satisfechos, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, su hijo le ayuda en su negocio cuando él está desocupado pero es ella la que pasa más tiempo allí ya que allí se entretiene  y se entera de todo lo que sucede en su entorno. Lleva más de 15 años en su negocio con el cual saco adelante a sus hijos y que hoy le permite ganarse la vida. 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, legumbres, etc. para surtir su tienda. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son mejorar  su tienda.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in the La Sequita parish in Montecristi, a canton known as the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro [José Eloy Alfaro (1842-1912), an Ecuadorian revolutionary leader and president] and for the famous straw [or "Panama"] hats that are valued both in Ecuador and abroad.

This is where Nimia, age 62, lives. She and her husband have been separated for several years, but they have five grown children, one of whom still lives with her.

Nimia is a woman who's had to work hard to get ahead in her life. She runs a little grocery store out of her house and she sells a little bit of everything, from grains and vegetables to chicken, fish and meat by the pound. She likes to keep a wide variety of stock so that her customers always find what they're looking for. She works every day from 6:00am until 8:00pm. Her son helps when he's free, but it's she who spends most of the time in the shop. She finds entertainment in her work and gets to find out about everything going on in the neighborhood. She's been running her business for more than fifteen years; it's how she earns her living and got her children ahead in life.

This loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, detergents, beans and more to supply her stores. She's been in this loan group since the beginning and she appreciates the help it's provided. Her goal is to improve her store.

loans.use: stock her grocery store with rice, sugar, detergents, and more

loans.name: Servan

texts.en:
Servan is 40 years. He lives in Fuzuli region near the war zone with his family, but his family have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city over the past 22 years.

Servan is married and has a child. He is a 15-year-old boy, and he goes to the eighth class of school. His wife is a housewife and she helps Servan in his work. Servan has been in an animal breeding business for 7 years and he loves his job. He sells milk and milky products (yogurt, cheese, etc.) which are made by Servan and his wife.

Now Servan wants to buy hay for the winter. Therefore, he needs a loan amount of 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for this loan. In the future, for increasing his business, Servan wants to build a new stall for cows.

loans.use: to buy hay, increase business, and in the future he wants to build a new stall for cows

loans.name: Gotitas De Ilusion Group

texts.es:
Veronica es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la confección de mantas de Alpaca.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa ingenio’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas y por la tradicional feria que se realiza todos los jueves y domingos; donde se dice que se puede encontrar desde una aguja de coser hasta un tractor de arado, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Veronica es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general (sentada al centro, usa suéter blanco). Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres, que pertenece a la familia, construida de adobe y ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; taller de soldadura, tapizado de autos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de hoja de coca y venta de jugo de quinua, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la confección de mantas de Alpaca. Actividad artesanal que heredó de su familia; en un telar de aproximadamente 1X2 metros realiza diariamente el tejido, todo el proceso es manual, la lana que utiliza la compra hilada y lavada quedando lista para trabajar. “el proceso que realizo es manual porque mis clientes así me lo exigen, tengo clientes que llegan desde el extranjero sólo a comprar mantas…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller amplio y propio. Ella desea realizar la compra de Lana de Alpaca por mayor para contar con material de trabajo constantemente. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Veronica solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de Alpaca por mayor para contar con material de trabajo constante.
texts.en:
Veronica is a 24-year-old woman who is single, has no children, and has a business making alpaca wool blankets.

She is independent, enterprising, reliable, responsible and hard-working. Her business is in the ‘villa ingenio’ area, a place characterised by trade of all kinds and by the traditional fair that is held there every Thursday and Sunday, where they say that you can find everything from a needle to sew with to a to a tractor to plough with. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day between 2ºC and 14ºC throughout the year.

Veronica has an olive complexion, long black braided hair, a small stature and a robust physical appearance. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks general-knowledge Spanish (she is the one sitting in the centre wearing a white sweater). She carries out her life in her parents' house, which belongs to the family, is made of sun-dried brick and building bricks with a corrugated iron roof and has running water, electricity, household gas and a sewage system. 

Her desire to get ahead led her to head a bank for business people to ask for a loan and expand their businesses. They have the following businesses: a welding workshop, a car upholstery business, smoothie sales, mobile phone cover sales, coca leaf and quinoa juice sales. She makes alpaca wool blankets, an artisan craft which she inherited from her family; she weaves every day using a loom which is approximately 1X2 meters. The whole process is done by hand. She buys the wool spun and washed so it is ready to work with. She comments: “I do it by hand because that is what my customers demand. I have customers that come from abroad just to buy blankets…”. Her dream is to have her own spacious workshop. She wants to bulk-buy alpaca wool so that she has a constant supply of material to work with. This is the first loan sequence with the institution in the year that she has been running the business independently.

It is for these reasons that Veronica is asking for a loan to bulk-buy alpaca wool so that she can have a constant supply of material to work with.

loans.use: to bulk-buy alpaca wool so that she has a constant supply of material to work with

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man and lives in Kagadi, Uganda, where he earns from produce selling, a motorcycle transport business, and farming. However hardworking Simon is, he is challenged by bad weather changes, making it difficult for him to transport his products to the market.

He desires to have a sustainable produce business to supply his customers throughout the year. He is asking for a loan to buy beans and maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for selling.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor, dedicado a cuidar de su ganado y cultivar granos básicos, su familia está compuesta por sus cuatro hijos  y su esposa, no cuenta con ayuda del extranjero, el oficio lo realiza desde hace varios años y lo aprendió de sus padres, no tiene un horario establecido.
El crédito será de utilidad para cubrir los gastos de preparación del terreno para cultivar granos básicos, así dará mejor alimentación a su grupo familiar y abastecerá a sus clientes para obtener ingresos, espera poder cancelar la deuda obtenida.
José desea seguir trabajando, dar un mejor futuro a su familia y heredar el negocio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who cares for his livestock and grows basic grains. His family is made up of his four children and his wife. He receives no remittances from overseas. 

He has been farming for several years, and he learned this trade from his parents. He has no set schedule. The loan will be used to cover the costs to prepare the land for planting basic grains. This will provide better food for his family and will also be a source of income from what he sells to his customers.He expects to pay off his debt.

Jose wants to continue to work, to provide a better future for his family, and to pass his business on to his children.

loans.use: to cover the costs of preparing the land to grow basic grains.

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 7 hijos, 5 mayores de edad e independientes  los  2 menores estudian en  colegio, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña María junto a su  esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos venden recipientes y otros productos de plástico como tachos, reposteros, platos, cucharas y muchos productos más, salen a ofrecer sus productos en los campos ya que por allá es donde más clientes tienen, trabajan 5 días a la semana,  a pesar de que el trabajo es cansado es la única forma que ellos tienen para ganar el sustento diario. Llevan más de 18 años dedicados a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar platos, reposteros y otros productos de plástico.  Lleva más de 5 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le ofrecen  los créditos. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para vender sus productos con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliaradora communal bank meets in the La Sequita parish which is part of Montecristi canton, a prosperous canton in Manabí, known as the birthplace of the "Viejo Luchador" [Old Warrior] Eloy Alfaro and for the famous straw hats that are valued within and outside the country. 

In this place lives María, who is 51 years old, married and from this relationship has 7 children, 5 who are adults and independent, and the 2 younger ones are secondary school students. Three of them still live in her house. Her husband is a salesperson.

María, along with her husband, works in sales. They sell containers and other plastic products such as trash cans, storage containers, plates, spoons and many other products. They go out to sell their products in the rural areas since it is there that they have the most customers. They work 5 days a week, and despite it being tiring work, it is the only way they have to earn their daily living. They have worked in this business for over 18 years and with it they get ahead. 

This loan will be used to purchase plates, storage containers and other plastic products. She has been in the communal bank for more than 5 years and she likes it for the help that the loans offer her. Her dream is to buy a car to sell their products more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase plates, storage containers and other plastic products.

loans.name: Saghira** Group

texts.en:
This group is called Saghira**. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They requested a loan of 150,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Saghira is the leader of the group. She is a single, 20 year old woman with an Elementary education. Her father works very hard and earns a daily wage which is not enough to cover the necessary expenses of the family.

Saghira decided to help her father through selling ready-made women's clothes door-to-door, hoping to make a better future for her family. The income from this humble business is very small because her merchandise is not enough to meet the demands of her clients. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase clothes to resell.

Saghira hopes to expand her business more.

loans.use: to purchase amount clothes to resell..

loans.name: Juana Silvia

texts.es:
Juana, de 62 años de edad, no estudió, está acompañada, su compañero de vida es agricultor y tienen 7 hijos y todos tienen su propia familia.


Juana, es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde la edad de los 12 años, inicio a trabajar junto con sus padres en la agricultura. Actualmente, junto con su compañero de vida, siembran 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y frijol. También, crían ganado bovino y de estas dos actividades productivas, obtienen ingresos para seguir adelante.

El crédito será invertido para comprar ganado de repasto. 

Los sueños de Juana son, mejorar su calidad de vida, mejorar su vivienda y continuar trabajando en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Juana is 62 years old. She did not study and lives with her life partner who is a farmer. They have 7 children who now all have their own families.

Juana is a very hardworking woman. When she was 12 years old, she started working with her parents in agriculture. Currently, together with her life partner, they plant 14,000 square meters of corn and beans. They also raise cattle and from these two productive activities obtain income to move ahead.

This loan will be used to invest in the purchase of grazing cattle.

Juana's dreams are to improve her quality of life, improve her home, and continue to work in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Nhóm 17 - Hồi Ninh 01 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Diu, pictured first from the right, is 57 years old. She works in the agricultural sector and earns VND 600,000 monthly. She is married with three children, two of whom are still going to school. Her family is in an economic hardship situation and could not afford to have a hygienic toilet. Diu is requesting a loan which will help her as well as other members of Group 17 - Hoi Ninh 01 build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions for the family members, by preventing diseases commonly associated with unhygienic toilets She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1995.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand washing with soap

loans.name: Aniel

texts.en:
Aniel is a 25-year-old married father of one child who has been selling mobile phones since three years ago to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Aniel is a hard worker and an ambitious man who succeeded with his honesty and good treatment to gain loyal customers. Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business and increase his business merchandise with new and different kinds of prepaid cards to satisfy his customers' needs.

This loan is very important to Aniel for it will increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with new and different kinds of prepaid cards

loans.name: Apolonia Margarita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Apolonia, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 24, 23 y 14 años, dos de ellos viven en su casa y estudian en colegio y universidad. El  esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta. 
Doña Apolonia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la cría de  pollos y chanchos para lo cual tiene un corral en el cual cría estos animalitos,  los mismos que compran pequeños y  tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses o  hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego  los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprarle para trasladarlos a otras ciudades, de esta forma ella logra sus recursos que son para solventar ciertos gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimentos y medicinas para pollos y chanchos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.  Sus sueños son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliaradora communal bank meets in the La Sequita parish which is part of Montecristi canton, a prosperous canton in Manabí, known as the birthplace of the "Viejo Luchador" [Old Warrior] Eloy Alfaro and for the famous straw hats that are valued within and outside the country. 

In this place lives Apolonia, who is 43 years old, married and from this relationship has three children, ages 24, 23 and 14; two of them live in her house and are students in secondary school and university. Her husband works in a factory in Manta. 

Apolonia is a woman who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses. She works raising chickens and pigs for which she has a corral to raise these animals. She buys them small and has them for a period of three or four months or until they have a sufficient weight and later she sells them to vendors who come to her house to buy them to bring them to other cities. In this way, she gets her income which is to pay certain household expenses and for her children's education.

This loan will be used to purchase food and medicines for chickens and pigs. She has been a member of this communal bank since the beginning and she likes it for the help that the loans offer her. Her dream is that her children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase food and medicine for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for pipes, cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and labor in order to install running water and to build a wash basin.

loans.name: Gulinor

texts.en: Gulinor is a hardworking woman. She is married, has four children, and lives in a rural area. She has been in business for about nine years. Her husband helps her in the business. They are planting seeds for future sales. Gulinor is a responsive and strong woman. She works hard planting in the land. She is planning to make a better condition of living in winter season from the profit of her business. She wants to buy fertilizers for the new sowing season. She needs financial support to widen her activity.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Vicenta Aida

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito San José. 
En este lugar vive la señora Vicenta, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos,  cinco mayores de edad e independientes, solo la ultima que es menor de edad es quien vive en su casa y estudia en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Vicenta es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene una pequeña granja donde cría pollos y chanchos, compra los pollos pequeños los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses hasta que estén listos y luego los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar tanto a los pollos como a los chanchos o si no los lleva a entregar a las tiendas del lugar, lleva más de 18 años con esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante y mas en ocasiones que su marido no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos  y medicinas para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the 24 de Mayo canton, in Manabí province, known for its lovely landscapes, its forests and variety of fauna, and for its friendly and hard-working people who work in agriculture and raising animals, the communal bank San José meets every two weeks. 

In this place lives Vincenta, who is 60 years old, married and from this relationship has six children, five are adults and independent, only the youngest one is a minor and lives with them and is a secondary school student. Her husband works in agriculture. 

Vincenta is a woman who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses. She has a small farm where she raises chickens and pigs, she buys the chickens when they are small and keeps them for a period of two or three months until they are ready, then she sells them to vendors who come to her house to purchase the chickens and also the pigs, or if not, she delivers them to the stores in the area. She has worked in this for over 18 years, which allows her to get ahead and more at the times when her husband doesn't have work. 

This loan is to purchase chickens, food and medicine so they develop well.  She has been in this communal bank for 5 years and she likes it for the help that the loans give her. She dreams of giving her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, food and medicine for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Buenas Amigas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad. Su esposo realiza trabajos de limpieza de piscinas.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja tres a cuatro días a la semana ya sea en la mañana o tarde ya que no tiene horario fijo para salir, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Lleva más de 6  años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Buenas Amigas communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized nationally and internationally: this is where the world-famous Panama hats come from.

This is where María, age 26, lives, along with her husband and their two children, ages 8 and 3. Her husband earns a living cleaning pools. María enjoys working to help out with the household expenses. She sells all sorts of clothing, both door-to-door and out of her home to her best customers. She works three or four days a week, morning or afternoon, and doesn't have a set schedule. She sells to her customers on credit, then collects at the end of the month. When she needs to, she goes to Guayaquil to buy more merchandise. She's been in this line of work for more than six years.

This loan will be used to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. María is a founding member of this loan group and she likes it for the short loan periods. Her dream is to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: buy all types of clothing for resale

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John un hombre separado de 43 años de edad, que en el momento no tiene nada, solo ganas de trabajar y una sed de progreso insaciable, con su exesposa.
Pasa por una mala condiciones y solo acude a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de dos terneras e iniciar una actividad laboral esperando que sea un éxito, tiene la suerte de que sus padres le enseñaran todo sobre el negocio solo espera el apoyo para lograr constituir su empresa y ganarse su vida con humildad y trabajo duro.
texts.en:
John is a separated 43 year old man who has nothing at the moment, only a desire to work and an insatiable thirst for progress, with his ex-wife. 

He has gone through hard times and came in only to apply for a loan in order to buy two calves and begin a work activity, hoping that it will be a success. He is lucky that his parents taught him all about business and he only hopes for support in order to successfully set up his company and earn a living with humility and hard work.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta comenta que viene de una familia trabajadora, actualmente vive sola, trabaja y con mucho sacrificio paga mis estudios con el objetivo de salir delante de manera a mejorar su vida y tener un mejor futuro.
Está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y a través de esta carrera quiere ser alguien en la vida, y a la vez ayudar a las personas que necesiten atención en su salud.
Pide este préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Vicenta told us that she comes from a hard-working family. She currently lives alone, works, and with a great deal of sacrifice is paying for her schooling. Her goal is to come out at the end with a better life and a brighter future.

She is studying for a career in nursing, and through this degree, she hopes to be someone in life, while at the same time helping people who need medical care. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her tuition and continue her studies.

loans.use: pay her college tuition

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando a construccion de obras,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el socio desea tener un negocio propio como tienda de abarrotes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar herramientas como martillos y pinturas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member still works in construction.  He wants to make progress with this business.  He wants to have his own business, such as a grocery store.

He's requesting the loan to buy tools such as hammers and paint.

He's happy about the loan and promises to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy tools such as hammers and paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, herbicides etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 19 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre, su abuela y su hermano, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopa, café, detergentes, golosinas, granos básicos refrescos, etc. todo por mayor y así seguir con sus ventas le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is blurred is 19 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has had a small store in his house for the past three years. He has many customers thanks to his variety of products and his good prices. He lives in a private house with his mother, grandmother and brother.

He is asking for a loan so he can buy soup, coffee, detergents, snacks, basic grains, soft drinks, etc., all at wholesale so he can continue selling and generating a good income.

loans.use: to buy soup, coffee, detergents, snacks, basic grains, soft drinks, etc., all at wholesale.

loans.name: El Hayat Kayfoun Group

texts.en:
Samaher is the featured borrower for El Hayat Kayfoun Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Samaher is a 32-year-old married Syrian mother of two children who has worked as a hairdresser from her house for three years, to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Samaher is an ambitious lady and a sacrificing mother who is working hard to develop her business. Thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary hair tools in addition to some makeup and cosmetics to satisfy her customers.

Samaher is the lady standing in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Wadad is the first lady on the right, and Rania is the first lady on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary hair tools in addition to some makeup  and cosmetics to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Nancy Estamilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia Nancy Estamilda,la socia tiene 53 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos, la socia se dedica a su negocio de snak cafetería, la socia vende cafes,mates,hamburguesas,gasesas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dúa a su negocio.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de gaseosas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Liderando Las Palmeras communal bank. The member, Nancy Estamilda, is 53 years old, married and has four children. She works in her business which is a snack bar. She sells coffee, maté, hamburgers, soft drinks, and among others. She has had this business for a good while, which is going well for her thanks to the dedication that she puts into her business each day. She is a responsible person. She wants to be able to continue working with her business which is going well thanks to the dedication that she puts into her business each day. 

She asks for the loan to purchase soft drinks among other things.

She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. 

This loan is part of the Arariwa Association's lines of credit, called Credi Yapa. This line of credit is granted to borrowers with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks among others.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load. Marilou is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ada Yamileth

texts.es:
Ada, se encuentra acompañada, vive con dos hijos de 4 y un año de edad, por iniciativa propia y en busca de una mejor vida para su familia inicio a elaborar pupusas para vender y a desempeñarse como consejera AVON (venta de productos de revista), sus actividades le permiten cuidar personalmente de su familia y generar ingresos para disminuir las necesidades básicas. No tiene un horario establecido.
