El préstamo le servirá para comprar lociones, cremas corporales, tratamientos faciales, algunas prendas de vestir y otros productos, incrementara la variedad de mercadería para mantener clientes satisfechos, espera recuperar la inversión con un margen de ganancias mayor que le permitan salir adelante con su negocio y otros compromisos.
Su objetivo es seguir luchando para tener una mejor estabilidad económica y así dar a sus hijos un mejor estilo de vida y una buena educación.
texts.en:
Ada lives with her life partner and her two children who are 4 and 1 year old. On her own initiative and in search of a better life for her family, she began selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) and also became an AVON consultant (catalog sales). Her work allows her to personally care for her family and to generate enough income to cover basic necessities. She doesn't have a set schedule.

She will use the loan to buy lotions, body creams, facial treatments, some items of clothing, and other products, increasing her variety of merchandise to satisfy her customers. She hopes to recover her investment with a larger profit margin, allowing her to move her business forward and to take care of some other commitments.

Her goal is to keep struggling to have more financial stability thereby providing her children with a better life style and a good education.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body creams, facial treatments, some clothing and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Finance and Banking.

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
A farmer living in Battambang province, Ratha is 25 years old and a father of one kid. He overcomes his family’s hardship via rice cropping. Moreover, he can earn more income via pig-raising and selling grocery items.

For Ratha, this is his second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid his past loan completely. Nowadays, he wants to study a skill (preparing radio and television), and he will spend his entire loan portion to pay his school fee. He hopes that he can earn more income than before after graduating.

loans.use: to pay his school fee

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia Esther, la socia tiene 41 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,perfumes,colonias entre otros, la socia vende  a sus amistades, familiares y clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dúa a su negocio.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de  perfumes para damas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Liderando Las Palmeras communal bank. The member is Esther, who is 41 years old, single, and has 2 children. She works in her business selling cosmetics such as creams, perfumes, and colognes, among others. She sells to her friends, family members, and customers who ask for the items. She wants to be able to continue working in her business, which is going well for her thanks to the dedication that she puts into her business every day. 

She asks for the loan to purchase ladies' perfumes. 

She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. 

This loan is part of one of Arariwa Association's lines of credit, called Credit Yapa. This line of credit is granted to borrowers with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' perfumes.

loans.name: Dora Sulema

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Dora, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, 4 mayores de edad y el menor de 17 años que estudia en colegio, el marido es obrero.
Doña Dora es una muy buena esposa que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la cría de pollos, compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños los mismos que cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para luego llevarlos a los distintos mercados o si no los pela y los vende por libras a vecinos y tiendas de sus localidad, con esto ella se gana lo suyo que les sirve para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 11 años en el Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otros lugares de crédito y por la ayuda que le dan en el grupo. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener salud.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in the parish of La Sequita in Montecristi Canton, a prosperous canton in Manabí known as the birthplace of the "Viejo Luchador" [Old Warrior] Eloy Alfaro and for the famous toquilla straw hats that are valued in Ecuador and abroad.

This is where Dora lives.  She's 49 years old and married, and has five children, four adults and the youngest, 17, who attends school.  Her husband's a laborer.  

Dora's a very good wife who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses.  She earns a living raising chickens.  She buys the animals when they're young and raises them for three or four months until they weigh enough; she then sells them to merchants who buy at her home and sell them in various markets.  Or she plucks them and sells them by the pound to neighbors and stores in her town.  She earns her own money, which helps her make progress.

She's going to use this loan to buy chickens as well as feed and medicine for the chickens so they grow well.

Dora has been in the communal bank for 11 years and she likes it because the interest is lower than with other loans and for the help they give to the group.  Her dreams are to get ahead and to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and medicine for them

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 38 years. She is married to Mbithi and blessed with four school-going children.She has been buying and selling animals for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 


Beth has requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy more goats and sheep for sale.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a plot of land and build her house.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep for sale.

loans.name: Fabiola Ramona

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Buenas Amigas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Fabiola, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 11, 8 y 4 años, los dos mayores estudian en escuela y el menor en inicial. El marido es chofer.
Doña Fabiola es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta realizar sus actividades para poder salir adelante junto su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos, bisuterías  y de ropa interior, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella recorre la ciudad y no tiene horario fijo ni días fijos para salir, deja a crédito y cobra  cada 8 días,   ella viaja a Colombia a comprar su mercadería y tiene más de 4 años dedicada a esta actividad. 
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, bisutería y ropa interior. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son que nunca les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Buenas Amigas communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized nationally and internationally: this is where the world-famous Panama hats come from.

This is where Fabioloa, age 27, lives, along with her husband and their three children, ages 11, 8 and 4 years. The older two children are in school and the youngest is in preschool. Her husband is a driver.

Fabiola is a hard-working woman who likes to do things that help her family get ahead. She is in the business of selling shoes, jewelry, and undergarments. She sells from door to door all over the city, but not on a fixed schedule. She sells to her customers on credit and collects every eight days. When she needs to, she travels to Colombia to buy merchandise. She's been in this business for more than four years.

This loan is to purchase additional merchandise of all kinds. She's been in the loan group since the start, and she likes it because it's how she is able to finance her business. Her dream is that her children will never want for anything.

loans.use: buy shoes, jewelry and undergarments to supply her business

loans.name: Uulai

texts.en:
Uulai is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Economics. Here is her story:

“I have a big family: my parents, three sisters and me. All my sisters are married and live separate from us, they have own children. I am 18 and single. My parents are farmers; we live in the village in Osh region. In summer we go far to the mountains to the pastures, where we raise cows and sheep in order to make them fat and sell them in fall. We also grow potatoes, onions and other vegetables there, what we sell at the market and earn additional money. As you see, my family doesn’t have a stable monthly salary; everything depends on summer weather, mountain water and good harvest. Although my parents are old enough, they are continuing to work at the farm and on the land. It happens because of the lack of higher education. Nobody studied at the university in our family. Therefore, my father wants to educate me although he hasn’t enough money for my tuition.

"I couldn’t concentrate on my studies while studying at school as I had helped my parents with the household. I loved English from school and tried to participate at English Olympiad at the 11th grade, but failed it. After that I tried to enter New Generation Academy of AUCA, as I was told that AUCA provides full scholarship for the 70 brilliant school-leavers from poor families of Kyrgyzstan. I understood that I should try, otherwise I wouldn’t have any chance to enter this prestigious university. I am thankful to this life, what gave me such a wonderful chance to study at the one-year-program at New Generation Academy for free. We completed a rigorous program in English, Kyrgyz, Russian languages, and College Math that are oriented towards developing critical and analytic thinking.

"Thanks to New Generation Academy, I could pass the entering exams that I am a freshman now. I love AUCA. It changed me and my life totally. I will study hard and do my best in order to get bachelor degree in Economics here. I would appreciate, if Kiva lenders could help me in paying the tuition fee.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en: Leatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Leatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children Hajara, Patricia and Kenet.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Leatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Leatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Leatu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To pay for childrens school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Chimwemwe Group

texts.en: Silira is a 42-year-old woman.  She has seven children and looks after seven orphans. She sells utaka (small fish) to people within her trading center. She runs this business in order to financially support her family and to improve her family's living standards.  She requested another loan to develop her business by buying more stock, and this will help her to increase her profits.  She plans to hire someone to assist her in running her business and hopes to buy a plot of land for her family. Accessing loans have helped her to have enough food in her household and to pay school fees for children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Wilma es madre de cinco hijos, con mucho esfuerzo se decidió y se animó a  continuar sus estudios, para así poder llegar a obtener un título académico.
 Su meta es  ayudar a sus hijos  a poder ser personas estudiadas, y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Está estudiando para ser profesora de enseñanza básica, se está esforzando para poder sobresalir y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de la cuota de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Wilma is the mother of five children. With much effort, she decided and was inspired to continue her education so she could get a degree.

Her goal is to help her children to be educated people, and that they don't lack necessary things like she had to experience.

She is studying to be a primary school teacher. She is working hard to be able to better herself and be someone in her life.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in paying the program fees, and in this way be able to continue with her education.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Amanda Noemi

texts.es: Amanda es una señora trabajadora de 45 años de edad vive en el campo y se dedica a la agricultura, ya que esta es la fuente de ingresos para sus 4 hijos, mismos de los cuales 2 están estudiando, Amanda va a invertir el crédito en la comprar de mano de obra, compra de abono y fungicidas para tener sus cultivos sanos, adicionalmente ella se dedica a      preparar la comida para unas monjitas y es otro ingreso mas, Amanda aspira que su negocio crezca y también le gustaría variar con otros productos sus sembríos
texts.en:
Amanda, age 45, is a hardworking woman who lives in the country and works in agriculture. This provides a source of income for her four children, two of whom are studying.

Amanda will invest her loan in labor, compost, and fungicides so that she can have healthy crops. In addition, she prepares food for some nuns as a source of extra income. She aspires to grow her business and would like to produce a variety of other crops.

loans.use: to pay for labor, compost, and fungicides.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hajara joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Nashemiya and Emmanuel.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hajara would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hajara can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Hajara spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una chica a quien le gusta estudiar, y con la ayuda de sus padres logró montar su propio negocio de ventas de ropas y así poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios. 
Está estudiando para ser especialista en habilitación  Pedagógica, y comenta que se  ve ejerciendo su profesión de psicóloga en su propio consultorio y enseñando en el nivel medio y así poder ayudar a la gente de su comunidad.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su curso de especialización, para poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is a young woman who likes to study, and with her parents managed to open her own business selling clothing, and in this way be able to cover the costs of her education. 

She is studying to be a pedagogical specialist and says that she sees herself practicing her profession of psychology in her own consulting office and teaching at the secondary level and in this way be able to help the people in her community.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in paying the fees for her specialist program, to be able to continue with her education as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay program fees.

loans.name: Auwalu

texts.en: Auwalu is a maize farmer from Hana Aiki village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Auwalu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Auwalu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Auwalu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sohiba

texts.ru: Жительнице района Дж.Руми 21 год ее зовут Сохиба. Она замужем и пока не имеет детей. Муж Сохибы находится за приделами страны на заработках. Она живет вместе со свекровью и братом мужа. Сохиба любит животных, и поэтому она занимается животноводством. Сохиба занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота всего один год. Она покупает молодых телят и откармливает их в течение определенного времени и перепродает их на скотном рынке. Сохиба быстро учиться и за столь короткое время она освоила свою работу на отлично. Сохиба обратилась за кредитом, чтоб расширить свою деятельность. Она считает, что набралась опыта и пора продвигать бизнес на новый уровень. Сохиба за счет денег купить несколько молодых телят. Этот кредит поможет ей достичь своей целей и улучшить условий жизни ее семьи.
texts.en: Sohiba is a resident of the J. Rumy district. She is 21 years old, married and does not yet have children. Sohiba's husband works abroad. She lives with her mother-in-law and brother-in-law. Sohiba loves animals and this is why she is involved in animal husbandry. Sohiba has been involved in fattening up cattle for just one year. She buys young calves, fattens them up during a set period of time and resells them at a livestock market. Sohiba learns fast and mastered her work excellently in such a short period of time. Sohiba requested this loan to expand her business. She thinks that she gained experience to move her business to a new level. Sohiba wants to use this money to buy several young calves. This loan will help her achieve her goals and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy several calves in order to expand her business

loans.name: Urozgul

texts.ru: Урозгул вместе с семьей живет на районе Дж.Руми. Ей 51 лет. Она замужем и имеет одного сына. Урозгул как и многие жители республики занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью, Этим видом деятельности она занята более 5 лет. В работе на земле в основном помогает муж и сын.  Урозгул имеет не большую часть земли  где она выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Она готовиться к посеву нового урожая и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Сейчас главная ее цель вспашка земли. Для вспашки она должна нанять трактор, купить топливо и оплатить услуги тракториста. Для оплаты всего этого ей не хватает денежных средств. Урозгул надеется на Вашу помощь и считает что с Вашей помощью она сможет закончить посев и на следующий сезон собрать богатый урожай.
texts.en: Urozgul and her family live in the J. Rumy district. She is 51 years old. She is married and has one son. Urozgul, just like many other residents of the republic, is involved in agriculture. She has been in this business for over 5 years. Her husband and son primarily help her with the farming work. She is preparing to plant a new crop and requested a loan for this reason. Her main goal now is to plow the land. She has to hire a tractor to plow the land, buy fuel and pay for the tractor driver services. She does not have enough money to pay for all of this. Urozgul hopes for Your help and thinks that, with Your help, she will be able to complete her sowing and gather a rich harvest next season.

loans.use: to hire a tractor, pay for fuel and tractor driver services in order to plow land

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Alba es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está cursando el Segundo año de la carrera de Derecho, su meta es recibirse y ejercer su profesión de Abogada, Trabajar de Forma independiente y ayudar a las personas que necesiten de sus Servicios de Abogada 
Sus aspiraciones es ser una Profesional destacada, una abogada de Renombre y siempre ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la cuota de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Alba is from the city of Paraguarí and is in her second year of her law program. Her goal is to qualify and practice her profession as a lawyer, to work independently and help people who need her services as a lawyer. 

Her aspirations are to be a stand-out professional, a renowned lawyer, and always to help her family. 

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in paying the program fees and in this way to be able to continue studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería civil, se está esforzando para poder ser un profesional útil a la sociedad y a si mismo por medio de los conocimiento que va adquiriendo.
Pone su mayor esfuerzo ya que su carrera es muy complicada, pero le gusta mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de sus cuotas y seguir estudiando y luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Luis is from the city of Villarrica, and is studying in the civil engineering program. He is working hard to be able to be a useful professional in society and for himself, through the knowledge he is acquiring. 

He puts forth his best efforts since his major is very complicated, but he likes it a lot.

He asks for this loan to cover the expenses of his payments and to continue studying and fighting for his goal.

loans.use: to cover payment expenses.

loans.name: Zoila Magdalena

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Buenas Amigas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 54 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo cinco hijos mayores de edad, una de ellos estudia enfermería y es la que aun vive con ella.
Doña Zoila es una mujer muy trabajadora que le toco muy duro para salir adelante y más después de la muerte de su marido, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado por libras y enteros si sus clientes así lo prefieren, todos los días en la madrugada se va hasta las playas de Manta a comprar  a los pescadores que llegan de alta mar y luego se desplaza Picoaza, Los Bajos y otros lugares  vendiendo el pescado, ella tiene su propio carro en el cual realiza sus ventas, ya son más de 20 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Crédito Buenas Amigas meets every two weeks in the canton of Montecristi. It is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its craftsmanship that is recognized nationally and internationally. It is the place of the famous straw hats (Panama hats).

Zoila lives in this place. She is 54 years old. Some years ago her husband died and she was left a widow. She has five adult children from the relationship. One of them is studying nursing and still lives with her.

Zoila is a hardworking woman who struggled to get ahead after the death of her husband. She works selling fish by the pound and whole if her customers prefer it. Every day at dawn she goes to the beaches of Manta to buy from the fishermen that come in from offshore and later she goes to Picoaza, Los Bajos and other places selling the fish. She has her own car in which she makes the sales. She has more than 20 years experience at this activity which permits her to get ahead.

This loan is to buy fish. She has been with the Grupo De Crédito since it started and she likes it because the loans permit her to get ahead. Her dream is to stay healthy.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 38 años de edad, es casada. Su familia es unida, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Habitada por gente sencilla y amable que se dedica principalmente a la pesca artesanal, ganadería y agricultura.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pollo, verduras y abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos), desde hace casi tres años de manera continua, cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos, patos, gallinas, entre otros. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, para aumentar el stock de su tienda, con esto Lucia espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y preferencias, lo que le generará un mayor nivel de ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia, 38, is married. Her family is close, and she lives in her own home with her husband and their children in the district of Lagunas, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Modest and kind people live there, and they make a living primarily through artisanal fishing, ranching, and farming.

Lucia makes a living by selling chicken, vegetables, and groceries such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and noodles. She has done this work for three years and she has established customers who provide her with good personal and professional references. She also works by raising and selling small animals such as turkeys, ducks, chickens, and more. This loan will be used to buy a large quantity of products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and other items to stock up her shop. With this loan, Lucia hopes to offer her customers a wider variety of products to satisfy their tastes and preferences. This will generate more income and will improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and other items to stock up her shop.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Listening to Edwin refer to the different breeds of dairy cows on his compound, one could mistake him for an Agricultural Extension Officer. Edwin, from Kapsowar, a remote town in Kenya, is an active and progressive farmer in his locality. He has a wife and 2 children, and together they live on a small piece of land.

Traditionally, Edwin's primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crop cultivation, and personal business. He has been farming for the past 10 years. Over so much time, Edwin has been able to gain a great amount of experience, so that now he is always ranked the best farmer in his village.

Kenyans drink a lot of milk. This tradition is probably derived from tribal culture, particularly in the Nandi tribe (Edwin’s tribe), where cows represent wealth. Demand for dairy milk has been high, and Edwin wants to take advantage of the market. Therefore, Edwin is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is profitable in Kenya, and Edwin has already identified the breed of dairy cow that he wants to purchase.

Edwin always says that to become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and the keenness to learn from successful farmers. As well, Edwin has planted so many trees that food for the dairy cows will never be a problem.

Marketing of the milk and other dairy products will not be a challenge because Edwin will sell the milk both directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. With his loan Edwin will not only benefit from milk sales but also the cows' manure. He will use it to improve the fertility of his farm's soil, thus saving money that would have otherwise been spent on fertilizer. Edwin has been facing challenges in accessing financing, but he feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva, are there to make his dream come true.

Edwin chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate is not only low but also calculated on a reducing balance. Edwin underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training season he learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. With his accumulated profits Edwin plans to permanently improve his living conditions and secure the future of his school-aged children by paying their tuition fees. He also plans to buy more dairy cows, build a bio-gas digester, and hence save costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Zubaydullo

texts.en: Zubaydullo was born in 1985 year. He is married and has two children. He is a very hardworking man. He has worked for more than eight years in a local school as a teacher. He is in higher education. Zubaydullo is a very careful father of his children. He uses his salary to provide his family with all the necessary things. He needs financial support because his mother is ill and he must buy medicines for her treatment. He is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy medicines for his mother’s treatment. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for the treatment of his mother

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is 27 years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 1 and 6 years, and one of them goes to school.

He has a shop and has been in a business for 4 years. With the loan, he would like to buy rice, sugar and salt to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and salt to resell

loans.name: Karen Estefany

texts.es:
Karen, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para invertir en arroz, maíz, frijoles, quesillo, harina, condimentos, aceite, etc., para tener materia prima suficiente para responder a las nuevas demandas de sus clientes y mantener la venta de pupusas y antojitos en el mercado, ella ve que los créditos le están ayudando mucho a superarse.
Con el financiamiento anterior ha aumentado la productividad, tiene nuevos clientes y ha cancelado sus deudas. Su familia se mantiene pero actualmente han mejorado su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Karen wants a new loan in order to invest in rice, corn, beans, cheese, flour, condiments, oil, etc, to have enough prime material to fulfill her customers' new demands and to maintain the sale of pupusas and street foods in her shop. 

She sees how the loans are really helping her to improve herself. With the last loan she increased productivity, found new customers, and paid off her debts. Her family is maintained and has improved their own lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in rice, corn, beans, cheese, flour, condiments, oil, etc, to have enough prime ingredients to fulfill new demands

loans.name: Felipa Del Carmen

texts.es: La ferretería de Doña Felipa siempre se ha mantenido surtida durante los 25 años que la tenido en pie. Su esposo ha sido su principal ayuda junto con los financiamientos adquiridos por parte MiCrédito-KIVA. Esta vez solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar diversas herramientas ferreteras. De esta manera mantener surtido el negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta obtener un local propio y mejor acondicionado ya que actualmente está alquilando el local donde tiene el negocio.
texts.en: Doña Felipa's hardware store has always remained stocked during the 25 years it has been standing. Her husband has been her main support along with the finances acquired from MiCrédito-KIVA. This time, she is asking for a new loan to buy various hardware tools. In this way she will keep her business stocked and satisfy client demand. In her future plans is to obtain her own premises and better air-conditioned, since right now she is renting the premises where she has the business.

loans.use: To buy various hardware tools

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two schoolchildren living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Khorn is 30 years old.

Because she has to make her living, she grows rice as a single source of income to support her family's conditions. This is the fifth loan cycle for Khorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully paid back her past loans wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. She leads a group of two to get a new loan.

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her farmland well and get more yields than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm

loans.name: Rit's Group

texts.en: A farmer from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Rit is 43 years old and a mother of three children. She grows rice as her main source of income and raises pigs to supplement her income. This is the eighth loan for Rit with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She leads a group of two members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay the harvesting fee and buy pig feed. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay the harvesting fee and buy pig feed.

loans.name: Olaya Georgina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Olaya, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijos de 25, 21 y 19 años de edad, el menor de ellos estudia en colegio  y es el que aun  vive en su casa. 
Doña Olaya es una mujer muy trabajadora que tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí  vende toda clase de víveres, legumbres, carnes, etc. también vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), productos que vende en su casa y también sale a recorrer,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, su  hijo le ayuda en su negocio cuando está desocupado, ella lleva más de 4 años con su tienda y con sus productos de Yanbal mucho más tiempo, así se gana la vida honestamente.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda del grupo. Sus sueños son aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in the parish of La Sequita in Montecristi Canton, a prosperous canon in Manabí, known as the birthplace of the "Viejo Luchador" [Old Warrior] Eloy Alfaro and for the famous toquilla straw hats that are valued in Ecuador and abroad.

This is where Olaya lives.  She's 42 years old and is the single mother of three children, ages 25, 21, and 19, the youngest of whom is in high school and still lives at home.

Olaya's a very hardworking woman who has a grocery store in her home where she sells all types of provisions, vegetables, meat, etc.  She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She sells at home and also goes out to sell.  She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m.  Her son helps her in the business when he's not busy.  She has had her store for more than four years and has sold Yanbal a lot longer, and she earns an honest living that way.

She's going to use this loan to buy provisions, perfume, creams, and cosmetics.

Olaya has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help from the group.  Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy provisions, perfume, creams, and cosmetics

loans.name: Razmik

texts.en:
Razmik is 73 years old and he lives in the village Arajadzor of the Syunik region. Razmik is married and he has two sons and a daughter; all of them are happily married, and they live separately with their families. Razmik’s wife is unemployed now, but for many years she worked as an accountant. 

Razmik has a specialty of electrician, and he has 42 years of work experience in this field. Now he also works as an electrician at a private company. 

Razmik, besides of being perfect master in his work, is also a good farmer. He has a large plot of land on which he cultivates beans, cabbage, tomato, cucumber and potato. His orchard is nicely coloured by apple, pear and mulberry trees. All these goods he sells at the city’s wholesale market with the help of his beloved wife. 

Razmik is asking for this loan because he decided to buy a plot of land and a lot of potato seedlings in order to enlarge his potato cultivation since its sale is greatly profitable.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land and a lot of potato seedlings in order to enlarge his potato cultivation since its sale is greatly profitable

loans.name: Sam At

texts.en:
Sam At (pictured) is 46 years old and lives in Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She had been married since 1989, has two sons and one daughter. They are still young.

Sam At is a weaver and has twenty years of experience, while her husband is a constructor with ten years of experience. She would like to apply for a loan to purchase materials for her house construction. Nowadays, she has an old house so she wants to get a new house. She said that she is going to pay back to Maxima.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her house construction

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en: Jomar is 23 year-old and single. He lives with his parents in a rural community and helps them in gaining income through buying and reselling mom-ma and fruits within the public market. He aims continue and improve this business but he has limited capital. For this reason, Jomar wants to access financial assistance of PHP 20,000 to buy mom-ma, beetle nuts, tobacco and fruits to resell. Through hard work and strong determination, Jomar believes that he will be able to improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy mom-ma, beetle nuts, tobacco and fruits to resell

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Corazón de Jesús está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y también están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de que cada una mejore sus condiciones de vida.
Ramona, una de las integrantes de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de prendas varias, que hace de manera ambulante y a través del cual ayuda a su familia por medio de sus ingresos. Ramona comenta que pese a que la vida esta difícil, ella pone su mejor esfuerzo para tener una mejor calidad de vida que ofrecer a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de remeras, short, camisillas, pantalón, pollera, toallas, etc., de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y tener mejores ingresos, para superar su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
The group called Corazón de Jesús is in its second loan cycle in the women's committee program where they all work and also are in the poverty elimination program, as a means through which each one improves her living conditions.

Ramona, one of the members of this group, works selling a variety of clothing, which she does as a street vendor and through which she helps her family with her income. Ramona says that despite it being a difficult life, she puts forth her best effort to have a better quality of life to offer her loved ones.  

She asks for this loan to purchase t-shirts, shorts, shirts, pants, polleras [traditional skirts], towels, etc. in order to continue with her sales and have more income, to overcome her poverty situation.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, shorts, shirts, pants, polleras [traditional skirts], towels, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace varios años, quiere mejorar su vivienda repellado las paredes y cambiando el techo, pero con lo que gana no de alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar cemento, arena, laminas, polines y pago de mano obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Julia is 31 years old and lives in her own house with her 2 children and her husband.  She has worked for several years selling seafood.  She wants to improve her home by plastering the walls and changing the roof, but with what she earns she does not make enough to carry it out.  

For this reason, she is asking for a loan to buy cement, sand, sheet metal, poles and to pay for labour in order that her family can live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, sheet metal, poles and to pay for labour

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en: Moureen is a 24-year-old married woman who lives in Kagadi, Uganda, where she operates a grocery to earn income to support her family. She is honest. Her dream is to grow her grocery into a supermarket, though she is challenged by competition, leading to income instabilities. Moureen is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, bread and sugar for selling.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread and sugar for selling.

loans.name: Isabel Teresita

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Buenas Amigas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Isabel, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad,  uno de ellos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
Doña Isabel con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sobrecamas, edredones, entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Lleva más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, sabanas, edredones y todo de lo que ella vende. Lleva más de 6 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Crédito Buenas Amigas meets every two weeks in the canton of Montecristi. It is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its craftsmanship that is recognized nationally and internationally. It is the place of the famous straw hats (Panama hats).

Isabel lives here. She is 61 years old. She is married and from this relationship has three adult children. One of them still lives with her. Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

Isabel, with the intention of earning something on her own and being able to get ahead in the home, sells all types of clothing, bedspreads, and quilts among other things. She sells from door to door and also sells from home when her well-known customers stop by.

She sells on credit and collects every two weeks. She goes to Guayaquil every other week or once a month to buy the merchandise she needs. She has been doing this activity for more than ten years and it is going well.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as clothing, bed sheets, quilts, and everything that she sells. She has been with the Grupo De Crédito for six cycles and she likes it because of the support of the loans they give. Her dream is to have a facility.

loans.use: to buy clothing, bed sheets, quilts, etc.

loans.name: Paola Isabel

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Buenas Amigas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Aquí vive la señora Paola, tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su marido es chofer y comerciante
Doña Paola realiza el crédito  para su esposo y para ella, ellos se dedican al comercio y tienen un carro en el cual realiza fletes cuando algún cliente lo requiere, los dos salen a vender ropa de todo tipo por la localidad, ellos también en su casa tienen un negocio de venta de aguas, colas y otras bebidas, de esta forma ellos se ganan la vida trabajando todos los días para tratar de darles lo mejor a sus hijos. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, aguas, colas y otras bebidas que ellos venden. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Buenas Amigas communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts, which are renown at a national and international level. It is the place of the famous straw hats. 

Here lives Paola who is 27 years old, in a common-law marriage, and from this relationship has two children, ages 6 and 2; the older one goes to school Her husband is a driver and salesperson. 

Paola takes out the loan for her husband and for herself. They work in sales and have a car in which they transport cargo when a customer needs it. The two go out to sell all sorts of clothing in the neighborhood. They also have a business selling water, soft drinks, and other drinks in their house, and in this way they earn their living working every day to try to give their children the best. 

This loan is to purchase clothing, water, soft drinks, and other drinks that they sell. She has been with this communal bank since the beginning and likes it for the help that the loans give her. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, bottled water, soft drinks and other drinks.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza is a strong woman. She is single, and she rents a house to live in.

For about one-and-a-half years Shahnoza has had a beauty salon business. She started her business in the city. She got a lot of clients from small towns. After some period of time, she decided to open a salon in a small town. There were more clients than in the city. 

Shahnoza decided to enlarge her business. She is planning to buy wedding dresses for brides and some materials for her beauty salon. Shahnoza is asking for financial support to widen her activity.

loans.use: To buy wedding dresses and some materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
San Expedito es un grupo muy unido, donde todas las integrantes decidieron ayudarse para poder mejorar por medio del programa de comité de mujeres, y también haciendo la encuesta de la eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Grecia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir, que está en un nivel medio, o amarillo, donde ella con su trabajo y las capacitaciones que recibe podrá ir mejorando, sumado a través de la venta de joyas de plata que ella hace. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, que se esmera y esfuerza.
La Sra. Grecia solicita de este préstamo para la compra joyas de plata para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
San Expedito is a very close group, where all the members decided to help themselves to be able to improve through the women's committee program and also by completing the poverty elimination questionnaire. 

One of the members is Grecia, who in her last questionnaire showed a poverty level within level two, which is to say that she is in a middle, or yellow, level, where with her work and the training that she gets, she can continue improving, adding to it through the sale of silver jewelry that she does. She is a very hard-working woman, who takes great pains and tries hard.

Grecia asks for this loan to purchase silver jewelry to sell, which will help her to have a concrete business plan, which will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase silver jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en: Idris is a maize farmer from Hana Aiki village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Idris had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Idris can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Idris, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Esther would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Esther can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Esther, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jovenes Del Barrio Florida Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Caaguazú son 9  jóvenes que se unieron con el objetivo de poder empezar a trabajar y salir adelante para ayudar a sus familias. Ellos están muy entusiasmados ya que podrán ayudar con los ingresos de la casa, y de esa forma poder sentirse útiles.
Una de estas jóvenes es Natalia, quien tiene 19 años, cuenta que está trabajando en venta de ropas y calzados. Ella es una joven de muy buena familia, todos son muy trabajadores, y quiere poder seguir el ejemplo que sus papas le dieron, y de esa forma poder ayudarles y que se sientan orgullosos de ella. 
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas y calzados varios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Caaguazú; they are 9 young people who got together with the objective to be able to work and get ahead to help their families. They are very excited since they will be able to help their households with their incomes, and in this way feel useful. 

One of these young people is Natalia, who is 19 years old. She says that she is working selling clothing and shoes. She is a young woman from a very good family, all are very hard-working, and she wants to be able to follow the example her parents have given her, and in this way to be able to help them and make them proud of her. 

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of a variety of clothing and shoes. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting and it will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Talatu

texts.en: Talatu is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Talatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Talatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Talatu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Esperanza se unió en la ciudad de Caaguazú, son 17 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que quieren dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lina  quien en su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró que ha mejorado bastante. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles y, por medio de ello ayuda a su familia con los medios que obtiene a través de su trabajo. También se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones a las integrantes y las incentivan a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Lina pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder hacer su comidas, como ser verduras, carne, pollo, y demás, para seguir con su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called Esperanze met in the city of Caaguazú. They are 17 very hard-working and determined women who want to give their families everything they were not able to have. They are in the poverty elimination program which allows them to know the life situation of each one. 

One of the members is Lina, who in her poverty elimination questionnaire showed that she had improved quite a bit. She works selling food and, with this, she helps her family with the means of what she gets through her work. The work of Fundación Paraguaya should also be noted, which provides constant support in training and checks on the participants, and motivates them to fight to be able to overcome the poverty. 

Lina asks for this loan to purchase supplies to be able to make her food, such as vegetables, meat, chicken and more, to continue with her microenterprise.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make food such as vegetables, meat, chicken and more.

loans.name: Hermis

texts.es:
La señora  Hermis de 23  años  de edad es soltera, vive con sus padres  no tiene  casa  propia ni tiene hijos que dependan  de ella, se dedica desde hace 03  años al negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos.
Doña Hermis es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de blusas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, camisas, calcetines, etc. para surtir  su negocio. Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando para salir adelante es su tercer préstamo que solicita a Prisma.
 Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Hermis is 23 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents.  She does not have her own home or children that depend on her.  For the past three years she has been in the business of selling clothes and shoes.

Hermis is a working woman with a desire to succeed.  She is requesting a loan to buy blouses, dresses, skirts, pants, shirts, socks, etc. for her business. With the support of this loan, she aims to improve her income and keep working to get ahead.

This is her third loan application to Prisma.  is dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, dresses, skirts, pants, shirts, socks, etc for her business.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
El Sr. Amado es una persona muy trabajadora, esta es su carta operación con kiva, y comenta que cada préstamo le ha sido muy útil y le ha permitido ir mejorando poco a poco. El tiene una despensa en la que trabaja arduamente, siempre buscando poder mejorar.
El pide este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser bebidas, lácteos, panificados, embutidos y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Amado is a very hardworking person.  This is his fourth transaction with Kiva.  He said that each loan has been useful to him and has allowed him to keep on improving little by little.  He has a grocery store where he works hard, always trying to improve.

He's requesting this new loan so he can buy various supplies for his store, including beverages, dairy products, baked goods, canned goods, and other things.  With this he'll be able to keep on making sales and striving to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, canned goods, and other products

loans.name: Koe Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Koe Pora está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Villa Ygatimi, la cual es una zona que aun se encuentra en crecimiento.  Por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Carmen es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la cría de animales, comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero que lo hace para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que no pudieron tener. Ella quiere poder tener algún día una granja con muchos animales.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar más animales para la cría, y también balanceados. Agradece por esa oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Koe Pora group is in its first loan cycle in the women's committee program. It is from the city of Villa Ygatimi, which is in a zone that is still in development. For this reason, the members of this group want to fight to continue developing and give the zone where they live a better environment and that it grows slowly.

Carmen is one of the members. She works raising animals, and says that the work is very demanding, but she does it to be ale to give her loved ones everything that they couldn't have. She wants to be able to one day have a farm with many animals. 

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase more animals to raise and also balanced animal feed. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is getting and it will be a lot of help to her.

loans.use: to purchase animals to raise and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica desde hace 30 años a la crianza de cerdos y los comercializa en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas cerdos y concentrado para continuar con la crianza y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Teresa is 53 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. For 30 years she has raised pigs and sells them in the area surrounding her zone. With the proceeds from the sales she can pay some of the household expenses. She seeks a loan to buy more pigs and feed concentrate in order to continue raising her animals and in this way have improved income.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed concentrate.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: Jose de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposa, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero desde hace 40 años adicional a eso también se dedica al cultivo de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados y ya tiene clientes fijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que le genera buenas ganancias y así podrá tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 63 years old and lives in his own house with his son and wife.  For 40 years, he has made a living raising dairy cows.  In addition, he also makes a living cultivating corn.  He sells his products in different markets and he now has regular clients.  He is requesting a loan to purchase a dairy cow to be able to continue his work, as it generates him a good profit.  This way, he will be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of energy-saving Jikos.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María, de 46 años de edad, estudió hasta 5° grado, ya que sus padres no pudieron ayudarle, por falta de recursos económicos. Es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y solo uno vive con ella.

Desde muy temprana edad María, ayudaba a sus padres en la siembra de maíz.- También, criaban ganado, cerdos y gallinas. 

Actualmente, siembra maíz y frijol.- Además, continua criando ganado con ayuda de su hijo, de esta forma, logran obtener ingresos para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.

El crédito será invertido para comprar ganado de repasto.- De esta forma podrá tener ingresos, cuando realice la venta del ganado.

El sueño de María, es mejorar su vivienda y solo podrá lograrlo trabajando muy duro, como hasta hoy lo ha hecho.
texts.en: María is 46 years old and completed a 5th grade education, as her parents could help her study more due to lack of economic resources. She is a single mother of 3 children, only one of whom lives with her. From a young age Maria helped her parents with the corn planting. They also raised cattle, pigs, and chickens. Today, she grows corn and beans. in addition, she continues raising cattle with the help of her son. In this way she is able to obtain income to cover her household expenses. The loan will be used to buy grazing cattle. In this way she will be able to have income upon selling the cattle. Maria's dream is to improve her home and only she will be able to achieve this by working very hard, as she has done up until today.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Sarin, 42, is a farmer living in Kampong Cham province and a mother of three children. To tackle her family’s hardships, she earns an income via rice cropping and cassava growing. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. For Sarin, this is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. She will spend her loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her living so it is better than before.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer to support her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Cristina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cristina, de 30 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, está acompañada, su compañera de vida es comerciante y tienen 4 hijos, solo tres estudian. 

Cristina, es una mujer con deseos de superación, desde que se acompañó, se dedicó a realizar las labores del hogar y cuidar de sus hijos. 

Hace dos años Cristina, con el objetivo de ayudar con los gastos del hogar, inicio a trabajar en la venta de sorbetes en su casa. 

Cada 8 días, surte su negocio con estos productos y de ésta forma ha ayudado a su compañero con los gastos del hogar.

El crédito será invertido para comprar más sorbetes para la venta, de ésta manera podrá ofrecer más variedad en su negocio y continuar ayudando con los gastos.

El sueño  de Cristina es, mejorar la calidad de vida su familia, mejorar su vivienda y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en: Cristina is 30 years old and completed a 9th grade education. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have 4 children, 3 are in school. Cristina is a woman with the desire to be successful. Since she married, she has worked taking care of the home and the children. Two years ago Cristina, with the goal of helping with the household expenses, began to work selling sorbets from her home. Every 8 days she stocks her business with these products and in this way has helped her husband with the household expenses. The loan will be used to buy more sorbets to sell, in this way she will be able to offer a greater variety in her business and continue helping with the expenses. Cristina's dream is to improve the quality of life for her family, improving her home, and helping her children be successful.

loans.use: to buy more sorbets for her business.

loans.name: Abdulhamidu

texts.en:
Abdulhamidu is a maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yako village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdulhamidu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulhamidu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Abdulhamidu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ygatimi Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado YGATIMI se formo en la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi, el cual es de una zona eminentemente rural, que aun está en crecimiento, y donde las integrantes luchan por un mejor acceso a medios que permitan seguridad a sus familias.
La Sra. Pablina es una de las integrantes, ella cría animales de corral, como ser gallinas, patos, cerdos y demás. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que con mucho sacrificio ha podido dar a su familia lo que necesitan.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de animales para la cría y también balanceados para los animales. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called YGATIMI was formed in the city of Villa Ygatimi, which is in a strongly rural zone, which is still developing and where the members fight to have better access to the means with which to provide security to their families. 

Pablina is one of the members, she raises small animals, such as hens, ducks, pigs and others. She is a very hard-working and determined woman who, with a lot of sacrifices, has been able to give her family what they need.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of animals to raise and also balanced animal feed. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is getting that will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase animals to raise and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité “3 de mayo”  está formado con 19 señoras que poseen  diversas actividades comerciales, pero también se ayudan las unas a las otras, para que por medio de actividades en conjunto vayan mejorando sus vidas.
Laura es parte de este grupo, ella hace manicura y trabajo de pies, es muy buena en lo que hace, por lo que ya se hizo de muy buena clientela. Es una persona que quiere salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos, es por ello que pone todo de si para abrirse camino.
Pide este préstamo, ya que con el podrá comprar esmaltes, alicates, limas y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo, dando un buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "3 de mayo" committee is made up of 19 women who have diverse commercial work but also help each other, so that through these jobs, together they can improve their lives. 

Laura is part of this group. She does manicures and foot work. She is very good at what she does, so she has a very good client base. She is a person who wants to get ahead and help her loved ones, and for this she puts her whole being into making her way. 

She asks for this loan, since with it she will be able to purchase nail polish, clippers, files, and more, with which she will be able to continue with her work, providing good customer service.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, clippers, files, and other things to do manicures and work on the feet.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Doña Marisol siempre buscando el bienestar de se su familia ha decidido ampliar su vivienda ya que sus hijos van creciendo y necesitan mas espacio y privacidad por lo que ha estado realizando remo delaciones.
este crédito lo quiere para la compra de cemento, puerta, ventanas, arena para completar de cerrar el anexo construido, Agradece el apoyo que se la ha brindado y la confianza que han depositado ya que ella espera seguir trabajando con los financiamientos y completar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Marisol is always looking after the wellbeing of her family. She has decided to grow her home since her children are growing and they need more space and privacy. Therefore, she has been carrying out remodeling.

She wants this loan to buy cement, a door, windows, sand to complete closing the constructed annex. She is thankful for the support that has been provided and the confidence you've deposited since she wishes to continue working with the loans and completing her dreams.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: María Marta

texts.es:
María de 45 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 24 años de edad que está acompañado y él y su pareja trabajan. Ella estudió hasta 2nd grado de educación básica y de sus ingresos no depende nadie pero está dispuesta siempre a ayudar a su hijo con los gastos de su familia.
María es comerciante, vende productos de catálogos y cuenta con mas de 5 años de experiencia trabajando de esta manera, aprendió gracias a una amiga que le consiguió el contacto con los vendedores y le enseño el oficio. Antes se dedicaba a lavar ropa a quien la buscara, su trabajo lo hace diariamente, recorre cerca de 5 kilómetros porque lo hace casa por casa en las colonias cercanas, nadie más se involucra en esta actividad, es su única fuente de trabajo y lo hace de 6:00 am a 10:00 am.
Solicita el préstamo para cancelar un pedido de productos, ella tiene que cancelar por adelantado y quiere aprovecha la época navideña que es cuando hay mejores ofertas que ofrece a los clientes y es cuando más se vende. Sueña con crecer en su negocio y trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
María, 45, is single and has a son aged 24 who is partnered; he and his partner work. She studied until second grade of basic education and no one depends on her income but she is always able to help her son with the family expenses.

María is a merchant - she sells products from catalogs and has more than five years' experience working in this manner. She learned thanks to a friend who got her a contact with the sellers and taught her this trade. Before, she worked washing clothing for those who looked for her. She does her work daily - she travels close to 5 kilometers because she does it house by house in the nearby neighborhoods. No one else is involved in this activity; it is her only source of work and she does it from 6:00 AM to 10:00 AM.

She is applying for this loan to pay off an order or products. She wants to pay it off early and wants to take advantage of the Christmas season, which is when there are better sales that she offers to her customers and it's when she sells the most. She dreams of growing her business and working with her own capital.

loans.use: to pay off an order of products.

loans.name: Ismudin

texts.ru:
Исмудин мужчина 50 лет , женат , отец четырех детей. Он получил неполное высшее образование,так как во время учебы был уже женат и ему нужно было работать и зарабатывать деньги.Он на учатске земли начал заниматься выращиванием овощей и через несколько лет на средства,полученные от продажи товара,купил несколько голов домашнего скота.Сейчас у него на 15 баранов ,который он откармливает и продаёт . В его делах ему помогает старший сын.Ко всему он ухаживает больные родители,которые живут с ним.Исмудин единственный сын в семье ,поэтому ему приходится работать на нескольких работах,чтобы обеспечивать свою семью.
Он обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом,так как хочет закупить корм для скота на зиму.Исмудин заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за доверие и помощь в трудные времена.
texts.en:
Ismudin is a 50-year old man, married and the father of four. He did not finish his college education since he got married during his studies and need to work and earn a living. He started growing vegetables on his land plot and, a few years later, used the revenue from his sales to buy several heads of livestock. At present he has 15 sheep for fattening and resale. His eldest son helps him in this business. Ismudin also takes care of his ailing parents, who live in his home. Ismudin is the only son in the family, which is why he has to work several jobs in order to support his relatives.

Ismudin has applied to the Arvand microfinance institution for a loan in order to buy animal feed for winter. He thanks Arvand in advance for its trust and help in difficult times.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a maize farmer from Bature village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yakubu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yako village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ahmed would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ahmed can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ahmed, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Rubiela

texts.es:
Maria Rubiela es una cariñosa dama de 61 años de edad, que en al año 2012 inicio empíricamente su negocio de venta de alimentos los cuales realiza desde su hogar, es madre de dos hijos ya ellos mayores de edad. 
Sus habilidades culinarias que adquirió a lo largo de su vida le dieron toda la experiencia para elaborar ricos alimentos y los dos años que lleva son un impulso motivacional muy grande para seguir realizando su actividad en la que espera que le ayudes prestándole un poco de capital para la compra un molino eléctrico nuevo, e insumos para elaborar su comidas esperando un gran año 2015 en el que pueda generar empleo.
texts.en:
Maria Rubiela is a caring woman who is 61 years old.  In 2012, she used her life experience to start her business selling food, which she operates from her house.  She is the mother of two children who are now older.

Her cooking skills that she acquired over the course of her life gave her all of the experience to make delicious food, and the two years that she has spent have been a large motivational push for her to continue carrying out her profession.  She hopes that you will help her by loaning a small amount of capital to purchase a new electric mill and provisions to make her foods.  She is hoping for a great year in 2015 in which she can generate employment.

loans.use: to purchase a new electric mill and provisions to continue running her business

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama San Sebastian, es un grupo antiguo y solido, la integran 17 mujeres con espíritu emprendedor y sentido de solidaridad, se encuentran en el 5° ciclo, y manifiestan entusiasmo e interés por continuar trabajando de manera cooperativa.
Entre estas mujeres trabajadoras, se destaca la señora Dionicia, trabaja en su propia casa, tiene una despensa bien surtida, fabrica masitas dulces, tortas, postres y las vende en su negocio y  también hace por pedido para eventos. También  cría animales, cuida a sus hijos y realiza todos los quehaceres de la casa. Es una señora muy guapa, carismática y entusiasta.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder surtir su negocio con verduras, bebidas, carne, frutas y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The bank is called San Sebastián.  It's an old and strong group made up of 17 women of enterprising spirit and a sense of solidarity.  They're in their fifth loan cycle and they're enthusiastically interested in continuing to work cooperatively.

Dionicia stands out among these hardworking women.  She works at home in a well-stocked general store.  She makes "masitas dulces" [petits fours], cakes, and desserts and sells them in her business as well as on request for events.  She also raises animals, takes care of her children, and does all the housework.  She's a very attractive, charismatic, and enthusiastic woman.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of products to stock her business with vegetables, beverages, meat, fruit, and other things.

Dionicia's grateful for this opportunity to be able to keep on growing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, beverages, meat, fruit, and other products

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 43-year-old farmer who wants to start commercial poultry farming in Kipsaina, a village in the Kitale area of Kenya. The father of six has been in the farming business for over a decade, keeping poultry and cattle and growing maize and other crops. Fredrick enjoys farming. The few poultry he currently keeps are enough to supply his family with eggs all year. The few times they ended up with more than they wanted, they sold door-to-door or at the farm's gate.

Fredrick is seeking a loan to venture into commercial poultry farming. He is planning to use the chickens for eggs and meat, and he will raise his own chicks.
