The male chicks will be raised for meat, while the female will be kept for egg production, to be sold at the market. The income Fredrick makes from this investment will not only go toward loan repayment but also business and personal expenses. He strives to provide the best for his family in order to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy poultry to venture into commercial poultry farming.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 28 years old. She is married with one two-year-old child. She has a shop and has been in business for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, biscuits and cooking oil to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more rice, biscuits and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Rory tiene 19 integrantes, donde cada una de ellas está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para ir mejorando sus vidas. Están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder mejorar su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lisa, quien es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a ser peluquera, y por medio de su trabajo su familia recibe los medios para poder tener una vida sin privaciones. Lisa quiere seguir creciendo y algún dia poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y demás, de manera a poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Kuña Rory group has 19 members, where each one of them is putting forth her best effort to improve their lives. In addition, they are in the poverty elimination program, which allows them to know the life situation of each one and, according to it, be able to improve their poverty situation. 

One of the members is Lisa who is part of this group. She works as a stylist, and through her work, her family gets the means to be able to have a life without deprivation. Lisa wants to continue growing and someday be able to give other people jobs.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase supplies for her beauty salon, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and more, so as to be able to continue providing good customer service.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and more.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Rosa, es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está en el  ciclo número 4° del programa de comité de mujeres, cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien hace comidas variadas para la venta, ella se levanta todos los días desde muy tempranas horas para poder hacer sus comidas y luego venderlas. Ella es una muy buena cocinera, es por eso que le va muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, verduras y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar cada día más.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa group is from the city of Encarnación; it is in its 4th loan cycle with the women's committee program, each one puts forth her best effort to be able to grow and get ahead.

One of the members is Lidia who makes a variety of dishes to sell. She gets up every day at a very early hour to be able to make her dishes and later sell them. She is a very good cook, so it is going very well for her.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of supplies to be able to make her dishes such as meat, seasonings, vegetables and more, with which she will be able to continue working, fighting to improve more each day.

loans.use: to purchase meat, seasonings, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fertilize a pineapple crop.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito San José. 
En este lugar vive don Luis, tiene 36 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 14 y 8 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposa es comerciante.
El señor Luis es un hombre muy trabajador que hace lo necesario para darles a su familia lo mejor, el tiene un taller en el cual arregla todo tipo de artefactos eléctricos,  día a día el recibe muchos trabajos y su clientela lo prefiere porque él es muy cumplido con su labor, el allí también vende ciertos repuestos que necesita para su trabajo para lo cual utiliza parte del crédito, la otra parte es para su mujer la cual es la encargada del bar en una escuela de localidad, allá allí vende jugos y alimentos  nutritivos para los niños, el lleva más de 15 años con este trabajo el cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar varios repuestos que necesita y víveres para preparar los alimentos que su mujer vende. Lleva más de más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank San José meets every fifteen days in the 24 de Mayo canton of the Manabí province. This area is known for its beautiful landscape, its forests, the fauna variety, and for its kind, hardworking people who make a living in agriculture and ranching. This is where Luis lives.

Luis is 36 years old and married. From this relationship he has three children, 15, 14, and eight years old, all of whom go to school. His wife is a merchant.

He is a hardworking man who does all necessary to give his family the best. He has a repair shop for all kinds of electric appliances. Every day he gets a lot of customers who prefer him because he does very good work. He also sells in the shop certain spare parts needed for his work.

Luis is using a portion of the loan for the spare parts, and the rest for his wife who is in charge of a local school cafeteria where she sells juices and nutritional food for children. He's done this work for over 15 years, and it allows them to get ahead.

This loan is to buy several spare parts he needs, and to buy provisions to prepare the food that his wife sells. 

He's been with the communal bank for over four years and he likes it because of the favorable loan terms. He dreams of giving his children the best.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and food supplies.

loans.name: Erick Adali

texts.es:
Erick de 20 años de edad, estudió hasta 4°grado de educación básica, está acompañado y tiene una hija de un año de edad, vive en la casa de sus suegros pero solo su pareja e hija dependen de él.

Erick es agricultor pero también es empleado de una cooperativa y está encargado del mantenimiento del cultivo de café en el que realiza las labores que el cultivo requiere en su determinado tiempo.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y pagar mano de obra para construir su casa y pasarse a vivir con su familia. Erick espera en un futuro tener una buena casa para dar la comodidad y seguridad su familia merece.
texts.en:
Erick, 20 years old, went to school up to fourth grade. He is partnered and has a 1-year-old daughter. He lives in his in-laws' house but only his partner and daughter depend on him. 

Erick is a farmer but he also is employed in a cooperative and is in charge of caring for the coffee crop. Where he does his work, the work that the crop needs requires a set time. 

He asks for this loan to purchase construction materials and pay labor costs to build his house and move there to live with his family. Erick hopes in the future to have a good house to provide his family with the comfort and security it deserves.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and pay labor costs to build his house.

loans.name: Maratbek

texts.ru: Маратбек, 38 лет, женат, отец 5 детей. У Маратбека средне-специальное образование, с 2008 года он занимается изготовлением и продажей изделий из металла. К примеру делает на заказ ворота, решетки, основания для юрты, также перепродает железные строительные материалы. В обороте у Маратбека есть товар на сумму 250,000 сом (KGS). Так как продукция Маратбека пользуется большим спросом и число покупателей растет с каждым днем, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку арматур, уголков и профилей для реализации. Маратбек является членом группы "Марат", в которой кроме нее состоят еще два человека. Доходы от кредита Маратбек планирует вложить в покупку необходимой для бизнеса грузовой машины.
texts.en: Maratbek is 38 years old, married and the father of five. He has finished a technical college. Since 2008 he has been manufacturing various metal articles. For example, he takes orders for making gates, railings, and support rods for yurts [traditional tent homes]. He also resells metal construction material. His merchandise stock is valued at 250,000 KGS. Since Maratbek's goods are in great demand, and his customer following keeps increasing he has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy fittings, angle bars and structural steel for resale. Maratbek is a member of the Marat [borrowers'] group, which includes two other members. Maratbek plans to invest the resulting revenue in the purchase of a truck needed for his business.

loans.use: to purchase fittings, metal angles and profiles for resale and hardware production.

loans.name: Emilce Ester

texts.es: Emilce, es una emprendedora mujer de 57 años de edad, inició su negocio en el año 2010, impulsada por la necesidad de hacer algo productivo, con sus propios recursos compró jeans para la  venta y con la ayuda de un sobrino que es el que realiza las compras de los jeans en la ciudad de  Medellín,  donde consiguen buena confección, calidad y buenos precios, Emilce comenzó a ofrecer los productos a sus vecinos, familiares y amigos. En la actualidad ella brinda facilidades de pago a sus clientes y sus compras las realiza con su capital de trabajo de contado. Emilce está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual surtirá su negocio con los nuevos modelos de jeans para esta temporada decembrina.  Esta inversión favorecerá las ventas y con ello los ingresos obtenidos.  Ella es madre de cuatro hijos  y tiene como meta familiar a futuro hacerle unas adecuaciones a su vivienda, por eso ella trabaja muy comprometida y dedicada. Ella desea continuar trabajando para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Emilce is an entrepreneurial woman of 57. She started her business in 2010, driven by the necessity of doing something productive. With her own resources, she bought jeans for selling and with the help of a nephew. It is he who carries out the purchases of the jeans in the city of Medellín, where they get good sewing, quality and good prices. 

Emilce started offering the products to her neighbors, family members and friends. Currently, she brings payment facilities to her customers and she does her purchases in with her cash working capital. Emilce is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan that she does from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, by which she will stock her business with the new models of jeans for this December season.

This investment will favor her sales and, with that, the income obtained. She is a mother of four children and has a future family goal of making some improvements to her home. Because of this, she works very committed and dedicated. She wishes to continue working in order to grow her business.

loans.use: to stock her business with the new models of jeans for this December season.

loans.name: David Ernesto

texts.es:
David, es soltero, vive con su familia, es muy responsable y dedicado a buscar la manera de poyar en los gastos familiares, su negocio es la crianza de pollos, su familia le ayuda en sus actividades, tiene 3 años de haber emprendido su negocio y sus padres han sido las personas que le enseñaron este oficio, semanalmente está produciendo 60 pollos adultos para poder venderlos. Por el momento no representa dificultades.
David con el préstamo comprara pollos recién nacidos, concentrado, vitaminas y mejorara las instalaciones de la granja, tendrá alimento para los pollos según su edad y mejorara sus cuidados, espera tener mejor producción, suplir las necesidades de sus clientes, aumentar las ganancias para poder cancelar su deuda y apoyar económicamente a su familia.
Sus sueños son construir su casa propia, ofrecer nuevos productos, tener más clientes satisfechos e ir mejorando la infraestructura de la granja.
texts.en:
David is single, lives with his family, is very responsible and dedicated to searching for the manner to support the family expenses. His business is raising chickens. His family helps him in his activities. He has 3 years since having learned his business and his parents have been the people who taught him this work.

Weekly, he is producing 60 adult chickens to be able to sell them. For the moment, there are no difficulties. With the loan, David will buy recently born chicks, feed, vitamins and will improve facilities of the farm. He will have feed for the chickens according to their age and will improve their care. He hopes to have better production, fulfill the needs of his customers, and grow earnings to be able to pay off his debt and economically support his family.

His dreams are to construct his own house, offer new products, have more satisfied customers and go improving the infrastructure of the farm.

loans.use: to buy recently born chicks, feed, vitamins and to improve the farm facilities.

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru:
Муким мужчина 35 лет , женат ,отец четверых  детей. Он с детства работает на поле, ухаживает за домашним скотом , выращивает фрукты и овощи.Муким хотел получить высшее образование , но у его родителей не было средств, поэтому он после женитьбы начал заниматься земледелием. Вот уже на протяжение 18 лет Муким на своем участке земли выращивает картошку,морковь,пшеницу и хлопок. Он начинал с 2 гектаров земли, и понемногу с годами достиг
того,что у него теперь 25 гектаров земли, где он и выращивает свой урожай, который продаёт на рынке. Ему помогает его жена и сыновья. Товар хорошо скупается,потому что Муким выращивает его с заботой и любовью. Он берет кредит,чтобы оплодотворить почву на своем участке и купить семена,но у него нет  полной суммы денег.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Он надеется,что МДО Арванд откликнется на его просьбу о помощи и выделит нужную сумму.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Mukim is a 35-year old man, married and the father of four. From his young age on he has been working in the fields, taking care of livestock, and growing fruits and vegetables. Mukim wanted to go to college, but his parents did not have the means for that, which is why he started growing produce once he got  married. For some 18 years Mukim has been growing potatoes, carrots, wheat and cotton on his land plot. He started with two ha [about 5 acres] of land and gradually has increased his plot to 25 ha [62 acres], where he grows his produce to be sold at the market. His wife and children help him. His produce sells well because Mukim puts a lot of care in his work. He is taking out a loan to fertilizer his soil and buy seeds, but he lacks the full amount needed. This is why he has applied to the Arvand microfinance institution for financial support. He hopes that Arvand will respond to his request for help and approves his loan. Mukim thanks you in advance for your support and trust.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yako village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aminu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aminu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Aminu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Joseph joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Monica, Yuwanq and Gayus. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Joseph would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Joseph can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Joseph spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for childrens school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Barnaba

texts.en:
Barnaba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Barnaba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yakubu, Saduda and Samaila. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Barnaba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Barnaba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Barnaba spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yahaya Jalo

texts.en:
Yahaya Jalo is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya Jalo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya Jalo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Yahaya Jalo expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide his family with food and clothing, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saratu Dantani

texts.en: Saratu Dnatani is a maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yako village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu Dantani would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu Dantani can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Saratu Dantani, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: David Dio

texts.en: David Dio is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. David Dio joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Jonathan, Enuch and Gidion. Before he became a Babban Gona member, David Dio would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, David Dio can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, David Dio  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gavharoy

texts.ru: Гавхарой 27 летняя жительница городка Турсунзаде. Она замужем и уже имеет троих детей. Ее муж работает в Гидро-электро станции. Дети еще маленькие. Гавхарой домохозяйка. Она следит за порядком и уютом в доме, за воспитанием детей и поддержание домашнего очага. Гавхарой успевает справляться за всеми домашними делами и заодно заниматься земледелием. У нее имеется не большой участок земли, где она выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Она хочет, чтобы ее дети питались здоровой пищей, и следит за их здоровьем. Гавхарой закончила посев и ей сейчас необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения.
texts.en: Gavharoy is 27 years old and lives in Tursun-zoda. She is married and already has three children. Her husband works at a hydroelectric power station. Their children are still young. Gavharoy is a homemaker. She maintains a tidy and comfortable home, raises children and takes care of the household. She manages to do all of her chores and also work as a farmer. She has a small land plot where she grows produce. Gavharoy would like her children to eat healthy and lead a healthy lifestyle . Gavharoy has finished the planting season and now she needs mineral fertilizers to treat her soil. She is applying for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Marbellí Del Socorro

texts.es: Marbeli siempre dedicada a su labor vendiendo cosméticos mientras su esposo se dedica al trabajo de tornero, con el crédito anterior que solicito logro empezar a construir un cuarto y levanto un muro perimetral, ahora solicita nuevamente un financiamiento para poder comprar los materiales que destinara para continuar la construcción de cuarto, puesta de piso del porche con esta inversión Marbeli espera terminar la obra que comenzó con el préstamo anterior, para así poder brindar a sus hijos mas espacio y comodidad.
texts.en: Marbeli has always worked selling cosmetics while her husband works as a lathe operator. With the previous loan that she requested, she managed to begin building a room and raised the perimeter wall. Now she asks again for loan to be able to purchase the materials that will be used to continue constructing the room, and put a floor on the porch. With this investment, Marbeli hopes to finish the work that she began with the previous loan, so that in this way she will be able to offer her children more space and comfort.

loans.use: to continue building a room, among other improvements to the house that will offer her family more comfort.

loans.name: Mayela Mercedes

texts.es:
Mayela es casada, con dos  pequeños hijos a su cargo alos que le provee su ayuda para  su desarrollo, de profesion Lic. En Ciencias de la Educaciòn, y se desempeña como agente de cominicaciòn social en una organizacion que le ayudan a niños de escasos recursos en las zonas rurales del departmento de la localidad donde habita.
Actualmente  Mayela tiene la necesidad de seguir mejorando su vivienda, como es el repello de paredes , por tal motivo se acerco a la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar su segundo financiamiento el cual lo utilizaria para la compra de materiales de construccion tales como: cemento, arena, zinc  y pago de mano de obra, lo que ledara mejor nivel de vida y comodidad a su hogar.
texts.en:
Mayela is married with two small children under her care.  She provides her help towards their development.  By profession she has a degree in education sciences, and she works as a social communications agent for an organization that helps children with scarce resources in the rural areas of the department where she lives.

Mayela currently needs to continue improving her house by doing things like plastering the walls.  For this reason, she came to the CEPRODEL office to request her second loan.  She will use it to buy construction materials like cement, sand, metal sheeting, and to pay for labor.  The will give her household a better standard of living and make them more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, sand, metal sheeting, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy materials and supplies that she needed for her business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenses.

She is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward the purchase of additional items like fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials for her rug-making business. This assistance will enable her to meet the needs of her family.

Geraldine wants her children to be able to complete their studies. She wants to give them a better future someday. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: for the purchase of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre, 32 years old, is married and has 2 children aged 1 and 5 years, one of them going to school. He is a farmer who has been farming for 9 years. Jean Pierre would like to use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow maize to sell

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Emmanuel, Jonathan and Ezra.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ezekiel would have had to sell his maize crop at a low price soon after harvest to cover his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. With this 7,026 NGN loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ezekiel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Ezekiel spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping to ensure his children are well-educated and eventually have professional jobs.

loans.use: to store his harvest, then sell it two months later at a higher price.

loans.name: Maria Silvina

texts.es:
María de 57 años de edad estudió hasta 2nd grado de educación básica, es casada y tiene dos hijos ya mayores y con hogar propio. Su esposo es agricultor de granos básicos y solo él vive con ella.

María es ama de casa, únicamente trabaja su esposo y es el que genera ingresos a la familia, en ocasiones y no muy seguido un hermano le envía remesas. Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y pagar mano de obra para construir la cocina en su casa. María se proyecta seguir ampliando su casa para tener mayor comodidad con su esposo.
texts.en:
María, 57 years old, went to school up to the second grade. She is married and has two adult children with their own homes. Her husband is a farmer of basic grains and only he lives with her. 

María is a housewife, only her husband works and it is he who generates the family's income. Sometimes, and not very often, a brother sends them remittances. She asks for this loan to purchase construction materials and pay labor costs to build a kitchen on her house. María plans to continue expanding her house to have more comfort with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and pay labor costs to build a kitchen on her house.

loans.name: Giovanni Dolores

texts.es:
Giovanni, de 24 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijas, sus compañera de vida tiene un pequeño negocio con el cual ayuda para los gastos de la casa.-

Giovanni, desde pequeño ha buscado la manera de ser independiente, aun cuando su madre se ha esforzado toda la vida por dale todo lo que necesita, ahora Giovanni, ha decidido formar su propia familia.

Giovanni, ha empezado recientemente a trabajar en una compañía que se dedica a la venta de aparatos tecnológicos, como celulares, protectores de pantalla y otros; este negocio exige tener cierto capital para poder invertirlo.

Giovanni, necesita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de Smartphone y accesorios tecnológicos, para aprovechar la temporada navideña, ya que muchas personas regalan este tipo de artículos,

Giovanni, sabe que este negocio le dejará buen margen de ganancias, es por eso que el ve una posibilidad de negocio muy rentable en esta temporada.

El planea, tener la suficiente solvencia económica, para darle a su familia todo lo que necesita y además, retomar sus estudios en ingeniería.
texts.en:
Giovanni, 24, is in a relationship and has two daughters.  His life partner has a small business with which she helps with the household expenses.  Giovanni has looked for ways to be independent from a young age, even when his mother worked hard her whole life to give him what he needed.  Now he has decided to form his own family.

Recently Giovanni started working in a company that sells technological apparatuses such as mobile phones, screen savers, and so forth.  This business requires having some capital to be able to invest in it.

Giovanni needs the loan to invest in buying smart phones and technological accessories to make the most of the Christmas season, because a lot of people give this type of gift.

Giovanni knows this business will yield him a good profit margin, so he sees a possibility for a very profitable business this time of year.  He plans to have enough economic solvency to give his family everything they need and to return to his engineering studies.

loans.use: to invest in buying smart phones and technological accessories

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ayuba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his child, Naboth.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ayuba spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his child, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Sandra una madre cabeza de familia, joven de 27 años de edad, sus hijos tienen tan solo 8 y 4 años de edad y se sienten orgullosos de tener toda una guerrera como madre que se preocupa por su alimentación, que vivan dignamente, que estudien. 
Sandra tiene una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, y les hace una invitación a que la apoyen con un préstamo  para invertir en su negocio, pues no tiene el capital para abastecerlo pues parte de lo que tenia se lo gasto en los regalos que tan felices hizo a sus dos hijos. 
Con el capital comprara granos, dulces, refrescos, cervezas, abarrotes.
texts.en:
This is Sandra, who is a mother, the head of the household, and a young, 27 year-old woman. Her children are only 8 and 4 years old, and they feel proud to have such a fighter in life for a mother, who cares that they have food, that they live with dignity, and that they study.

Sandra has a store consisting of products for a family’s shopping basket, and she extends an invitation to support her with a loan to invest in her business, since she does not have the capital to supply it; part of what she had she spent on the gifts that made her two children very happy.  With the capital, she will purchase grains, groceries, sodas, beer, and groceries.

loans.use: to stock her business with grains, groceries, sweets, fried snacks, sodas, and chocolates.

loans.name: Celsa Dolores

texts.es:
Celsa es una señora casada , con dos hijos a su cargo a los que le proporciona su ayuda para su formaciòn y desarrollo, de profesion maestra de educacion primaria, con 26 años de laborar, desempeñandose como docente en una escuela rural del municipio donde vive.
Actualmente esta señora se acerco a la oficina de Ceprodel Para solicitar el financiamiento ,nùmero tres, el cual lo utilizaria en la compra  una computadora ( combo) mesa, monitor, cpu, parlantes, teclado y bateria.
lo que vendria a facilitar a realizar su trabajo y realizar las tareas de sus hijos.
esta señora se encuentra muy agradecida con Ceprodel y las organizaciones que la han apoyado por medio de ceprodel, ya que a mejorado sus condicones de vida  de su familia.
texts.en:
Celsa is a married woman, with two children in her care, to whom she provides her help for their formation and development. By profession, she is a primary school teacher, with 26 years of experience, working as a teacher in a rural school in the municipality where she lives.

Currently, this woman approached the Ceprodel office to ask for loan number three, which will be used to purchase a computer set, table, monitor, CPU, speakers, keyboard, and battery, which will come to make it easier to do her work and for her children to do their work. 

This woman is very grateful to Ceprodel and the organizations that have supported her through Ceprodel, since she has improved her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a computer set, table, monitor, CPU, speakers, keyboard and battery.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is a 45-year-old married mother of two children, who started selling home products two years ago to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. Faten is an ambitious woman, who is working hard to develop her business. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new requested products to attract more customers and satisfy their needs. This loan will increase Faten's income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new requested products to attract more customers and satisfy their needs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bookstore merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is happy to have a chance again to cooperate with Kiva and its field partner Nor Horizon. This will be his third deal with Kiva, and for the previous two, he thanks lenders greatly. Those loans helped him to pay for his daughter’s tuition fees.  

Garik lives in Vanadzor city with his nice wife, small daughter and son. His elder daughter is married, and she lives with her family. 

Garik earns his living from his small business in a garage of his own where he gives car-repairing services. He has had this business already for five years, which brings not small but constant income for his family. This is especially thanks to his many regular customers, which he collected during the years. 

Garik repairs cars of different makes and years of production, but sometimes he has a lack of some spare car parts. 

Garik asks for this loan in an amount of 250,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) in order to buy spare car parts, which he mostly uses and needs during his repairing activities.

loans.use: to buy car spare parts, which he mostly uses and needs during his repairing activities

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia integrada por su esposa y un hijo, tiene  la responsabilidad de abastecer a su familia de vestuario, alimentos y educación, su actividad económica es la venta de prendas de vestir tales como faldas, camisas, pantalones, etc., su horario es de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde y la realiza de manera ambulante en pueblos cercanos a la ciudad en donde vive.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar variedad de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, tendrá más surtido su inventario, espera poder aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos que serán de ayuda para cumplir con sus compromisos.
Su sueño es lograr tener casa propia para dar a su familia un espacio con mayor seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en: José lives with his family, made up of his wife and one son. He has the responsibility of providing for his family with clothing, food and education. His economic activity is selling apparel like dresses, shirts, pants, etc. His schedule is from seven in the morning to four in the afternoon. He does it as a walking salesman in villages near the city where he lives.

loans.use: comprar variedad de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, tendrá más surtido su inventario

loans.name: Rabeka

texts.en:
Rabeka is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Nathan, Joshua and Loise.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rabeka would have had to sell her maize crop at a low price soon after harvest to cover her immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. With this 6,766 NGN loan and Babban Gona’s support, she can now store her maize and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Rabeka spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, hoping to ensure they are well-educated and eventually have professional jobs.

loans.use: to store her harvest so that she can sell it at a higher price several months later.

loans.name: Edith Roxana

texts.es:
Edith de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta 6| grado de educación básica, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos que estudian 2nd año de bachillerato, 9° y 4° grado de educación básica, su pareja se dedica a los trabajos de albañilería y a la siembra de hortalizas.

Edith es ama de casa y trabaja como empleada doméstica en una casa particular y devenga un salario mensual por ello y en los tiempos libre apoya a su pareja en los trabajos del campo. Solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para los cultivos y para comprar arena y cemento para hacer reparaciones en su casa.

Edith sueña con reparar totalmente su casa para vivir más cómoda con su familia.
texts.en:
Edith, 35, studied until the 6th grade.  She lives with her partner, and she has three children who are studying in the second year of high school, ninth grade, and fourth grade.  Her husband works in construction and vegetable farming.

Edith is a housewife and she works as a housekeeper in a private home, earning a monthly salary.  In her free time, she helps her husband with the farm work. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase fertilizer for the crops, and to purchase sand and cement to repair her house.

Edith dreams of repairing her house completely, in order to live more comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and to purchase sand and cement to repair her house.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Sarah would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sarah can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Sarah, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly, 53, is originally from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She has four children in total; one is single and lives under her support, while the other three are married. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. She has been a farmer for 20 years, with a daily earning of USD 5.00.

Her husband, VA, 50, is a construction worker who can earn USD 10.00 per day, on average. During this time, her husband’s career is running badly because there is not a variety of construction materials for him. Due to this reason, Ly is applying for a Kiva loan for her husband to buy a concrete hoisting machine. She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a concrete hoisting machine

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, está mejorando la granja de pollos con las utilidades que está generando al invertir el préstamo anterior en insumos para la misma, su familia se mantiene unida y tienen un nivel de vida mucho más digno.
Está solicitando un crédito nuevo para comprar pollos y huevos para surtir el negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, de esta manera seguirá trabajando.
texts.en:
José is improving his chicken farm with the earnings that he is generating by investing the previous loan in supplies for this farm.  His family is together and has a much more decent standard of living.

He is requesting a new loan to purchase chickens and eggs to supply the business and to meet the needs of his clients, and in this way, continue working.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and eggs to stock his business and to meet the needs of his clients

loans.name: Tungteeya  Bim - Masaka Group

texts.en:
Azara is a 50-year-old hardworking woman from Bimbilla in the Northern Region of Ghana. Azara is married and has six children. Azara is the individual pictured with her hands on the milled parboiled rice among the members squatting. Azara is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the last 15 years. The name of the group is "Tungteeya Bim - Masaka- Bimbilla". She earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality parboiled rice for the local markets around Bimbilla and non-local markets.

Azara and Tungteeya Bim - Masaka Group have asked for a loan of 12,700 cedis (GHC). Azara’s share of the loan is 400 GHC, which would be used to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing. Azara aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food, health care and educational materials.

Azara thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing.

loans.name: Domingo Alberto

texts.es: Hace 12 años que Don Domingo se dedica a la elaboración de muebles, poco a poco fue aprendiendo como ayudante y después puso su propio taller. Se ha caracterizado por ser un joven humilde y trabajador con deseos de salir adelante siempre. Solicita el crédito para comprar Madera, Barniz, Lijas entre otros. Este crédito le será de gran ayuda ya que podrá terminar algunos muebles que tiene en proceso de esta manera podrá entregarlos en el tiempo establecido y mantener a sus clientes satisfechos. Como expectativas próximas esta expandir su negocio a otros departamentos cercanos.
texts.en:
Domingo has made a living producing furniture for 12 years.  Little by little, he learned as an assistant, and afterward, he started his own workshop.  Others characterize him as a humble, hardworking young man with the desire to always move forward.  

He is requesting the loan to purchase wood, varnish, and sandpaper, among other things.  This loan will be a great help to him, since he will be able to finish some pieces of furniture that he has in process and in this way, be able to deliver them within the established timeframe and keep his clients satisfied.  His next goal is to expand his business to other nearby departments.

loans.use: to purchase wood, varnish, and sandpaper, among other things

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en: Ruqia is a 44-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Los Girasoles”  está conformada por 08 socios comprometidos en desarrollarse cada día en sus negocios. Este es el caso de Elia de 58 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo independiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede cubrir con los gastos del hogar. El crédito que solicitó lo invertirá para la compra de plátanos, manzana, naranja y pera. El grupo “Los Girasoles” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Elia se encuentra en la parte posterior es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chaleco rojo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Los Girasoles (The Sunflowers) is made up of eight members who are committed to developing their businesses every day.  This is the case of Elia, who is 58 years old and separated with one independent child.  She makes a living selling fruit.  Thanks to her effort she is able to cover the household costs.  The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase bananas, apples, oranges, and pears.  

The Los Girasoles group is grateful for the loan being offered and they promise to continue working hard.  Elia can be seen in the back of the photo.  She is the first person on the left and is wearing a red vest.

loans.use: to buy bananas, apples, oranges and pears.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Salamatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salamatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Salamatu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham is a 33-year-old married man and a father of four young children, from Palompon, Leyte. He is a very hardworking person. He would like to invest again in a retail store business, after a super typhoon ruined it a year ago. Abraham is requesting a loan to buy stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, sugar and others. This loan will enable him to improve his inventories, thus attracting buyers to his store. In the future, Abraham hopes to make his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save enough money to support his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, sugar and others

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en: Mastura is 35 years old. She is a very hardworking woman. Mastura is a highly educated person. She has worked in a museum for more than 10 years. Mastura is one of the best workers. She reads many books and has a wide world view. Mastura’s daughter is going to be married but Mastura does not have money to organize a wedding party for her daughter. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to pay for the wedding party for her daughter. This loan will help to create a family in Tajikistan.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's wedding party

loans.name: Mumbua

texts.en:
Mumbua is 46 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with four children. She farms and has been in the farming business for the past 11 years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to grow her farming business and provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy materials and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will again let her borrow an amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional items like fabric, thread, and other materials for her business. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Marites wants for her business to continue to expand and she also desires to be able to save for her future plans. She meets every week with her co-fellowship*  members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cloth, thread, and other materials for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josphine is 52 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with three children. She farms in Thika town, she has been in the farming business for the past 24 years, and it has been profitable. Right now she makes a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to grow her farming business and have a happy family by providing for their needs.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for planting on her farm.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 31 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 9. Two of them go to school. 

She sells food stuffs and has been in business for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and Irish potatoes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and Irish potatoes to resell.

loans.name: Rafiki Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Rafiki Self help group. She is 57 years old, married and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. She sells clothes as her main business. She has benefited a lot from HIH EA training on enterprise and financial management, which has enabled her to manage her business well. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to increase her stock, which will consequently increase her income. This will assist her to cater for her family's needs such as food, medicine and paying school fees for her children. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Shaga'a Group

texts.en:
Shaga'a is a group that consists of four women from Hodiedah city, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Neama is the leader of the group. She is married with five children and lives with them in a very poor area. The house where Neama lives with her family lacks a lot of home appliances and housewares and most of them are very old. Neama's husband is the sole breadwinner and has a weak income. She works as a housewife. 

Neama has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some of the necessary housewares that the family needs daily. Neama has a very simple dream, which is providing her house with all necessary home appliances.

loans.use: To purchase some of the necessary housewares that the family needs daily.

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
Ameeran is a 60-year-old married woman who has run a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her son. She has two buffaloes and two calves for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. Ameeran has five children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

This is Ameeran's fifth year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for milking.

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en: Leatu is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Leatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Leatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Leatu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and she hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Mariela Mercedes

texts.es:
Mariela es una señora dedicada a la enseñanza de los demas principalmente a los niños, es maestra de educacion primaria con 11años de laborar en un colegio de la localidad donde habita, es casada con 2 hijos a los que le brinda el apoyo necesario para su educacion, actualmente tiene la urgencia de  construir  su vivienda
 por tal motivo visito a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar su segundao financiamiento el que lo utlizaria  en la compra de materiales de construccion tales como cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra.
 y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida, agradeciendole a ceprodel por la repuesta pronta y oportuna.
texts.en:
Mariela is a woman who's dedicated to teaching others, mostly children. She's a primary school teacher who's worked in a school in the area where she lives for 11 years. 

She's married with two children, who she provides with the support necessary for their education. Right now, she urgently needs to build her home. Because of this, she visited the Ceprodel office to seek her second loan, which she will use to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, iron and payment for labor. 

In this way, she will improve her life conditions. She's thankful to Ceprodel for the prompt and timely response.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: cement, sand, iron, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is a 28-year-old electrician from Palompon, Leyte. He runs a small shop for electrical repair. Ricky has been in the business for several years now. This is the source of his income. 

Ricky is asking for a loan to buy materials for the shop like pliers, screwdrivers, electrical tape, wires and other items. With this, he will be able to cater to more customers in his shop, thus allowing him to increase his income. Ricky dreams of expanding his business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy materials for his shop like pliers, screwdrivers, electrical tape, wires and other items

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy groceries and other supplies which were needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional grocery items, toiletries and beverages she needs to expand her product inventory. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Amelita wants to expand her business so that she can help support the educational needs of her children. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marium

texts.en:
Marium is a 49-year-old married woman who has run a business selling animals with her son for the last two years.  At present she has two buffaloes and two goats.  She looks after them while her son sells them at different places. In this way they obtain a good profit. They are happily working together to support their family.

Now, for the expansion of her business, Marium has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals. This will help her to increase her earnings for meeting household expenses efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her earnings for meeting household expenses efficiently.

loans.name: Zahidha

texts.en:
Zahidha is a 45-year-old, energetic, married woman.

For the last three years, she has been manufacturing ‘waan’ which is a material used in making charpoy (a bed of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). She offers various kinds of waan in different colors, and she is famous for providing good quality waan in her community. In this way she is able to manage the needs of her family members.

Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of his family members. She is the mother of 6 children. She needs to improve her business so she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy another waan-making machine to inflate her sales and increase profits.

loans.use: to buy another waan making machine to inflate her sales and increase profits.

loans.name: Carlos Edil

texts.es: Carlos, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un hijo, reside en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. El trabajaba en la agricultura como jornalero y hace dos años que se ha dedicado a la venta de CDs de musica, peliculas y tambien sandalias. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y se estaciona en las aceras del mercado a ofrecer su producto. Le ha ido bien con su negocio, ya invirtió su primer préstamo y actualmente solicita otro por 12,000 Lempiras para surtir y vender CD con música, sandalias y peliculas. Sus planes son mantener el negocio y hacer su propia casa y apoyar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Carlos is 24 years old and single, and he has a child.  He lives in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. 

He used to work as a day laborer in agriculture, and he has been selling music CDs, movies, and sandals, for two years. He makes his sales on foot, and he also stations himself on the walkways of the market to offer his products.  

His business has gone well for him—he already invested his first loan, and he is currently seeking another for 12,000 Lempiras in order to stock and sell music CDs, sandals, and movies.  

His plans are to maintain the business, build his own house, and support his child.

loans.use: to stock and sell music CDs, sandals, and movies.

loans.name: Bimenyimana Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is 37 years old. He is married and has three children aged between 8 months and 8 years old, two of whom go to school. Viateur is a farmer and has been farming for 11 years. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for his maize. The profits from his business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for his maize

loans.name: Sevinc

texts.en:
Sevinc is 33 year old, married, and has two kids. She lives with her family in the Agdash region. Sevinc has run a business selling clothes for 8 years with help from her husband and also earns additional income from raising livestock. T

his loan is important for her to purchase new stock of winter clothing to cover her customers' orders. Her products are on display at her home and she also works as a street vendor. Sevinc's monthly income from this business is 300 AZN .This is going to be her first loan. Please support Sevinc.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of winter clothing

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 50-year-old married woman and has enjoyed the work of making Parandas for many years. Parandas are considered a traditional hair accessory in a country like Pakistan. Women use them for a traditional look on special occasions like Eid (a holiday) and weddings. Shamim makes beautiful Parandas, especially for bridal hairstyles. She initiated her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Taking a loan from Kashf helped her meet expenses she thought she could never bear. 

Currently Shamim has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials including colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls to attract more customers to earn more revenue.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls to make Parandas and attract more customers to earn more revenue.

loans.name: Mikoroshini Group

texts.en:
Thomas, who is in his early 40s, is married and has two children who are still in school.  He has been running a retail shop since 2007.  He works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Thomas's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to repair his shop by putting in better selves and increasing the shop's inventory.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  Thomas used the profits to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase his retail shop inventory.  He dreams of opening a wholesale shop.

Thomas will share this loan with his loan group "Mikoroshini," which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his retail shop inventory.

loans.name: Maarouf

texts.en:
Maarouf is a 42-year-old married father of three children. He has a confectionery where he prepares and sells desserts and sweets to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Due to the increasing living costs, Maarouf's income is not enough anymore, thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees.

Maarouf hopes to develop his business more in the future to stay capable of satisfying his family's needs.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan started his school in April 2011. He began his teaching career by teaching in a government school. In April 2011, he decided to go back to his home village and start his own school so that the children there could have access to good quality education.

Today, there are over 150 students in his school, and more than half of these students are girls. The students and other teachers in the school are very happy with the school, which has the reputation of being the best in the community. He requires PKR 75,000 to repair his school and buy furniture and a computer for his students. He is excited about the future of his school.

loans.use: to repair his school and buy furniture and a computer for his students.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 37 year old married woman who started a school about 2 years ago. Today, there are over 150 students in the school, of which half are girls. Rubina believes that investing in her school will not only improve her income but will also improve the lives of the children in her school and those in the community. She requires a loan of PKR 100,000 to buy chairs and desks along with blackboards for her students.

Rubina wants to make her school the best in the community, one that others will look to follow.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks along with blackboards for her students.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 45 years old. She is a separated lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Rani makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 55,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make stock available for her customers. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Rani wishes to utilize part of her revenues for providing a good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Maryamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Amos, Chriss and Ladi. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Maryamu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gemar

texts.en:
Gemar is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children. She lives with her family in Palompon, Leyte. 

Gemar has engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than several years now. Fishing is a profitable business in their place. Gemar is standing next to a fishing boat that is undergoing repair. 

Gemar is asking to take a loan to buy materials like plywood and nails and to purchase a new boat engine. A loan will help Gemar and her husband improve their fishing business, thus augmenting their income and profit.  

In the future, Gemar dreams of expanding their fishing business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy materials like plywood and nails and to purchase a new boat engine

loans.name: Ronild Jose

texts.es:
Ronild  es casado , bachiller, con 2 hijo a su cargo a los que le proporciona el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, y se desempeña como agente de comunicacion social desde hace seis años de laborar para una organizacion que ayuda a niños de escasos recuros y de extremada pobreza en las comunidades rurales.
Actualmente este señor tiene la necesidad de hacer divisiones a su vivienda  para tener  dos dormitorios  para el  y su esposa uno y el otro el de sus hijos.
 por tal motivo se acerco a la oficina  de ceprodel para solicitar el segundo financiamiento el que lo utilizaria en la compra de laminas de playcem, clavos, reglas de madera y pago de mano de obra lo que le  
vendra a dar mejores condiciones y comodidad  a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ronild has a high school degree and is married with two dependent children whom he provides with the support necessary for their development. He works as an agent of social communication. For six years, he's worked for an organization that helps underprivileged children living in extreme poverty in rural communities.

Currently, this man has a need to have divisions in his home to have two bedrooms, one for him and his wife and the other for his children. Because of this, he came into the Ceprodel office to seek his second loan, which he'll use to buy cement board, nails, wood rules and labor payment. This will give him better conditions and comfort in his home.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement board, wood rules, nails, paint and labor payment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish and pay for the repair cost of the sidecar

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Palompon, Leyte.  

She wants to start a business in order to support her husband in providing the needs of the family, especially for their children’s schooling. 

Evelyn is asking to take a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help Evelyn a lot in making her dream business a reality.  

She believes that through hard work and perseverance, she will be able to make a living, thus allowing her to support the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Ruksana

texts.en: Ruksana, age 39, is a married woman.  Her husband runs a general store, but earns insufficient income to bear the family's expenditures alone. Ruksana deals in the business of selling animals and makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. Ruksana needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single hardworking woman who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. Her main business is a retail shop; farming and rentals provide additional income. 

Jane used her previous loan to buy sugar, soap and general merchandise for her shop. She has requested a new loan to buy sugar, salt, basins and bread to sell. Despite high competition, Jane is hoping to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, basins, bread and general merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Mirzosafar

texts.ru: Мирзосафар мужчина 55 лет , женат ,счастливый отец шестерых детей и пятнадцати внуков.Вот уже на протяжение 40 лет он занимается земледелием.С раннего возраста Мирзосафар помогая родителям по дому обучился земледельческому мастерству ,изучил характеристику некоторых растения и деревьев,знал,в какое время года что сажать.Он воспитал и поставил на ноги шестерых детей,дал им хорошее образование,обеспечил  светлым будущим.Сейчас будучи в пожилом возрасте Мирзосафар всё так же работает и зарабатывает на жизнь.Он не жалуется ни на погоду,ни на болезнь,всегда весёлый и бодрый Мирзосафар работает на поле,ухаживает за своим участком земли.Сейчас он планирует оплодотворит  землю,посадить новые семена , но у него нет полной суммы денег.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Мирзосафар заранее благодарит  организацию Арванд за помощь и доверие к своим клиентам.
texts.en: Mirzosafar is a 55-year old man, married and the happy father of six and grandfather of 15. For 40 years already he has been working as a farmer. From a young age Mirzosafar helped his parents in the household and learned the secrets of farming, studied the specific qualities of plants and fruit trees, and learned about the various planting seasons. He has raised six children, provided them with a good education and helped them find their place in life. Now as he is getting older Mizosafar continues to work and make a living. He never complains about the weather or his health and is always upbeat and energetic when working in the field and treating his soil. At present he plans to fertilize his soil and plants new seeds, but his funds are insufficient. This is why he turned to the Arvand microfinance institution for financial support. Mirzosafar thanks Arvand in advance for its help and trust.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine, a married and hardworking man, lives in Kagadi, Uganda, where he has operated a hardware shop together with a bar since 2005 to generate his family income. 

He desires to educate all his children despite challenges of competition leading to low returns. Augustine is requesting a loan to buy cement, iron sheets, and nails for selling.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron sheets, and nails for selling.

loans.name: Expedito

texts.en: Expedito, who operates a boutique as his source of income, is a married Ugandan man of 37 with three children, living in Kagadi. He also practices crop production to supplement his income. He plans to grow his business with time. Expedito is hardworking, though challenged by competition from fellow businessmen dealing in the same business. He intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Justus Bunuzi

texts.en:
Justus, a married man, lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in wholesale, a retail shop, and farming since 2012 for income generation. 

He hopes to grow his business and he is working hard towards achieving this goal. Justus is challenged by competition from similar business men. He is asking for a loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, salt, sodas, and many more for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, salt, sodas, and many more for selling.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda es estudiante del 3er año de la carrera de ciencias administrativas, trabaja actualmente como administradora de una empresa publicitaria, quiere seguir creciendo y es por eso que esta en busca de su titulo universitario.
Le gustaria poder llegar a ocupar un puesto mas alto en su trabajo, es por eso que se esfuerza mucho.
Pide este prestamo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Brenda is a student in her third year of administrative sciences. She currently works as an administrator of an advertising company. She wants to continue growing and is thus seeking a university degree.

She'd like to be able to occupy a higher position in her work, so she puts in a lot of effort. She's seeking this loan to pay tuition fees for her career so she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia is 28 years old and married. She has been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best providing services, she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  That is why she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers to gain profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers to gain profits to build her own house.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana viene de una familia muy trabajadora y unida, ella esta estudiando para poder ser una abogada exitosa, y por medio de sus estudios poder abrirse camino en el mundo laboral.
Ella esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida, y así también poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en: Ana comes from a very unified and hardworking family. She is studying to become a successful lawyer, and will use her education to enable her to gain entry into the professional world. She is putting her greatest effort to become "somebody" in this life; and in this way she will also be able to help others. Ana requests this loan to cover the tuition payments of her degree and continue striving toward her goals.

loans.use: to cover her tuition payments.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 47-year-old married woman who has four children. For about 10 years she has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, Shameem has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Mehboob

texts.en:
