Mehboob has successfully built her business selling bangles and jewelry items with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to her family's income. Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, Mehboob was able to purchase a variety of bangles to increase her sales. 

Now Mehboob is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more variety of bracelets, earrings, rings, and bangles. This will enable her to increase her sales and profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of bracelets, earrings, rings, and bangles.

loans.name: Larissa

texts.es:
Larissa vive en la ciudad de Luque con sus padres, se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresa tiene como meta terminar su carrera universitaria así superarse y ofrecer servicio profesional a la sociedad, obtener buen ingreso y ayudar a su familia  a  tener un vida digna.
Ella esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para ser una buena profesional destacada en sus calificaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Larissa lives in the city of Luque with her parents. She is currently pursuing her degree in business administration. Her goal is to finish her degree and in this way get ahead and offer her professional services to society and obtain good a good income with which to help he family to have a dignified life. She is working her hardest to be a distinguished professional in her field. 

Larissa requests this loan to be able to invest in the payment of her university tuition, and in this way to be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to cover her tuition payments.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal es un joven de 22 años, esta estudiando la carrera de ciencias contables, por medio de su carrera quiere poder ayudar a su familia por medio de los ingresos que pueda tener.
Es un joven que se esta esforzando bastante por poder crecer y salir adelante. Esta esforzándose mucho por ser un profesional exitoso.
pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Anibal is a young man, he is 22 years old. He is pursuing a degree in accounting, and through this degree he wants to be able to help his family with the income he will be able to earn. He is a young man who is working especially hard in order to be able to grow and to get ahead. He is working very hard to become a successful professional.

Anibal requests this loan in order to be able to pay his tuition, in order to be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to cover his university tuition.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia, age 27, is a married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all their household expenses, so Nazia initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. Nazia also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. With the support of the Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. 

Currently, Nazia has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn more profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn more profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Amrullo

texts.en:
Amrullo is 45 years old. He lives in a small village in Tajikistan with his wife and children.  He is a very industrious and smart man. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, he feeds cattle and sells them in a local market. He has been busy with this business more than five years. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

He wants to develop the business but he has not money to buy more cattle for increasing working capital. This loan will help him to increase the number of cattle and from the profit,  improve living their condition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase working capital

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: A 46-year-old married woman, Josefa earns a living by raising pigs and poultry. She lives in Palompon, Leyte with her family. She has been in the business for more than a year now. Her husband earns an additional income through carpentry. Josefa is requesting to take a loan to buy piglets and chickens to raise. This loan will enable her to improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Josefa dreams of improving their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a 36-year-old woman living in Palompon, Leyte. She is married and has three children ages 15, 13, and 3.  Helen supports her family through her retail sales of clothing, slippers and sandals, cosmetics and others. This is a good investment for Helen. For now, she needs additional capital for her business. She is asking to take a loan to buy more stock like dresses and pants, fashion accessories, slippers and sandals, cosmetics and others. This loan will help her improve the variety of her stock, which will attract more buyers. In the future, Helen hopes to make her business a successful one and she wants to save some of her earnings to pay for her children’s tuition.

loans.use: to buy more stock like dresses and pants, fashion accessories, slippers and sandals, cosmetics and others.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is a 58-year-old single lady who has been selling milk for the last 24 years.  She earns a monthly income of KES 16,000 which she uses to support her family. She has applied for a loan of KES 7,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy energy-saving Jikos for use in her house. She would like to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy energy-saving Jikos.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Palompon, Leyte. She used to run a small sari-sari (retail store) as a source of income. But, she decided to stop after a super typhoon hit their place and ruined everything including her business. As of now, she wants to restart again.

Lorena is requesting a loan to buy groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, beverages, soap, toiletries, biscuits, bread, cooking oil and condiments. With a loan, Lorena will be able to improve her inventory, thus attracting more customers to her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, beverages, soap, toiletries, biscuits, bread, cooking oil and condiments.

loans.name: Marliza

texts.en:
Marliza is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She lives in Palompon, Leyte. Marliza is engaged in the poultry business. She raises chicken which she then sells to the market after several weeks. She is also a vegetable vendor. Marliza is requesting a loan to buy more chickens to raise. This loan will help Marliza to improve her way of life.

In the future, Marliza hopes to make her business sustainable and profitable. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to raise.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Palompon, Leyte. 

She earns a living through her retail sales of clothing like dresses and pants, as well as cosmetics and detergents. Chona has been in the business for more than eight years now. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Chona is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell like dresses and pants, cosmetics, detergents, and others. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.  

In the future, Chona hopes to make her business more productive and stable Furthermore, she wants to save money for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: n to buy more stock to sell like dresses and pants, cosmetics, detergents, and others

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
She is Lolita. She has sold fruits and vegetable for years now and she earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs. She works hard with the determination to have a better income to provide for their everyday needs and pay for their daily expenses. 

To improve sales, Lolita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional fruits and vegetables. At an amount of PHP 15,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of fruits, veggies, and other items needed to expand her inventory. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Lolita hopes to have an extension of her business. She dreams to give her family a better life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fruits and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, a teacher, is a hardworking Ugandan married woman who earns extra income from farming. 

Alice desires to educate all her children but she is challenged by bad weather hindering her crop yields and the general low salary payment accompanied by the long distance to the school where she teaches. 

However, she is determined to see her children attain degrees. Alice is getting credit to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new welder; his idea to renew his equipment will improve his product and make his business more competitive.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla es una estudiante que pone todo de si para poder crecer y salir adelante, sigue estudiando arduamente su carrera de administración de empresas, comenta que su préstamo anterior de kiva lo uso para poder pagar las mensualidades de su carrera, lo que le fue muy útil, y por lo cual esta muy agradecida.
Hoy pide nuevamente un préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y así seguir estudiando. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad qu recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Perla is a student who puts her all into growing and progressing. She is still arduously studying in her Business Administration degree program. She says that she used her previous loan from Kiva to pay her monthly tuition payments, which was very helpful to her and for which she is very grateful. 

Today, she is requesting another loan in order to be able to make her payments so that she can continue studying. She is thankful for this new opportunity that she is receiving; it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres,su papa es chófer de un colectivo y su mama una empleada domestica,y esta estudiando para poder superarse así mismo y también para poder darle una mejor vida.
Esta estudiando la carrera de arquitectura, quiere ser una buena profesional para poder ayudar a la sociedad por medio de su conocimiento.
Pide este prestamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: María is 21 years old and lives with her parents. Her father is a taxi driver and her mother works as a housekeeper. María is studying in order to rise above, and also to create a better life for herself. She is pursuing her architecture degree. She wants to be a good professional in order to be able to help society through her knowledge. María requests this loan in order to be able to invest it in covering the tuition payments for her degree. This way she will be able to continue pursuing her degree as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS REYNAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Maranura, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rutd ella es soltera y tiene 44 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of “Las Reyna’s” Communal Bank.  It is located in the district of Maranura, which belongs to the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

The member Señora Rudt is 44 years old and single, with 3 children.  She has a restaurant business, where she works preparing different dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soup, and saltados de carnes (traditional Peruvian stir-fried beef).  She works from 8:00 A.M. until 5:00 P.M.   She has had this business for 10 years now, and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant.  She is requesting the loan in order to purchase products for cooking, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

The other members devote themselves to business such as animal sales, livestock-raising, a grocery store, and a restaurant.

The member thanks those who are part of this dream in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase products for cooking, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 42-year-old married woman who has run a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. Zahida has eight children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

Zahida has taken many loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a hardworking man, aged 44 years, happily married, with three children. He grew up in a very humble family with few assets and even without school fees to educate him. Francis opted to do odd jobs around the village and the trading centers to earn a living. Due to his hard work he managed to save some money and bought a piece of land close to the trading center in Mbarara District where he put in a banana plantation. This enabled him to earn a living to the extent that he even managed to start constructing a house, which he hopes to complete soon since he has already made bricks. 

Francis is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to finish his house so that his family can live comfortably.

loans.use: To finish his house so his family can live comfortably

loans.name: Rosario De Fatima

texts.es:
“Mientras haya vida hay esperanza”, es una de las frases más usadas por doña Rosario y su familia recordando que siempre seguirá trabajando duro para mantener su negocio. Rosario una mujer que se caracteriza por su arduo trabajo y empeño, comenzó su pequeño negocio con la ayuda de su esposo, ahora está trabajando vendiendo tortillas producidas en su casa, a Rosario le gustaría dar a conocer su producto en los barrios aledaños porque son clientes potenciales donde perfectamente podría incrementar sus ventas. Sus principales expectativas son seguir en aumento de sus ventas e inventario.
El negocio de doña Rosario puede ser uno más en su barrio pero su amabilidad al despachar es lo que la caracteriza. Rosario solicita el crédito para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, entre otros. También aumentara su inventario y por tantos sus ventas al ofrecer de todo podrá captar más clientes comprando los productos más buscados por sus clientes. Esto deposita su confianza en el financiamiento ya que de esa manera podrá mejorar sus finanzas e incrementar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
"As long as there's hope" is one of the expressions Rosario and her family use most to keep in mind that she'll always keep on working hard to support her business.

Rosario's a woman known for her hard work and effort.  She started her small business with her husband's help.  Now she's working selling tortillas she makes at home.  Rosario would like to make her product known in the nearby neighborhoods because there are potential customers and she could absolutely increase her sales.  Her main expectation is to keep on increasing her sales and her inventory.  Rosario's business might be just one more in her neighborhood, but her friendly service distinguishes her.

Rosario's requesting the loan to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar, and other things.  She's also going to expand her inventory and, consequently, her sales.

By offering everything and buying the products in most demand among her customers, she'll be able to attract more customers.  This places her trust in the loan, because she'll be able to improve her finances and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, and other basic staples

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es de la ciudad de Pilar, está cursando el último año de la carrera de derecho, esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser un buen profesional y poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que tiene ese gasto que debe cubrir a la hora de terminar para su carrera.
texts.en:
Teresa is from the city of Pilar. She is studying her final year of a law degree program. She is putting her best effort into becoming a good professional and being able to help other people.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in her degree fees, as she has this expense that she must cover upon finishing her degree.

loans.use: to pay degree fees

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha esta lista la almacena en sacos así como muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los pueblos aledaños, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Julio is 47 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and his daughter. He sows basic grains (principally corn and beans). When the harvests are ready, he stores them in sacks, as the photograph shows, then sells them in nearby villages.

Julio is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, plague controls, and other inputs. In this way, he will earn a better income.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers,manure, plague controls, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. The eldest is 18 and the youngest is 6 years old. Arlene lives with her family in Palompon, Leyte. 

She is engaged in the goat-raising business. Arlene has raised goats for more than four years now.  Her husband works as a baker in a bakeshop. 

Arlene is asking to take a loan to buy more goats to raise. This loan will enable her to improve her goat business, thus augmenting her income and profit. 

In the future, Arlene wants to expand this venture and make it more sustainable and productive.  She also wants to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more goats to raise

loans.name: Mercie

texts.en:
Mercie is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Palompon, Leyte. She is used to operating a small sari-sari (variety store) but had to stop after a super typhoon ruined her business. As of now, she would like to reinvest again to earn an income.

Mercie is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell, including noodles, rice, eggs, condiments, canned goods, biscuits, snack foods, soap, toiletries, sugar, and coffee. A loan will enable Mercie to improve her inventory, thus attracting buyers in her store. Mercie hopes of making her business more profitable and sustainable. She also adds that she wants to save more money for her children's educational fees.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like noodles, rice, eggs, condiments, canned goods, biscuits, snack foods, soap, toiletries, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is a vegetable vendor from Palompon, Leyte.  She is 62 years old, married and has two dependents. Luisa has been in the business for more than 5 years now. She also grows vegetables in her backyard. Luisa is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables to sell.  This will provide a greater variety of produce for her customers. In the future, Luisa dreams of improving her business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell, thus providing a greater variety of produce.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy general needs and supplies for her general store. She is glad that through her earnings she has been able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

Maricris would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy school supplies such as pads of paper, ball pens, name tags, and hair accessories, body powder, and soaps that she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her store earnings help meet her family's basic needs and pay for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Maricris dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy general needs, school supplies, name tags, ball pens, hair accessories,  bracelets, soaps, and powder to sell at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her registration expenses.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a fish vendor from Palompon, Leyte. He is 29 years old and married with two children. Jonathan has been in the fish vending business for several years now.

He also earns additional income through his motorcycle transport business. Jonathan is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell, thus giving him the chance to cater to more customers in his store. Jonathan hopes to make his business successful and sustainable. Furthermore, he wants to save money for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell, thus giving him the chance to cater to more customers in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su padre, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi continuar con su trabajo y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is concealed is 25 years old and lives in a zone of high risk. She cultivates basic grains (mainly corn and beans). She sells her harvests in different markets, and from these sales, she is getting ahead. The young woman lives in her own house with her father.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, manure, plague controls, herbicides and other inputs. Thus, she will be able to continue with her work and have a better income.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, seeds, manure, plague controls, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 48-year-old hardworking woman who has four children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Bashiran’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Bashiran has requested a loan amount 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demand of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demand of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Twezimbe Women Group

texts.en:
Betty is 47 years of age, and a member of Twezimbe women's group. She is a resident of Wakiso central in Wakiso, and married with 4 children who all attend school.

Betty operates a butcher shop which is situated in Kyengera town - a city outskirt. Betty started this business in 2003 when she realized that her family needs where increasing rapidly yet her husband had lost his job due to illness and could no longer support the family

Betty first borrowed a loan with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI) to boost her business and the business is surely moving on quite well. However Betty needs a loan this time to pay for the complete roofing of her rentals that are located in Wakiso.

Betty has dreams of growing her business to an enterprise level. In addition she wishes the best for her children. This is evident in the effort she makes to work harder to see her children complete their studies successfully and have better jobs in future.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, nails, cement and paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her business, such as clothes, toys, and school supplies.

loans.name: Kwagalana Group

texts.en: Ronald is a 28-year-old member of the Kwagalana group.  He is married with one child, age 4, who attends school. Ronald is a motorcyclist (boda boda) in kisenyi Kampala city suburb. Ronald started this business 8 years ago after dropping out of school due to school fee problems. Ronald approached Ugafode Microfinance for a loan to enable the purchase of a new motorcycle.  The one he is using now is old and is no longer making profits as it used to when it was new. He is assured of double profits with a new motorcycle, which will attract more clients and enable longer distances. He and fellow group members are hardworking and appreciate the work of Kiva lenders to support their small enterprises.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been running a business selling animals with the support of her husband. Parveen fully supports her family though her work.

Now, Parveen has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market to improve her standard of living

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 40 years old and widowed with three children. She is a farmer who has been in the business for five years now. She will be using this loan to buy a water pump for use in her farm. This will enable her to water and irrigate all of her crops to get more farm produce to sell and more income. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya.  She has repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her farming and to be successful.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for use in her farm.

loans.name: Jasmines Group

texts.es:
Nina es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 3 meses, 2 y 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es sensible, sincera, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, buena madre, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ un área caracterizada por el gigantesco crecimiento de su población; mineros relocalizados del occidente y etnias como ‘Los Ayoreos’ nativas del lugar, se establecieron. Su siguiente generación, en su mayoría se ocupa del comercio y manufactura. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Nina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que practica. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción, y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela los menores aún no están en edad escolar. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación por el bien de su familia la hicieron liderar una banca de personas con actividades comerciales como; venta de jugo de quinua, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras, venta de helado, elaboración de empanadas, venta de carne de cordero y taller mecánico, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano; como pantalones, camisas, blusas, jeans, poleras, camisetas, etc. Actividad que realiza durante el día. Como segunda actividad se dedica a la venta de bijouteria como; pulseras, manillas, anillos, aretes, etc., de forma ambulante en comercios, ambas actividades las realiza durante el día, turnando días para cada producto. “tengo 2 actividades con las que me movilizo, los días que no puedo vender en la calle por cuestiones climáticas me dedico a la bijouteria en comercios bajo techo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su propia tienda para dejar de seguir ambulando. Ella desea aprovechar las fiestas de temporada para incrementar sus ventas mediante la compra y aumento de stock de ropa de segunda mano y bijouteria. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Nina solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano y bijouteria para aprovechar las ventas de temporada.
texts.en:
Nina, 29, lives with her partner.  She has three children, ages 3 months, 2, and 9.  Her business is selling used clothing.  She's a sensitive, sincere, understanding, patient, supportive, enterprising, responsible, and hardworking woman, as well as a good listener and a good mother.

She works as a street vendor in the Plan 3000 neighborhood, an area known for its huge population growth: Miners relocated from the west and ethnic groups like the Ayoreo people, natives of the area, settled there.  The next generation works primarily in commerce and manufacturing.  The tropical climate is warm and humid, with a temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade during the day.

Nina is short and dark and wears her long dark hair tied back.  Her native language is Guarani and she speak Spanish for cultural reasons and for business.  She lives with her partner, who works in construction, and her children; the eldest is in school and the younger ones are not yet of school age.  They live in a rented brick house with a corrugated metal roof, and they have potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Her desire to improve herself for her family's good made her form a bank with people to request a loan and expand their businesses, which include quinoa juice sales, perfume sales, soft drink sales, traditional pollera skirt sales, ice cream sales, empanada sales, lamb meat sales, and an auto repair shop.  Her second job is selling costume jewelry (bracelets, rings, earrings, etc.) on foot in shops.

She works both jobs during the day, taking turns at each job.  "I alternate between two jobs.  On days when I can't sell in the street because of the weather, I sell costume jewelry in shops with a roof," she said.  Her dream is to have her own store so she can stop working as a street vendor.

She wants to make the most of the seasonal celebrations to increase her sales with a purchase of and increase in supplies of second-hand clothing and costume jewelry.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the two years she has been doing both jobs.

For those reasons Nina's requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothing and costume jewelry to make the most of the holiday sales.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and costume jewelry to make the most of holiday sales

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 41-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchases and sales with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase more calves and heifers to serve more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase calves and heifers to serve more customers.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Haruna is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rabi Garba

texts.en: Rabi Garba is a maize farmer from Sarkin Dawa village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rabi Garba would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabi Garba can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Rabi Garba, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to ensure that other members of her community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a 37-year-old married woman and mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. She is a firewood vendor. Rosalia also runs a small sari-sari store selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. She also raises goats and pigs.

Rosalia is requesting a loan to buy more firewood to sell. This loan will help to improve her business, thus allowing her to augment her income and profit. In the future, Rosalia hopes to make her business more sustainable. She also wants to save money to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 41-year-old married woman residing in Palompon, Leyte. She has five children. Rose is engaged in retail sales of firewood. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Rose has sold firewood for more than four years now.  Rose is asking for a loan to buy more firewood to sell to the market. With more stock, she will be able to sell more for a good price. Rose dreams of improving their livelihood and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell to the market

loans.name: M. Ange

texts.en: M. Ange is 23 years old. She is married with one child who is three years old and does not yet go to school. She has a shop and has been in a business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, maize flour and cooking oil to resell.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy insurance for her family.

loans.use: To buy more salt, maize flour and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Nuhu S.

texts.en: Nuhu S. is a maize farmer from Hayin Mallam Bawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nuhu S. would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu S. can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Nuhu S., like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Vidala

texts.en: Vidala is a 47-year-old vegetable vendor from Palompon, Leyte.  She is married and has four dependents. Vidala has been in the vegetable selling business for more than two years now. She also earns a supplemental income from selling firewood. Vidala is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables and firewood to sell. A loan will help Vidala to improve her business and to earn income. Vidala’s greatest dream is to expand her business and improve their way of living.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en: Fazeelat is 38 years old. She is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer from Hayin Mallam Bawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Musa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure that other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ovilla

texts.en:
Ovilla, 39, is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines and is married to Isagani, a driver. They have five children: one is in college, one is in high school, two are in elementary school, and the last one is already working. She manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her four children to school. 

Ovilla operates a general store, where she sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers mostly all essential household items and food. It is the place customers go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also grills and sells barbecue by her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 900 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store she is requesting a Php 16000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, pasta, can goods, noodles, beverages. She will also use part of the loan to buy fresh meat, charcoal, and seasonings for her barbecue business. She expects a higher demand for groceries and orders for barbecue this Christmas season. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Ovilla hopes to maintain and grow her business to uplift their lives. She strives to hard to send her children to school to earn a college degree so they may become professionals. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Isiyaku expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide family with food and clothing, and in the long run, become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en: Barnabas is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Barnabas joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Kefas, Nahemiya and Sunday.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Barnabas would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Barnabas can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Barnabas  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jummai can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. loans.name: Dauda Maitala

texts.en: Dauda Maitala is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Dauda Maitala joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Kyauta, Roben and Amos. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda Maitala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda Maitala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Dauda Maitala  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: too pay for his children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Faxraddin

texts.en:
Faxraddin lives with his wife, son and bride. He is very friendly grandfather with two grandchildren. They live in the Füzuli region. His daughter is married and not living with them. His son is a tailor at the same village. For 22 years they have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli city.

Faxraddin has few cows. He and his wife prepare dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt, etc.), which he sells in the local bazaar to earn money. Now Faxraddin is applying to Kiva partner Komak for a 900 AZN, as winter is coming and he must buy vaccinations for his cows. He is thankful to Kiva and Komak for help. In the future he wants to help his son to buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy vaccinations for his cows for his dairy business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 57 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. She does farming in Tala town and has been in this business for 14 years. She keeps dairy cows and also plants cash crops to sell.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of poultry for rearing. This will enable her to supply more eggs and chicken to her retail shops and hotel customers. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her family. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to be a chicken and egg supplier, add more dairy cows and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy poultry for rearing

loans.name: Alh. Mohammed

texts.en: Alh. Mohammed is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Mohammed would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Mohammed can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Alh.Mohammed is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old and he has a photo studio which he has been running for 20 years. He also has a boutique shop and it has been profitable. He is married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with two children. 

He will use this loan to expand his business by buying more stock of shoes, cosmetics and beauty products to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. In the future he hopes to be successful in his business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes, cosmetics and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is a 41-year-old married woman from Palompon, Leyte. She is engaged in a poultry business. She raises chickens which she sells to the market after several weeks. This is the source of her income.  Roselyn is asking for a loan to buy more chickens to raise. A loan will increase the productivity of her business, thus augmenting her income. Roselyn’s dream is to make her business successful and productive.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Amina joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Bala, Ezra and Nahemia. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Amina would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Amina can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Amina  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is a 64-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown-up children. She lives in Palompon, Leyte. Sylvia is engaged in food selling of processed meat like longganisa (sausage) and tocino (bacon).  Sylvia is standing next to a fridge in which she stores her meat products. As of now, she is requesting a loan to buy more longganisa and tocino to sell to her customers in her neighborhood. A loan will help Sylvia improve her business’ profitability and sustainability.

loans.use: to buy more longganisa and tocino to sell to her customers

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is a 34-year-old married woman from Palompon, Leyte. She operates a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Evangeline has been in the business for more than a year now. Evangeline is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, condiments and others.  Evangeline believes that a loan will help her improve her store’s stock, thus attracting more buyers. In the future, Evangeline hopes to make her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, condiments and others.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Alice, a young, hardworking small holder farmer who is 37 years of age. She is happily married to a handsome man, and they are blessed with six children. She hails from Munyaka, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Her upbringing was challenging and she never went to college so that she could secure a formal job, but she did not surrender to that, and has been practicing farming for the past fifteen years. 

Through farming, she has been able to take care of her young family. Her main source of income has been milk, eggs and crop farming, and through these ventures, she has supported her family because she is the breadwinner. Alice passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of her animals “Blacky,” which is an English word depicting the color of the cow. Alice stated that the most enjoyable bit about farming is “it gives me personal fulfillment and feeds my family." 

Although she has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. She has been facing challenges transporting her produce from the farm to the market; that is why she is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. The Kitale area is a rural town and roads are very poor. For Alice, transporting goods has always been a “nightmare.” She has been suffering losses because goods reach the market when they are not fresh, hence fetching a low price. Vegetables and milk are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, and through the loan, she will be able to achieve her dream. 

Alice plans to employ someone who will be helping her in farm work and transporting the produce to the market, hence impacting the society positively through creation of employment. Increased profits from the loan will allow her to repay the loan fully and be able to permanently change her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport her produce from the farm to the market

loans.name: Noshaba

texts.en: Noshaba is 45 years old and a married woman. She is been in the beauty parlor business for thirteen years. She is known in her town for offering many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Now, she needs to deal with more customers, over and over. For this reason she has obtained a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR. It enabled her to purchase more hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase more hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en: Sarwar, age 63, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. Sarwar needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase one more baby cow to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase one more baby cow to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Kalsom

texts.en: Kalsom, age 30, is a married lady. The man shown in the photo is her husband. She is running a successful business selling goats to provide her family with a decent life. She buys baby goats at low prices and after raising them for a year or two, sells them out in her locality. Currently she has requested  a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats, to increase her sales in order to fulfill her dream of providing a good education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en: Mehnaz, age 29, is a married lady. The man shown in the photo is her husband. She is running a successful business selling goats to provide her family with a decent life. She buys baby goats at low prices and after raising them for a year or two, sells them out in her locality. Currently she has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats, to increase her sales in order to fulfill her dream of providing a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales

loans.name: Twin Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photograph is James, a member of Twin Women Group. He is 65 years old and blessed with six children. James is a maize, beans and potatoes farmer. Part of his produce is used for family consumption, and the rest is put into commercial use. He is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the enterprise management training he received, which equipped him with skills to manage his business.

James is borrowing from Kiva to purchase farm inputs, e.g., seeds, fertilizer and storage sacks. This will help improve his crop yield and production, hence, increasing his income. He plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children.

James is grateful to Kiva and his lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and storage sacks that will help improve on crop yield and productivity.

loans.name: Ilena

texts.es:
Ilena es estudiante del primer año de la carrera de ciencias Administrativas, trabaja actualmente en la misma universidad en la que estudia, comenta que es casada y tiene una hija.
Ella se esfuerza por su familia, ya que son su principal sostén y ayuda,que siempre la apoyan.
Solicito el préstamo para pagar las cuotas pendientes del semestre y los derechos de exámenes, para poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ilena is a student in the first year of the program in administrative sciences. She is now working in the same university where she studies. She comments that she is married and has a daughter.

She works hard for her family, since they are her principal supporters, and it helps that they always encourage her.

She applied for the loan to pay the pending bills of the semester and the examination fees in order to be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay pending bills and examination fees.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia sigue trabajando como Profesora de danza; enseña en varias academias, vive con sus padres. Sus metas futuras son montar su propia academia, guardería  para obtener mejores  ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
Está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura en Educación Inicial, y quiere poder realizarse como profesional y persona.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de una notebook y una impresora, que le serán de mucha ayuda a la hora de realizar sus trabajos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Lidia continues to work as a dance instructor; she teaches at various schools. She lives with her parents. Her future goals are to start her own school / daycare center, so she can make more money and help her family.

She is pursuing an elementary education license, and she wants to be able to fulfill herself as a professional and as a person.

She is asking for this loan to use to buy a notebook computer and a printer, which will be very helpful to her as she does her homework for college.

loans.use: to buy a notebook computer and printer

loans.name: Jared

texts.en: Jared is a married man. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells bananas, tomatoes and other fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located in a safe place and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be competition from other sellers. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to be a wholesaler of fruits and vegetables within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a good business. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank; his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Danjuma

texts.en: Danjuma is a maize farmer from Badamasi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Danjuma would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Danjuma can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Danjuma, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man with one child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are large scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough working capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is his second  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; his previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock to sell during this festive season.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
For the last 14 years Florence has been selling assorted vegetables and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is married and blessed with two school-going children. 

She has applied for her second loan of 40,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more assorted vegetables and fruits for sale.

She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Palakia

texts.en: Palakia is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be serious in business. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are ladies. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a big and busy shop within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are ladies. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for use in the salon. She hopes that in the future she will be the greatest salonist in her area. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a married man. He has four children whose ages range from 3 years to 9 years old. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a transport business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are regular. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to have a transport company within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en: Leatu is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Leatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Leatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Leatu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing. thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 34 years. She is married to George and together they have been blessed with three children aged 12, 8 and 3 years old.

Hellen sells groceries, a business she has been in for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 25,000 KES. Hellen has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of 20,000 KES, which she will use to add stock of groceries and fruits in season. With the anticipated profits, Hellen will be able to restock her business as well as repay her loan. She also will be able to pay school fees for her children.

Her hope and dream for the future is to increase her source of income.

loans.use: to add stock of groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a generator to be used in irrigation

loans.name: Sulma Patricia

texts.es:
Sulma, invirtió el préstamo anterior en materia prima para la venta de pupusas y comida, generando un impacto positivo en su negocio, hoy en día cuenta con un nivel menor de endeudamiento, da apoyo a su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar y tiene mayor cantidad de clientes.
Como una forma de continuar desarrollando sus actividades está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en granos básicos, harina, verduras, azúcar, condimentos, aceite, leña y gas propano, para seguirá trabajando.
texts.en:
Sulma invested her previous loan in raw materials for the sale of pupusas (thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) and food, creating a positive impact in her business. Today, she has a lower amount of debt, she helps her husband to cover household expenses, and she has a larger number of clients.
As a way to keep developing her occupation, she is asking for a new loan to invest in bulk grains, flour, vegetables, sugar, condiments, oil, firewood, and propane gas, to keep working.

loans.use: to invest in bulk grains, flour, vegetables, sugar, condiments, oil, firewood, and propane gas, to keep working.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida, age 52, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. Khalida needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase one more buffalo to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Fukhraj

texts.en: Fukhraj is 49 years old and a married woman. She is been in the beauty parlor business for two years. She is known in her town for offering many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Now, she needs to deal with more customers, time after time. For this reason she has obtained a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR. It enabled her to purchase more hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase more hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, de 52 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de la escuela, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, de los cuales solo dos viven en su misma casa, uno tiene 20 años y trabaja en una pizzería como cocinero y la otra hija tiene 33 y le ayuda a su madre en el negocio familiar, también viven con ella sus tres nietos.

El negocio que posee Rosa, consiste en la elaboración de tortillas, empanadas, enchiladas y yuca frita, oficio que lleva realizando por cuatro años.- También, cuando tiene tiempo se dedica a lavar y planchar ropa ajena cuando se lo piden. 

Cuando fue joven trabajó en algodoneras, luego se dedicó a realizar oficios domésticos y posteriormente, decidió iniciar su propio negocio.- En el trabajo se involucra su hija mayor y una nuera.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar los materiales e insumos básicos para poner una pupusería.- Rosa, considera que este negocio le dejará buenas ganancias.

Rosa, sueña con lograr reparar su casa, pues el techo se encuentra bastante deteriorado y es necesario reestructurarlo.- También, desea llegar a tener un carro, con el cual poder realizar viajes con su familia y  aprovecharlo también, para vender en diferentes sectores de su comunidad o fuera de ella.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52 years old. She studied until third grade in school. She is a single mother to four children, of which only two live in the same home. One son is 20 years old and works in a pizza restaurant as a cook, and the other, a daughter, is 33 and helps her mother in the family business. She has three grandchildren that live with her as well.

The business that Rosa owns consists of making tortillas, empanadas, enchiladas, and yuca frita (fried yucca); this is a trade she has been doing for the last four years. Also, when she has time (and when she is asked), she makes a living washing and ironing clothes.

When she was younger, she worked in cotton fields; after, she made a living doing domestic housework, and after, she decided to start her own company. Her oldest daughter (and her daughter) are involved in her work.

The loan she is requesting is to buy materials and basic ingredients to have her pupusa shop. Rosa believes that her business will have a great profit.

Rosa dreams of doing repairs on her home, because the roof is pretty run down and needs to be restructured. Also, she hopes to own a car so she can take vacations with her family, as well as use it to sell to different sectors in and outside of her community.

loans.use: to buy the materials and basic ingredients to have a pupusa shop.

loans.name: Naghmana

texts.en: Naghmana is a 43-year-old working woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband. After she married, she felt that she should help her husband to improve their financial condition, so she started a business of cloth trade in her locality. Naghmana believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. She is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Naghmana has taken out a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth in different colors to increase sales and earn substantial profits. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth in different colors to increase sales

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar viene de una familia humilde, sus padres se dedican a al comercio , el mediante el apoyo de sus padres procura  terminar su estudios universitarios, para que pueda tener un futuro mejor.
Él esta estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en letras, y a través de su profesión quiere abrirse camino para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Oscar comes from a humble family. His parents work in commerce. With the support of his parents, he is seeking to finish his university studies so that he can have a better future.

He is studying in the Bachelor of Arts program, and through his profession he wants to open a path to be able to be someone in life.

He is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the payment of his program fees. In this way he will be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay program costs

loans.name: Mrangirangi Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her late 50s, is single with five children, two of whom are still in school and three are grown-ups. She has been selling new clothes and cosmetics since 2010. She works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling cosmetics and to buy clothes in fashion and has paid back her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a laptop and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy clothes, cosmetics and renovate her shop by installing floor tiles and painting. She dreams of building more rooms on her house.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group Mrangirangi which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and renovate her shop by installing floor tiles and painting .

loans.name: Afiniki

texts.en: Afiniki is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Afiniki joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Lucy, Linus and Godwin.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Afiniki would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Afiniki can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Afiniki spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nhóm 3 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en:
Do, 44, is a farmer who earns about VND 600,000 monthly. She has four children, two of whom are in high school and the other two are in university. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1990.

Currently, her family is using an unhygienic latrine. A portion of Group 3 - Kim Dinh 01's loan will help Do as well as other group members to build a septic tank and a hand-washing device with soap. This will help to improve living conditions and the health of families throughout her community, and to protect the environment.

In the picture, she stands in the front row, first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap.

loans.name: Daysi Aracely

texts.es:
Daysi, tiene un negocio que consiste atender una tienda de productos básicos para el hogar y además se dedica a la crianza de pollos, vive con su familia formada por su esposo y una hija de un año de edad, sus actividades las realiza todos los días sin un horario establecido, siendo muy joven y soltera aprendió de su familia estos oficios.
Comprará pollos de engorde y concentrado para mejorar la granja, el resto lo invertirá en aceite, bebidas, golosinas, detergentes, etc., para tener nuevos productos en la tienda, así tendrá oportunidad de  aprovechar las fiestas navideñas y de fin de año para generar más ingresos, que serán de ayuda para cancelar su deuda y cambiar el estilo de vida familiar.
Sus sueños son tener un patrimonio sólido para que su hija se convierta en profesional.
texts.en:
Daysi has a business that consists of running a shop for basic household products as well as raising chickens. She lives with her family: her husband and a one year old daughter. She runs her business every day without an established schedule, being very young and single, she learned these trades from her family. 

She will buy broiler chickens and concentrate in order to improve the farm, and the rest will be invested in oil, drinks, candy, detergents, etc, to have new products in the store. She will thus have the opportunity to take advantage of Christmas parties and the end of the year and to earn more profits. This will help her to pay off her debts and to change her family's lifestyle. 

Her dreams are to have a strong estate that will help her daughter become a professional.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens and concentrate in order to improve the farm.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, su sueño es ser un profesional en el ámbito de la ingeniería agroindustrial para llevar en alto sobre las industrias del paraguay y ayudar a su familia.
El es una persona que quiere salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto.
texts.en:
Cristian is from the city of Carapeguá. His dream is to be a professional in the area of agroindustrial engineering in order to raise up the industries of Paraguay and help his family.

He is a person who wants to get ahead and be someone in life.

He is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the payment of his program fees, as a way to be able to cover this expense.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Elmer Eugenio

texts.es:
Elmer, de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene una niña de 5 años, que aún no ingresa a la escuela.  
                                                               
Elmer, es agricultor en pequeño desde hace 5 años, aprendió viendo y ayudando a sus hermanos mayores.- Además, tiene cuida ganado; el lugar donde siembra, está a 1 kilómetro de su casa y se va en bicicleta,  un vecino es quien le ayuda en las labores agrícolas. 

El préstamo es para comprar abono, pesticidas y semilla para sembrar 3,500 metros cuadrados de pipián y 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz, en época de verano; pues cuenta con el motor y sistema de riego.
 
El sueño de Elmer es, seguir trabajando en la agricultura, para poder mantener a su familia y en un  futuro poder construir su casa con paredes de concreto, pues actualmente toda su casa es de láminas.
texts.en:
Elmer, who is 24 years old, studied until sixth grade. He has a partner, who takes care of the home, and a 5-year-old daughter, who still has not started school.
Elmer has been a small scale farmer for 5 years. He learned by watching and helping his older brothers. He also takes care of livestock. The place where he sows is one kilometer away from his home, and he cycles there. A neighbor helps him with agricultural tasks.
The loan is to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seed to sow 3,500 square meters of pipián (a kind of squash), and 3,500 square meters of maize, in the summer season, because he can use a motor and an irrigation system. 
Elmer’s dream is to keep working in agriculture to be able to support his family, and in the future be able to build a house with concrete walls, because currently, his whole house is made of laminate.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seed to sow 3,500 square meters of pipián (a kind of squash), and 3,500 square meters of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes, oranges, rice and other items

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He has two children who are two and six years old. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he makes metallic boxes, cooking pans, ovens and other items to sell. His business is located in an area with many customers. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy metal sheets and other materials for making boxes, pans etc. His business goal is to open another business branch within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good business and educate his children. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. He will use the anticipated profits to open another business branch.
