loans.use: to buy metal sheets and other materials for making boxes, pans etc

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita started her small business and became her own boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls over her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she makes good sales since she is the only store in her barangay.

Recently she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities.

In the future, she hopes to provide a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en: Shumaila is a 39-year-old married woman. Her brother (also shown in the photo) is running a furniture-making business. Over time he has become famous for providing good-quality furniture in his community. For the improvement of her brother’s business, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from Murabaha to purchase good-quality wood with the packs of polish and nails in a larger quantity. This will help the business cater to more customers without delay, which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood with the packs of polish and nails in larger quantity to cater to more customers

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is a 41-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who has been in the business of cattle sales and purchases for the past three years. Safina fully supports and assists her husband with his work. They currently have a few goats. Now, Safina has requested a Murabaha loan for her husband of PKR 30,000, which he used to purchase more goats to sell in the market, to earn good profits and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to earn good profits

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen, a 27-year-old lady, has two children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been selling fruit in his locality for many years. He uses the income to support his entire family. Currently Noreen has requested a loan from Murabaha of 20,000 PKR for her husband. He used it to purchase more sacks of fruit, including oranges, apples, guavas, and dates. He hopes to increase his sales in order to generate a healthier source of income, to provide a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of fruit, including oranges, apples, guavas, and dates

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a 42 year old, married woman with seven children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosalie has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Rosalie requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jerressa

texts.en:
Jerressa is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Jerressa requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Jerressa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a metal shop business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her metal shop business.

Analyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Analyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Balarabe

texts.en: Balarabe is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Balarabe would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Balarabe can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Balarabe expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide family with food and clothing and, in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nhóm 4 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en:
Nga, 39, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of about VND 500,000. She has a child who is currently in Primary school. She has been a member of the Women's Union since 1995. Her family does not have a sanitary toilet.

With this loan, Nga will build a sanitary toilet that will improve her family's quality of life and help her family stay healthy by avoiding diseases and infections associated with using an unsafe latrine. In the picture, she is in the middle of the first row.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 5 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en:
Huong, pictured right in the middle of the first row, is 28 years old and works in agriculture with a monthly income of approximately VND 600,000. She has two children still in primary school. Due to the family's economic hardship, her household does not have a hygienic latrine. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2006.

With this loan, Huong will use the funds to build a septic tank to improve living conditions, improve the health of family members and contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Nhóm 7 - Kim Định 01 Group

texts.en:
Tuoi, pictured in the middle of the first row, is 59 years old and working in agricultural production with a monthly income of approximately VND 600,000. She is married and has three children.

Due to the lack of funds, her family does not have a sanitary latrine. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1875.

A portion of Group 7 - Kim Dinh 01's loan will help Tuoi as well as other group members build a septic tank latrine and a hand-washing device with soap. This will help to improve their living conditions, secure the health of local families, and contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever es estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial tiene una hija de 4 años, su mamá y su papá son comerciantes. Comenta que se esfuerza mucho por poder dar a su hija un buen futuro.
Al terminar su carrera se ve como Gerente en la empresa que se encuentra trabajando actualmente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y continuar luchando por cumplir con sus metas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Ever is a student pursuing a degree in business engineering.  He has a four-year-old daughter.  His mother and father are business people.  He remarks that he makes a great effort to be able to give his daughter a good future.

When he finishes his degree, he sees himself as a manager in the business where he’s currently working.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for his degree and to continue fighting to fulfill his goals.  He is grateful for this opportunity that he has received to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay the fees for his degree.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, es estudiante de la carrera de arquitectura, está en la etapa de su tesis, a punto de terminar su carrera.
Comenta que su meta es poder tener su titulo y trabajar para poder abrirse camino en el mundo laboral y hacerse un profesional conocido.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y así estar cada vez más cerca de su meta como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Pedro is from the city of Ybycuí. He is studying in the program in architecture. He is at the thesis stage, at the point of finishing his program.

He comments that his goal is to have his degree and work to be able to open a path in the world of work and become a recognized professional.

He is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the payment of the fees for his program and thus be closer and closer to his goal, as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are ladies.

Rose will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use.

loans.name: Samini

texts.en:
Samini is a married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 7 to 15 years. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, flour and sugar. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are locals.

Samini describes his biggest business challenge to be competition. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of flour, bread and sugar.

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of flour, bread and sugar.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en: Cyrus is a married man. He has two children who are 5 and 10 years old. He describes himself to be loyal. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to open another business branch within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be kind. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand and have a large store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Ambenakan Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe AMBENAKAN ont en moyenne 49 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des ustensiles de cuisine et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe AMBENAKAN sont à leur 6ème prêt solidaire. ROKIA, 1ère  femme assise à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 douzaines de plateau, 20 cueilleurs, 30 tasses Inox, 20 théières et 30 assiettes. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in group AMBENAKAN are on average 49 years old with five children. They all live in traditional extended families in KIMPARANA/SEGOU (the Republic of Mali’s fourth administrative region).

These women met through family relations. They trade in kitchen utensils and various other products. After repaying their previous loans without incidents, group AMBENAKAN’s women are on their sixth solidarity loan. ROKIA, the first woman sitting from the left in the photo, intends on using her loan to purchase ten dozens trays, twenty spoons, thirty stainless steel cups, twenty teapots, and thirty plates. She purchases locally from wholesalers. She retails to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and often offers credit.

She foresees an average monthly profit of 30,000 XOF, which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Ijumo Group

texts.en:
Through her group. Annet has applied for a loan. She trades in timber and is a well known business lady in Ijumo village, Ishaka Municipality Bushenyi District. She works for 8 hours a day and she also has another source of income from agriculture, specializing in coffee farming in Bushenyi District. She started these businesses to generate income. She says she will use these loan funds to buy trees to cut into timber. She sells the timber mainly to builders and carpentry workshops.

She aims at stabilizing her financial sources of incomes as her dream ideal. She is married and wants her five children aged 22, 20, 18, 17 and 15 years old. who are all in school. to grow in a good environment. She is hard-working, though her main challenge is still limited capital.

She applauds her group members for being hard working and innovative and the Kiva lenders for fighting poverty.

loans.use: To buy trees

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and bags. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future she will own many clothing  stores. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Lider

texts.es:
Lider es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, tiene 23 años de edad, es un joven muy dedicado y quiere salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia.
Estudia la carrera de administración de empresas, y quiere poder abrirse camino por medio de su carrera, y de esa forma poder ser un profesional exitoso.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir luchando por cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Lider is from the city of San Ignacio.  He is 23 years old.  He is a very dedicated young man, and he wants to get ahead to be able to help his family.

He is studying for a degree in business administration, and he wants to be able to open a path for himself through his degree. That way, he can be a successful professional.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for his degree, and thereby be able to continue fighting to fulfill his goal.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Miguelina tiene 19 años, es de la ciudad de san Ignacio, es estudiante de la carrera de ciencias contables, por medio de esta carrera quiere abrirse camino en el mundo laboral.
Es una joven muy luchadora y sacrificada que quiere salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida por medio de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de su universidad, como ser cuotas y materiales.
texts.en:
Miguelina is 19 years old, and she is from the city of San Ignacio.  She is studying for a degree in accounting sciences.  Through this degree, she wants to open a path for herself into the working world.

She is a very determined and self-sacrificing young woman who, through her studies, wants to get ahead and be someone in life.

She is requesting this loan to be able to cover her university expenses, such as fees and materials.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay her fees.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, es estudiante de la carrera de educación física, comenta que su meta es poder recibirse y poder ayudar a su familia.
Es una joven tranquila, estudiosa y procura por tener una buena vida. Su sueño es poder conseguir un trabajo y trabajar.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Gladys is from the city of Ybycuí. She is a student in the program in physical education. She comments that her goal is to graduate and be able to help her family.

She is a serene and studious young woman who is trying to have a good life. Her dream is to be able to find a job and work.

She is applying for this loan in order to be able to pay her university fees and in this way be able to continue with her studies, striving for her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Gati

texts.en: Gati is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the fluctuation of prices. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and other vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will own a warehouse. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, con el apoyo de financiamientos mantiene su negocio de venta de especias en el mercado, poco a poco su situación económica se ha estabilizado, tiene nuevas demandas y  mantiene un buen record crediticio.
Requiere de un nuevo préstamo para comprar bicarbonato, orégano, chan, mostaza, pimienta, etc., al por mayoreo, así logrará cumplir con los diferentes pedidos de la temporada y obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Victor, with the help of financing, takes care of his spice sales business in the market. Little by little, his economic situation has stabilized, he has new orders, and maintains a good credit record. 
He needs a new loan to purchase baking soda, oregano, chia seeds, mustard, pepper, etc., at wholesale, to be able to meet the various seasonal orders and receive a good income.

loans.use: to purchase baking soda, oregano, chia seeds, mustard, pepper, etc., at wholesale, to be able to meet the various seasonal orders.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the fluctuation of prices. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand and have a larger clothes store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be outgoing. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a town centre and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially independent. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis is 26 years old and a Roma married man with a two-year-old child and a three-month-old child. To earn a living, he resells old items including clothing, shoes, kitchenware and electrical appliances in the Roma market in his city. Kindly note that this market is the largest in Albania. It was initially built by contribution of Romas themselves, but after a while it caught fire. Until they rebuilt it, the municipal government built a new one for them. Some of the Romas sell new items as well. All these items are brought from the neighboring countries. Luis' mother lives in Greece and she sent the items from there so that they could be resold. Luis is seeking your financial help to buy inventory items to resell.

loans.use: to stock up on second-hand inventory items to resell

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Alba es una persona muy luchadora, que se esta esforzando por poder ser una profesional exitosa que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus conocimientos y su trabajo. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, lo que le fue muy útil.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alba is a very hard-working person who is striving to be able to be a successful professional who can help other people through her knowledge and her work.

She comments that she used her previous loan to be able to pay her program fees, which was very useful for her.

She is requesting this loan to be able to again pay her program fees and in this way be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a bakery where he bakes and supplies cakes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a developing area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of wheat flour, sugar and other ingredients for preparing cakes. His business goal is to be a main supplier of cakes within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, sugar and other ingredients for preparing cakes

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 47 years old, widowed and a mother of four children. She sells clothes and has been running her business for two years.  

She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer is a married woman who has four children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells onions, tomatoes and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be a major supplier within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to her M-pesa float

loans.name: Owen

texts.en: Owen is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a farm where he grows collard greens. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with good climate for agriculture and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. His business goal is to have a big market within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will prosper in business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a married woman. She has two children who are four and six years old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy hair weaves and other hair products for salon use. Her business goal is to open a beauty products shop within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy hair weaves and other hair products for salon use

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a single woman who has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a pub where she sells drinks, and has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of drinks

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a married woman who has two children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a tailoring shop where she repairs and makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic area with business growth and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her life style. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a bookshop where she sells books and other stationery. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of stationery. Her business goal is to own three bookshops in town within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: buy more stock of stationery

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells secondhand clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial problems. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a supplier of clothes to retailers within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better living. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 25 years old. He is married to Grace and together they have been blessed with one child.

Robert is a hawker, a business he has done for the last four years, earning a monthly income of 50,000 KES. Robert has requested his second loan with VisionFund Kenya of 54,000 KES, which he will use to buy more plastic goods for hawking. He successfully repaid his previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Robert will be able to start another business in order to increase his profits.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be able to support his family and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more plastic goods for hawking

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 33 years old and he has a retail shop in Nairobi town, which he has been running for eight years. He is married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 1 child. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of milk, bread, sugar, flour, rice, cooking oil and detergents to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to open a wholesale shop.  This is his fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods for sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells secondhand clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial problems. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a supplier of clothes to retailers within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better living. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and labor so that she can build a wash basin and a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian es de la ciudad de Luque, es docente y para adquirir mas conocimientos opto por seguir estudiando, actualmente tiene como meta terminar su carrera universitaria que es la de Didáctica así superarse e ir dando mayor servicio profesional a la sociedad.
Está esforzándose para poder ser una persona capacitada que se esfuerza por ir mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su curso, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lilian is a teacher from the city of Luque. In order to acquire more knowledge, she chose to continue her studies. Her current goal is to finish her university degree in Education, which will help her to excel as she provides better professional service to society.

Lilian is striving to become a competent individual who does her best to improve. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her course. As a result, she will be able to continue her studies as before.

loans.use: to pay for an educational course.

loans.name: Surayyo

texts.ru: Сурайё 29-летняя разведенная женщина, имеющая двух детей. Ее дочери 14 лет, а сыну 8 лет. Сурайё с детьми живет в районе Рудаки. Дети для нее являются смыслом жизни и она старается, чтобы они не испытывали нужду. Сурайё без поддержки бывшего мужа сама обспечивает свою семью. Ее дети учатся в местной школе, а сама Сурайё работает швеей. Вот уже три года как она занимается шитьем женских национальных платьев. В деятельности ее все устраивает, так как она не только зарабатывает на жизнь, но и преобретает много хороших знакомых. В данный момент Сурайё начала ремонт в доме. Она хочет подоготовиться к зиме, утеплить дом и улучшить условия проживания в доме. Однако для завершения ремонта дома ей не хватает еще немного средств. Ей некуда обратиться, поэтому она решила получить кредит. Сурайё ответственный человек, она обещает выплачивать кредит в срок за счет своей швейной деятельности. Поддержите Сурайё в эту нужную минуту.
texts.en: Surayyo is a  29-year-old divorced woman with two children. Her daughter is fourteen years old, and her son is eight years old. Surayyo and her children live in Rudaki. Her children mean everything to her and she works hard so they won't be in need. Surayyo supports the family without any support from her ex-husband. Her children attend a local school, and Surayyo works as a seamstress. For three years she has been sewing women's traditional dresses. She likes her work since it not only makes her a living, but also helps her acquire a lot of good friends. Currently, Surayyo needs to renovate her house. She wants to prepare for winter, warm the house and improve living conditions in the house. However, she doesn't have money to complete the home renovations. She had nowhere to turn, so she decided to get a loan. Surayyo is a responsible person. Because of her clothing business, she promises to repay the loan on time. Support Surayyo in her time of need.

loans.use: renovate her home and prepare for winter.

loans.name: Horacio

texts.es: Las ganas de superación y deseos de una mejor vida es lo que han motivado a Don Horacio de 71 años a salir adelante con su pequeño negocio de alquiler de molino y venta de maíz. Tiene cuatro hijos que ya no están a su cargo porque ya trabajan, su esposa ha sido su apoyo incondicional en todo momento. Para seguir adelante con el molino Don Horacio solicita un crédito para comprar maíz y algunos repuestos para el molino. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta poner un puesto de venta de granos básicos.
texts.en: The drive to succeed and the dreams of a better life is what has motivated Horacio, who is 71, to get ahead with his small business of renting a grinder and sale of maize. He has four children who are no longer under his care because they work. His wife has helped him unconditionally in every moment. To be able to continue with the grinder, Horacio asks for a loan to purchase maize and some replacement parts for the grinder. One of his future plans is to open a stall to sell bulk grains.

loans.use: to purchase maize and some replacement parts for the grinder.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase sewing materials to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Conselata

texts.en: Conselata is a married woman. She has four children whose ages range from 8 years to 23 years. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial problems. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better living. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Aminta

texts.es:
Aminta, de 41 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la venta de pan, tiene 3 hijos y uno vive con ellos.

Aminta, tiene una pupusería desde hace 4 años, aprendió por iniciativa.- Además, con su pareja salen a vender frutas y verduras a las comunidades más cercanas, la venta la hacen cada 2 días, desde las 4:00 p.m. a 7:00 p.m. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar un horno, ya sea eléctrico o artesanal, para elaborar su propio pan y venderlo, ya que cuenta con los conocimientos para ejercer el oficio y el resto invertirlo en la venta de pupusas.

Aminta, desea que sus ventas incrementen y en un futuro vender tortillas también, porque tendrá el apoyo de una cuñada para hacer más eficiente el negocio.
texts.en:
Amina, who is 41 years old, studied until second grade. She is married and her husband works in bread sales; she has three children, one who lives with them. 
Aminta has had a pupusería (a shop selling stuffed tortillas) for 4 years. She learned on her own initiative. She and her husband also go and sell fruits and vegetables in nearby communities. They have sales every 2 days, from 4:00 p.m. until 7:00 p.m. 
She needs the loan to purchase an oven, either electrical of craft, to make and sell her own bread, since she has the knowledge to do the trade, and invest the rest in the sale of pupusas (thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). 
Aminta hopes that her sales increase, and to also sell tortillas in the future, because she will have the help of a sister-in-law to make the business more efficient.

loans.use: to purchase an oven, either electrical or craft, to make and sell bread.

loans.name: Abaasi

texts.en:
Abaasi is a 45-year-old married man with five children aged 20, 18, 15, 11, and 8. Each child attends a different school. He deals in the produce business and works six days a week, six hours a day. He has been in this business for 12 years.

He is also an agriculturalist who grows beans, maize, bananas and coffee, by which he generates additional income to support his family. His business is located in Kiruli and he usually sells his goods to people around Kiruli and surrounding areas, and sometimes to the city. He hopes to use the loan to boost his family income and buy more coffee to increase his business. His hope and dream is to construct a good house. However, he faces a challenge of limited capita,l which affects his operations.

loans.use: To buy coffee

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 36-year-old married man with four children aged 10, 8, 6, and 5. Each of the children attend a different school. He deals in a poultry business where he works six days a week, seven hours a day. He has been in this business since 2005.

He also deals in seasonal produce and agriculture, from which he generates additional income to support his family. He operates in areas of Ddwaniro and surrounding areas and usually sells his goods to fellow traders and local people in that area. He hopes to use the loan to construct and expand his chicken accommodation. However, he faces a challenge of limited capital and chicken diseases, which affect his operations. He is described as an honest and hardworking man in business. He appreciates the services offered by lenders.

loans.use: To construct a chicken pen

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo engages in the raising and selling of hogs. To augment his income, he also operates a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells various household commodities like noodles, canned goods, sugar, eggs and soap. He is a married man with nine dependents. Out of the nine, three are still attending school. He lives in Mcarthur, Leyte.
 
He is asking for a loan to buy more stock for the store like beverages, canned goods, soft drinks and other dry goods. These supplies will be beneficial in operating his store again. This will cause him to fill his store with a variety of stock and could attract more customers. With these, his income will improve, and now he will provide his family with good food and also finance the education of his children.
 
Arnulfo hopes that he can handle his current business in order to be successful and at the same time, improve the family's status of living.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for the store like beverages, canned goods, soft drinks and other dry goods

loans.name: Monica Janeth

texts.es: A sus 40 años de edad Monica es una señora casada, ella tiene su negocio familiar que es su tercena desde hace 24 años atrás, Monica junto a su marido e hijos también se apoya en este negocio, comenta que mientras que Monica atiende a la clientela, su esposo y su hijo se trasladan al campo a comprar el ganado para llevarles a faenarlos,   el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de toretes, la aspiracion de Mónica es tener el suficiente dinero para hacer realidad los sueños de sus hijos que es sacar un titulo profecional y mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Monica is a married woman who is 40 years of age. Her family business is a butcher shop that she has managed for 24 years. Monica, along with her husband and children, help one another with running the business. She says that while she is attending to the customers, her husband and children travel to the country to buy cattle that is ready to be slaughtered.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of beef cattle. Her aspiration is to have enough money to fulfill her dreams. These include seeing her children obtain a professional degree, improving her quality of life, and having a peaceful retirement.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle for butchering.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru:
Инобат проживает и работает в городке Турсунзаде. Ей 35 лет. Она мать. Инобат 3 года работает в торговой сфере. Она занимается продажей бобов и приправ. Инобат выходит на работу в любое время года и в любую погоду, чтобы поддержать источник дохода. Она старается работать больше, чтобы приносить больше дохода в семью и чтобы ее дети не знали нужду. Все что она делает, все для детей.
   Инобат решила расширить деятельность, то есть увеличить продаваемый товар. На привозку и купли достаточного количества товара ей не хватает не большой суммы денег и Инобат решилась обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en:
Inobat lives and works in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 35 years old. She is a mother. Inobat has been working in trade for three years. She sells beans and seasonings. Inobat works year-round in in all weather in order to maintain her income. She tries to work hard to bring in more income so that her children will not be in need. She does everything for her children.

Inobat decided to expand her shop by increasing sales. However, she does not have the money to buy and ship goods, so she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: buy spices and beans to increase sales.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 20 señoras que apuntan a una mejor y buena calidad de vida, todas son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su unión.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Bety, madre de 2 hijos menores, ella es costurera y macatera (vendedora ambulante), ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que está luchando por una vida mejor para ella y sus hijos, y de esa forma evitar que pasen por las necesidades por las que ellas tuvo que pasar.
Solicita este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
This committee consists of 20 women who have indicated that they want a better quality of life. All of them are female heads of household who want to help their loved ones as a result of having joined together.

One of the members is Sra. Bety, who is the mother of two young children. She a seamstress and a traveling saleswoman. Bety is a hardworking individual who is striving to achieve a better life for herself and her children. She wants her children to avoid the experience of being deprived, such as the one she had to endure.

Bety is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of fabrics, thread, elastics, and other supplies. This will help her to continue her work just as before. All of the group members appreciate the opportunity they have received so that they can continue their work.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastics, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Qimmat

texts.ru:
Киммат уроженка района Джиликуль, который расположился на юге страны. Природные и климатические условия района благоприятны для ведения тут растениеводства. В связи с этим Киммат, как и многие ее односельчане занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью.
Киммат имеет четверых сыновей и двоих дочерей, все они уже обзаведены семьями. Киммат живет вместе с мужем, одним сыном, невесткой и четырьмя внуками-школьниками. Киммат 77 лет. Она добрый, общительный и трудолюбивый человек. В таком пожилом возрасте она все еще активная и занимается посевом и сбром урожая. В данный момент Киммат обратилась за кредитом для приобретения минеральных удобрений для обработки посевов. Она нуждается в этом кредите.
texts.en:
Qimmat lives in Jilikul, in the south of the country. The climate and environment are good for farming. Therefore, Qimmat, like many of her fellow villagers, works in agriculture.

Qimmat has four sons and two daughters, all of them are grown with families of their own. Qimmat lives with her ​​husband, one son, daughter and four school-aged grandchildren. Qimmat is 77 years old. She is a kind, sociable and hardworking person. In her advanced age she is still active and sows and reaps her crops. Qimmat has now requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. She needs this loan.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows tea and also keeps cows. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are large scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs to enable him to increase production. He hopes that in the future, he will have a large scale business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tarpuy Group

texts.es: Verónica de 43 años de edad es casada y tiene 01 hijo dependiente. La Alcancía Comunal “Tarpuy” está conformada por 09 socias dinámicas y comprometidas con su negocio. Verónica se dedica a la venta de productos naturales como tónicos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio. De la misma manera ella labora como secretaria en un centro educativo. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de vitaminas, tónicos y jarabes. Su mayor deseo es poner su propio local de venta. El grupo “Tarpuy” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito.  Verónica se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior,  es la tercera del lado derecho y viste blusa floreada. En la parte superior a lado derecho se encuentra Liz la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en: Veronica, who is 43 years old, is married, and has 1 child who she supports. The communal bank “Tarpuy” is made up of 9 dynamic members who are committed to their business. Veronica’s occupation is the sale of natural products, such as tonics. With a lot of work, she has managed to get ahead with her business. At the same time, she works as a secretary in an educational center. She asked for the loan for the purchase of vitamins, tonics, and syrups. Her biggest wish is to have her own sales establishment. The group “Tarpuy” thanks all the people who made this loan possible. Veronica is standing in the back, she is the third from the right, and wears a flowered shirt. In the upper part on the right is Liz, who could not be on time due to work reasons.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, tonics, and syrups.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
En el grupo Sagrada Familia todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 8 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en un novel de pobreza extrema, las demás han ido mejorando.
Una mujer capaz de ir creciendo y mejorando por medio de su  trabajo, es la Sra. María, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de productos, comenta que al principio su despensa era pequeña, pero que poco a poco la fue surtiendo y hoy su negocio ya es muy amplio y mejorado, todo esto gracias a su esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su negocio, como ser panificados, verduras, frutas, lácteos, bebidas y otros. Todas las integrantes están agradecidas por la oportunidad que reciben de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
In the group Sagrada Familia, they all work and help each other get ahead. They are participating in the "Poverty Stoplight" questionnaire, where 8 members find themselves below the poverty line. In other words, at a level of extreme poverty. The rest have been improving.

One lady that is capable of growing and improving through her work is Maria, who has a well-stocked food store with all types of products. She mentions that at the beginning her store was small, but little by little she went about filling it, and now her business is very large and improved. This is all thanks to her effort.

She is requesting a loan to be able to invest in buying various products for her business, such as baked goods, vegetables, fruits, dairy, drinks and other items. All of the members are thankful for the opportunity they are receiving to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, vegetables, fruits, dairy, drinks and other items.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият всего 22 года. Она проживает на районе Шахринав вблизи с городком Турсунзаде. Хосият несмотря на свой юный возраст несколько времени она занимается земледелием. Хосият знает уже многое о посеве урожая. Сейчас многие жители уже заканчивают посев и Хосият тоже не исключение. Теперь необходимо обработать посеянный урожай минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить здоровый и богатый урожай. Но для купли необходимого количества минеральных удобрений, у Хосият нет достаточных средств, и она обратилась с надеждой на то, что ей помогут.
texts.en: Khosiyat is only 22 years old. She lives in the small town of Shakhrinav near Tursun-zoda. Khosiyat, despite being so young, has been farming for a while. Khosiyat already knows a lot about sowing crops. Now, many of the people have already finished planting, and Khosiyat is no exception. Now she needs fertilize her crop to get healthy and rich harvest. But Khosiyat does not have enough money to buy all the fertilizer. Therefore, she is hoping for help.

loans.use: buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sushmita

texts.en: Sushmita is a 23-year-old single student. She is studying for a Post graduate diploma in Banking & Finance in a reputable college in Bhubaneswar, Odisha. Her major is Banking and Finance. She is from a small village in Sundergarh district in Odisha. Due to the fact that she is short of finances to pay her tuition fees for her course, Sushmita has decided to take a loan. This loan will help her graduate successfully with a chance for a good job to build her future. For her dream, she wants to work in a bank.

loans.use: to pay for her banking and finance course fee

loans.name: Claudia Vanessa

texts.es: Claudia de 28 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de sandalias y prendas de vestir para dama, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Claudia desea realizar la conexión de agua potable en su vivienda ya que actualmente no cuenta con este vital servicio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tubos, cañerías, codos, grifos y derecho de instalación de agua potable en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Claudia is 28 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion and their two children. She is an enterprising woman who earns a living through her business of selling sandals and women’s clothes. Claudia has been in this business for 10 years and has a large number of customers who request her products.

She wants to install a water connection in her home since she does not receive this essential service. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in tubes, pipes, plumbing joints, faucets, and installation fees so that she can receive running water in her home.

loans.use: to pay for tubes, pipes, plumbing joints, faucets, and installation fees so that she can receive running water in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for making tamales.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра живет со своей семьей в городе Душанбе. Ей 31 год. Она мать четверых детей, дочери 13 лет, а сыновьям по 11, 9 и 7 лет. Гулчехра работает в ателье швеей. Данной деятельностью она уже занимается в течение 6 лет. Гулчехра берет заказ на пошив женской одежды национального стиля. Сейчас она хотела бы расширить сферу своих услуг. Гулчехра просит кредит, чтобы приобрести модернизированную швейную машинку, а оставшуюся малую часть потратить на проведение мероприятия. В дальнейшем она планирует еще успешнее продвигать свой бизнес и  открыть собственное ателье.
texts.en: Gulchehra lives with her family in the city of Dushanbe. She is 31 years old. She is the mother of four children: a thirteen-year-old daughter, and 11-, 9- and 7-year-old sons. Gulchehra works in a tailor's shop as a seamstress. She has been doing this for six years. Gulchehra takes orders for traditional dresses. Now she would like to expand the scope of her services. Gulchehra is asking for a loan to buy a modern sewing machine with enough to set some aside for the future. In the future, she plans to promote her business successfully so she can open her own shop.

loans.use: buy a modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза гордо носит статус жены и мамы. Ей 32 года Она с семьей проживает в городке под названием Турсунзаде. Фируза дома занимается предоставлением услуги портнихи. Она не много лет занята этой деятельностью, но уже полностью освоила свою работу. Для Фирузы доход от этого бизнеса является более чем необходимостью. Сейчас на ее пути стоит большая преграда. У нее сломалась швейная машинка и чтобы сохранить источник дохода, ей срочно надо купить швейную машинку и начать снова зарабатывать. На машинку у нее нет денег, и Фируза с надеждой обратилась за кредитом. Поддержите ее.
texts.en: Firuza is proud to be a wife and mother. She is 32, and she lives with her family in a town called Tursun-zoda. Firuza works from home as a seamstress. She has not been doing this long, but she has already mastered the job. The income she makes from this business is an absolute necessity for Firuza. Now she has a big problem. She broke her sewing machine and to keep making money she urgently needs to buy a sewing machine and start earning again. She has no money to buy a sewing machine. So, filled with hope, she asked for a loan. Support her.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Jonathan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jonathan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Jonathan, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Corazones Abiertos Group

texts.es:
17 son las integrantes de este grupo, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que se están esforzando por sus familias y sus seres queridos para poder darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Fidelina es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es la presidenta de este grupo, y comenta que siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras para poder esforzarse y salir adelante. Ella vende prendas variadas y con ello puede tener los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y sus ventas, para que su familia tenga todo lo que necesita para una vida digna.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this group are hardworking and enterprising women. They are working hard on behalf of their families and loved ones so that they can provide them everything that they weren’t able to have.

Fidelina is one of the members of this group and also serves as the president. She says that she always tries to motivate her fellow group members to do their best and push forward. Fidelina sells various types of clothes. Through this business, she has the necessary means to help her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy various types of clothes. This will enable her to continue her work and generating sales so that her family can have everything they need to live a decent life.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a native from Mcarthur, Leyte. She is a 49-year-old married woman with two grown children. She engages in the raising and selling of hogs.  To have an additional income, she engages in a tuba (coconut) wine vending business. She produces and sells tuba to the people in her place. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 12 years already.

She has requested a loan to buy tungog (a maroon color that gives a bitter taste to coconut wine to have natural fermentation) and to buy materials for the pig pen and pig feed. These will help Amelita and her family to grow and sell more pigs. She could now produce and sell more tuba to her customers. Eventually, she can start to pay her obligations and other household expenses.
 
In the future, she hopes to have a sustainable livelihood to help her improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy tungog (a maroon color that gives a bitter taste to coconut wine to have natural fermentation) and to buy materials for the pig pen and pig feed

loans.name: 19 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres 19 de Marzo está en su ciclo número 5° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para que vayan mejorando la vida de cada una.
La Sra. Feliciana era ama de casa pero con este préstamo que pide quiere comprar perfumes varios y joyas de plata para comercializar, y de esa forma poder buscar una forma más con la que podrá ayudar a su familia.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres 19 de Marzo" loan group is on its fifth loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme where all the members work and help each other in order to get ahead. The group's members are undergoing the poverty elimination survey in order to improve each of their lives.

Feliciana used to be a housewife but, with this loan, she wants to buy different perfumes and silver jewellery to sell. This way, she can find a way to help her family.

Feliciana is grateful for this opportunity to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different perfumes and silver jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa 3 está en su ciclo número 5° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Matilde, quien se dedica a la venta de verduras frescas que ella misma compra los más frescos y después los sale a vender. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, que se fue abriendo camino gracias a sus ganas de querer crecer y ser alguien en la vida. 
Pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras frescas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y luchar además cada día por ir mejorando.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Guapa 3" loan group is on its fifth loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme where all the members work and help each other in order to get ahead. The group's members are undergoing the poverty elimination survey and ten of them are living under the poverty line, ie. in extreme poverty.

One member of this group is Matilde, who makes a living selling fresh vegetables. Matilde buys the freshest vegetables and then goes out to sell them. She is very hard-working and has opened up a path for herself thanks to her desire to grow and to be someone in life.

Matilde is applying for this loan in order to buy fresh vegetables and continue with her sales. She can then keep on fighting every day in order to improve.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ziyoda

texts.ru:
Зиёда молодая жительница одного из красивых населенных пунктов Таджикистана района Дж.Руми. Район был назван в честь великого персидского писателя Джалоходдини Руми. Район отличается от других населенных пунктов своей особенной природой и воздухом. 
   Зиёда живет там с отцом, но сейчас ее папа работает заграницей, в Российской Федерации. На Родине Зиёда занимается шитьем женской одежды, на дому принимает заказы. В данной сфере она работает около года. Она влюбилась в свою работу и хочет дальше развиваться в этой сфере. Сейчас Зиёда запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку. Благодаря новой машинке она сможет улучшить качество работы и раскрыть свой потенциал.
texts.en:
Ziyoda is a young woman who lives in J. Rumy, one of the most beautiful regions of Tajikistan.  The region is named in honor of the great Persian writer Jalokhiddini Rumy and its unique natural setting and air set it apart from other regions.  Ziyoda lives here with her father, but he is currently working abroad, in the Russian Federation.

In her own homeland, Ziyoda has a home-based business making women's clothing to order.  She has been doing this for about a year.  Ziyoda has fallen in love with her work and she wants to develop her business further.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine, which will allow her to improve the quality of her work to her full potential.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Victor Julio

texts.es:
Victor, a sus 64 años de edad, es un hombre carismático, activo y servicial. Ser padre de tres hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 24 años, comenzó a fabricar y comercializar calzado para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 

Esto lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará calzado al por mayor e insumos como cuero, suelas y pegantes, así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en esta temporada navideña, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Victor manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en un gran distribuidor de calzado y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Victor!
texts.en:
At 64 years old, Victor is a charismatic, active and obliging man. Being the father of three children is Victor's greatest motivation to fight indefatigably every day to look for alternative ways to earn a living and support his children.

Around 24 years ago, Victor began to produce and sell footwear for all sorts of customers. He produces good quality products at excellent prices, which allowed him to become known in the local area and to take his business along the right path.

Victor is applying for this loan in order to strengthen his stock. He will use it to buy footwear in bulk and to buy supplies such as leather, soles and glues. He can then satisfy demand, which will increase during the Christmas season. This will help Victor to earn a higher income.

Victor says that his age does not stop him from doing the work that he is passionate about. Victor always sets himself new targets, including becoming a big footwear wholesaler and generating job opportunities. Victor would then be able to improve not only his own and his family's well-being but also that of others who would help him in his work.

So why not loan to Victor's business?

loans.use: to buy footwear in bulk and to buy supplies such as leather, soles and glues.

loans.name: Anipahan

texts.ru: Анипахан 31 год, замужем, 4 детей дошкольного возраста. Анипахан занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду она на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы. На участке мерою 0,90 ГА выращивает рис. Выручка от сельскохозяйственной деятельности составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). Так как это главный источник дохода, Анипахан в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, что позволит накопить средства на строительство магазина, о котором она давно мечтает.
texts.en:
Anipahan is 31 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are too young for school.  Anipahan is in the farming and animal husbandry business and, as a result of her hard work, today she has two cows.  Anipahan also grows rice on 0.9 ha of land.  The income from her business comes to about 25,000 som (KGS).

Since her business is her main source of income, Anipahan wants to develop it further and she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two steers.  She plans to reinvest the profits from her loan in her business, allowing her to save up the funds to build a store, which has been a dream of hers for a long time.

loans.use: to purchase two steers for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro, es un joven emprendedor de 19 años de edad, habitante del municipio de Galapa en el Atlántico, su idea de negocio nació de la mano de un amigo que vendía postres y yogurt,  después de un tiempo él continuó solo en el negocio ofreciéndoles a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares.  Él trabaja todos los días en el horario de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m., vende sus productos de contado o a crédito y aunque su capital es escaso, compra de contado los insumos como leche, crema de leche, leche condensada, galletas, frutas, gelatinas y saborizantes a graneros de la ciudad. Este negocio funciona desde el año 2012 y ha logrado consolidar su clientela gracias a los deliciosos productos que ofrece. En esta temporada navideña le han solicitado unos pedidos de postres, para ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual invertirá en algunos insumos como leche, galletas y frutas. Su meta de negocio es abrir un local comercial e  incrementar sus ventas,  así mismo su meta familiar es comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Pedro is an enterprising young man who is 19 years of age. He resides in the town of Galapa in the Department of Atlántico. His idea for a business started when he helped a friend with selling desserts and yogurt. After a period of time had passed, he continued the business alone by offering products to neighbors, friends, and relatives. Pedro works every day from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. He sells his products for cash or on credit, but his capital is scarce. Pedro goes to the stores in the city and pays cash for supplies such as milk, cream, condensed milk, cookies, fruit, gelatins, and flavorings.

His business has been in operation since 2012 and he has been able to establish his clientele thanks to the delicious products that he offers. For the Christmas season, his customers have placed a few dessert orders. This is why he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Pedro will invest in a few supplies such as milk, cookies, and fruit. His business goal is to open a retail shop so that he can increase his sales. At the same time, his goal for his family is to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy a few supplies such as milk, cookies, and fruit.

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.ru: Зарифа, 43 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование у Зарифы среднее, дополнительно много лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно полеводством и животноводством. По характеру Зарифа очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина, она очень общительная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве есть 1 корова. Также Зарифа выращивает на 0,36 ГА собственной земли картофель и кукурузу, экологически чистая продукция пользуется большим спросом. Совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса, Зарифа решила обратиться в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля. На прибыль от кредита она планирует и дальше развивать свою деятельность.
texts.en: Zarifa is 43 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. Zarifa has a secondary education and additionally has been involved in agriculture, specifically farming and animal husbandry, for many years. Zarifa is a pleasant and responsive woman; she is very sociable and hardworking. Her farm contains 1 cow. Zarifa also grows potatoes and corn, all ecologically-clean, highly-demanded products, on 0.36 hectares of owned land. Her combined monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Zarifa decided to request a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy potato seeds. She is planning to use the profit from the loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds in order to grow ecologically clean vegetables

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJEKADI ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des ustensiles de cuisine, des condiments, des céréales et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEKADI sont à leur 14ème prêt solidaire. SITAN, 1ère  femme debout à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40Litres d’huile, 10 paquets de Cube Maggi, 10Kgs de poivre, 15Kgs de beurre de karité, 10Kgs de piment et 20Kgs d’oignon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 33 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekadi group are on average 40 years old with four children, and all live in traditional extended families in Kimparana / Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali).

These women know each other through kinship ties and are traders of kitchen utensils, condiments, cereals and other products. Having correctly reimbursed their previous loans, the women in the Djekadi group are on their fourteenth group loan.

Sitan, the first woman standing on the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 40 liters of cooking oil, 10 packages of Maggi cubes, 10 kilos of pepper, 15 kilos of shea butter, 10 kilos of hot peppers and 20 kilos of onions. She gets her supplies from local wholesalers, and conducts her sales to both men and women customers, for cash and often on credit.

She expects average monthly profits of 33,000 CFA francs, which will be used to cover health-related expenses, food, clothing and school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a single man. He has one child. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to have a fleet of motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Cyprian

texts.en: Cyprian is a hardworking man age 45 years old hailing from the village of Sanga in Kiruhura district. He grew up without his parents after both of them died when he was very young. He was brought up by his grandmother who also died when he was 15 years old. This forced him to move from his home in the eastern part of the country to the western part. He started by working on people’s farms where he was looking after the goats. Because of his trustworthiness, he was given five goats as gifts which laid a foundation for his success. He has looked after these goats and they multiplied to become over 30 goats which he used to marry and acquire land for his banana plantation. He has also managed to construct a house and now he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to finish the construction of the tank.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Filasso Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FILASSO ont en moyenne 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments et des céréales.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FILASSO sont à leur 6ème prêt solidaire. DIAHARA, 2ème femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100Kgs de mil, 100Kgs de fonio, 100Kgs d’haricot, 70Kgs d’arachide et 200Kgs de riz. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Filasso group are on average 43 years old with five children, and all live in traditional extended families in Kimparana / Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali).

These women know each other through kinship ties and are traders of condiments and cereals. Having correctly reimbursed their previous loans, the women in the Filasso group are on their sixth group loan.

Diahara, the second woman from left to right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 100 kilos of millet, 100 kilos of fonio, 100 kilos of beans, 70 kilos of groundnuts and 200 kilos of rice. She gets her supplies from local wholesalers, and conducts her sales to both men and women customers, for cash and often on credit.

She expects average monthly profits of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be used to cover health-related expenses, food, clothing and school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy agricultural products

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe MIRIYA ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à MEDINE l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente du poisson et des produits divers.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe MIRIYA sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire. KADIA, 1ère  femme debout à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20Litres d’huile, 2 paquets de Cube Maggi, 50Kgs de sucre, 15Kgs de lait en poudre, 5 boîtes de lait concentré, 1 carton de vinaigre, 1 carton de savon et 1 carton de bonbon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Miriya group are on average 35 years old with four children, and all live in traditional extended families in Medine, one of the districts in San/Segou (fourth administrative region of Mali).

These women know each other through kinship ties and are traders of fish and various products. Having correctly reimbursed their previous loans, the women in the Miriya group are on their third group loan.

Kadia, the first woman standing on the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 20 liters of cooking oil, 2 packages of Maggi cubes, 50 kilos of sugar, 15 kilos of powdered milk, five cans of condensed milk, one case of vinegar, one case of soap and one case of sweets.

She resupplies with local wholesalers, and conducts her sales to both men and women customers, for cash and often on credit.

She expects average monthly profits of 30,000 CFA francs, which will be used to cover health-related expenses, food, clothing and school fees. The remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy various products

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with one child aged eight years old. She is a farmer and has been in this business for 14 years.

She will be using this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and boost her business.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her farming, make more income and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores podrán conocer su situación de vida e ir mejorándola.
Una de las integrantes que se destaca es la Sra. Primitiva, una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada, que ha tenido que pasar por muchas privaciones, y es eso justamente lo que la motiva a luchar, para que su familia no tenga que pasar por ello. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que gustan mucho a sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para invertir en su emprendimiento de comidas, ya que necesita comprar verduras, condimentos, carne, y otros, para poder seguir  con la venta de sus comidas e ir mejorando cada día. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben que les permitirá mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
